story:
The Short of it:

Since I started shooting I've always dreamed about having creating a complete photo studio (see some of my work above).  Seeing as how I live in a loft in the middle of downtown San Diego, that studio will have to be in my living room.  I am offering prints in several sizes delivered to your doorstep, all the way up to a personal 2 hour photo shoot and image editing as rewards.  Please see the box to the right, I'm hooking people up who want to help out.


What I Need

Here's the deal, I've already spent a few thousand bucks on equipment and just got a big tax bill from the IRS which puts my project behind.  I shoot for the love of the art- not for money.  That said, studio lighting equipment is expensive and since I don't typically charge for my work I need your help to finish getting the rest of the gear needed to complete the studio.  It will also allow me to contribute more tutorials on lighting and photography techniques to http://mikenewton.com/category/blog/

Here is what I need:
$718= (2)- Alien Bee 1600 Flash Heads: $359/each (I need 2, I already bought one)
$198= (2)-13 ft. air cushioned light stands- $99/each (I need 2, I already bought one)
$26= (2) -carrying bags to hold the AB1600s- $13/each=
$299= (1)- Vagabond battery pack- now I can use on location!
$240= (2) Alien Bees strip boxes- $120/each
$149= (1) Alien Bees medium octobox
$119= (1) Alien Bees medium soft box
$138= (2) Alien Bees cyber sync's - $69 each (I need 2, I already bought 3)
$600= (2) Nikon SB-800 speed lights (used price on Craigslist) (I need 2, I already bought one)
$140= (2) light stands for SB-800's (I need 2, already bought 3)
$70= (1) boom arm
$129= (1) 28" Apollo soft box kit
$32= (4) sandbags- to keep the light stands grounded, I broke 2 umbrellas when the stands blew over last month.
$50= reflector arm/holder
$89= (1) 10'x20' Diamond Cloth black backdrop
$60= (1) white seamless paper roll (mine is almost too ripped to use, time for a replacement)

$3057= Total needed to finish up the studio (as well as be able to take it on location as well).

IF I HIT MY GOAL: I will do a good ole' Irish Jig and probably loose sleep by shooting photos until I pass out.  I will pick up all the gear on my list and complete the studio.

What You Get


Seeing as this project is photography related, I thought the rewards should be as well!  In addition to making my dream come true to have a studio in house, check out the panel to the right!  Need professional head shots for work?  Want to update your modeling portfolio?  Always wanted to do a classy boudoir/pinup photo shoot photos but never got around to it?  I am offering a 2 hour photo shoot and full editing of your top picks for $300 (must be in San Diego)- can be on location or in the studio. 

10 photo sessions booked= goal/studio completed,  20 photo sessions booked= much needed camera body upgrade as well.  People have asked me if I sell prints of my photos and the answer is typically no.  This will be one of the only times these prints will be available for sale, so if you like one, pick it up!

Click here to view my best photos of San Diego (all are available for print)
Click here to view all my photos on flickr (all are available for print)
Click here to view photos on Faceboook (all are available for print)

Other Ways You Can Help


Have you ever enjoyed stalking my facebook photos? Know of someone who has been talking about getting some photos done?  Just want to be an all around awesome person?   Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, etc. to reach those who would like to help out!  I'm a contributor to other Indie Gogo campaigns, and would appreciate your help spreading the word as well.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

-Mike Newton

story:
Summary

The time finally draws near for the completion of my third book! I want to first, and foremost, thank everyone that made this book possible. Through the Indiegogo contributions you made in October of 2014, I was able to take a two week journey through America's Southeast, and meet some of the most amazing people. It was one of the most nerve wracking, and most rewarding experiences of my life. Here I was, in a Prius, with a dream - hoping to get people to open up, let along photograph them. I came in with the question, "Who are these mysterious people, behind the fun at the fair?" What I found, was more complex. Rich history, family stories, smiles, laughs, and a sense of what the word 'carny' really means.

What I Need & What You Get

The total raised in this campaign, will ALL be applied towards the first print order run of this book. I am working with Blurb once again, and in trying to keep cost down, will need volume to make this the best book yet! This edition will be hardcover, and full of images both black and white, and full color. Included will be thoughts, quotes, and stories of the journey along the way. Blurb discounts orders for books when purchased in volume. The more I can pre-order, the more I can have printed to be on hand to sell to others. I would like to keep cost down to $25.00 per book, plus shipping. I need to pre-order at least 200 copies to keep the pricing down, as I am charged per book, and format. There will be different perks for amounts donated, but a minimum of $30.00 will be needed to secure a copy of the book.

What's Next

Once the book is ready, I will continue to try to find a literary agent and or publishing company to work with, so I can continue making these human interest pieces to engage the world in seeing itself in the faces and lives of strangers, on a wider scale. I have plenty more coming, and I will keep trying to bring these ideas to all of you!

Risks & Challenges

No matter the total raised, I will use all funds to order copies of the book. Indiegogo allows you to use funds, even if your full campaign is not met. The less books I order, the less I will have on hand, but you as a contributor will still receive your promised copy and any other perks listed for the amount donated. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't order a copy at this time, please share this link with friends and family. I appreciate your continued support for my projects, and wouldn't be able to do this without you. You are truly making dreams come true!

story:
My name is Toni Smailagic and I've dedicated more than a decade of my life to photography, and spent the past 3 years solely focused on documenting Jacksonville the way I saw and experienced it. From the street style at Downtown Jacksonville Art Walk, to the community organizers, mural installations, nightlife creators, activists, as well as the creators and creatives that put in work around the clock, making sure the city is more inclusive and yields more opportunities for future generations. 300 events later, and I knew the only way to wrap up the first two years would be through a book that highlights my favorite people, events, and development efforts.

Throughout the 264 pages of the 11 x 8.5in, hard-cover book you'll find quotes from 33 of the most influential & impactful people I met in the city within the 2016-2018 timeframe. I asked them to offer a quote or piece of advice to the next generation of movers and shakers coming up behind them. You'll find everyone from Mal Jones and Melissa Ross, to BeBe Deluxe and Jessica Santiago.  

This isn't just an introduction to Jacksonville and the vibrancy of the communities that I witnessed shaping the city, but a love letter to every person I met and photographed along the way. I made it my responsibility to document the overlooked beauty of the people in the city, and after a year of preparing for this release, I want to share it with you and make it a part of your collection. 

Why $15,000?

** All photoshoot / lesson perks must be local, or accommodate travel ** 

To get the book physically printed, a portion of the funds are required as a deposit. That's correct, this is just a portion to start the printing process! I spent almost a year editing the book down, getting quotes, color correcting, while continuing shooting new content for future releases. Hitting this goal guarantees you a copy of the printed book and allows you to get it at a $5 discounted rate before it's sold physically at $45. My gift to the community is ensuring that these memories are saved in a tangible form, and allowing future generations to take a glimpse into what living in Jacksonville in the midst of the new cultural boom really was. 

The campaign ends on October 13th, (30 days), and the book is set to go to print by November. The book release party will take place shortly thereafter where you'll be able to pick up the book, as well as meet some of the people who make cameos throughout it - oh, and dance, of course! 

About Me

story:
Let's step up, Austin.

If you're here, you probably know Jon Bolden. He's a nice guy. Moreover, he's a generous guy. An ace photographer who could (and does, in professional situations) charge a pretty penny for his services, but who has made a habit of offering those services to local performers and other creatives for free, or at hugely reduced prices.

Now, Jon needs our help.

Jon's trusty camera, after many years of service, finally conked out on him. Now, he needs a new one. Good cameras ain't cheap, friends. And not replacing it isn't an option; he depends on wedding shoots and other professional gigs to make a living.

So, in the spirit of the season, a humble proposal: If you have ever benefitted from Jon's photography gratis or at a super-reduced price (hint: if you paid less than a hundred, you got a honey of a deal), why not throw some cash his way?

story:
EDIT: The campaign is now closed. We didn't achieve the goal, but any funder received already the relative reward. I will complete the project in any case. In fact I will be in Italy on May, 2016 to give 2 street photography workshops. You can find any info here:

http://www.alexcoghe.com/roma-sp-workshop/

I wait you in Rome.
ITALIA, DOLCE VITA!!!


ITALIA, DOLCE VITA: a printed book documenting the lifestyle of Italians through the eyes of an Italian street photographer, currently based in Mexico.




Hey everyone, my name is Alex Coghe.  I am an Italian street photographer; I am currently based in Mexico.  After 3 years in 2013 I managed to return to Italy for a month.


During that time I started a photo project, titled ITALIA DOLCE VITA between street photography and documentary and this work has become something more than I could have ever expected.  I recently published the first part of this project with the clear intention to complete it when I will have the opportunity to come back in my hometown. To make this real I need your support and donations.

WHAT DESTINATIONS WILL HAVE YOUR DONATIONS IF I WILL ACHIEVE THE GOAL?

Achieving the goal will lead me to realize a printed  book, a series of e-books, special posts on my blog, and when in Italy conferences, workshops and an exhibition. There will be also the opportunity to meet me for those supported the project in Italy and I will insert them on my printed book.

  • A PRINTED BOOK
  • 2 FREE STREET PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOPS IN ROMA (ITALIA)*
  • 1 FREE STREET PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP IN FIRENZE (ITALIA)*
  • 1 FREE STREET PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP IN MILANO (ITALIA)*
  • A WEEKLY EDITION MAGAZINE "ITALIA, DOLCE VITA" PDF E-BOOK EDITION I WILL PROPOSE FOR ALL MY STAY IN ITALY
  • SEVERAL E-BOOKS CONTAINING SPECIAL PHOTOS FROM THE PROJECT, PRESENTED AS MINI-PROJECTS
  • A SPECIAL E-BOOK CONTAINING PHOTOS MADE IN ITALY FROM STREET PHOTOGRAPHERS, CURATED BY ME
  • A PERSONAL DIARY PUBLISHED THROUGH MY BLOG ABOUT THE EXPERIENCE IN ITALY, WITH CONTINOUS UPDATES
  • Accomodations and Travel expenses for me in Italy (the air travel Mexico-Italy-Mexico is very expensive)

*THE WORKSHOPS WILL BE FOR A MAXIMUM OF 5 ASSISTANTS EACH WITH THE CLASSIC FORMULA INCLUDING MY GUIDE TO STREET PHOTOGRAPHY, ILLIMITED FEEDBACK, PARTICIPATION CERTIFICATE AND PUBLISHING OPPORTUNITIES

WHAT IF I WILL NOT ACHIEVE THE GOAL?

I really would not want to take even consider this hypothesis, but in any case the project already exists and the perks that I thought for my funders are sent almost instantly (24h max.). There are perks as you can see with rewards that I can offer only when the goal is achieved, but to the deadline, depending by the result of the campaign, I considered alternative stuff to honor and thank the funder.

The formula is the Flexible Funding: this means in any case the money donated is mine. If we will be near to the goal I could think to make an effort and going to Italy in order to complete my project, clearly, with a lower budget and some programs will be reviewed, in any case any donor is sure of his reward.

If the donations collected will not allow to go in Italy the money will be invested to feed my other project here in Mexico dedicated to barrios.

Whatever will be the result the funders and me will be winners.







You can already download a special free e-book edition to get familiar with this project:

http://issuu.com/alexcoghe9/docs/italia_dolce_vita_free_ed/1

In fact I feel the first 100 photographs realized are just the start up of a project documenting Italy from a particular point of view. In the title I mention the golden age (1958-1964) in a style known throughout the world, LA DOLCE VITA, the sweet life of the famous Fellini movie with the unforgettable Marcello Mastroianni and Anita Ekberg, where it was evoked remarkably that indulgence typically Italian, that pleasure induced by eating well and dine a good wine, to enjoy staying at the table to talk, to crowd the beaches during the summer, maybe singing the last smash hit. In this project, aided by the physical distance from my country lasting three years, I want to document a country that basically has not changed too much in his research of being and living well, with food culture and art that permeates every level of Italian society, where even if you do not care much about Art and History you’ll anyway influenced because it is everywhere and permeates the lives of everyone who lives in the Old Boot.



The Italians know how to enjoy life despite the economic crisis, despite the political situation. So you can see them still there, at the bar in the morning to drink their coffee, maybe eating a croissant. You can see them come together in the streets, well-dressed with fine linen shirts and sunglasses, with a newspaper under their arm. A lifestyle that ends up to involve the many foreigners who flock to the peninsula, even just  as tourists. I wish that those who observe this project consisting, at the moment, of 100 photographs,  focus on the clothes and colors, on the details of each photograph because it is with this approach that I decided to photograph and present this project. Through the many color images I tried to tell my country, now that I see it inevitably with different eyes, although I am still absolutely and proudly Italian. Now even more than before.



I went back to review and edit these photographs only now. After two years of their creation, in May of 2013. I published the first part of this ongoing project on my official website and I created a facebook page dedicated to this project. I was surprised to dwell on some of these images because they appear  timeless in my eyes, like a slightly faded memory. Some photographs could be taken in the 70s or 80s and very little would change, I think. I want to think about this series of photographs as an open project, because I desire to return to continue to document my beloved Italy. Italia Dolce Vita.



This project wants to be not just a set of visually appealing images, but I see it as a vehicle and a means to further fund my goals to create a book with this work.  With the help of you guys, this can be the next step in the direction of coming back to my country to complete this project. Your contributions will enable the completion of this project, which wants to provide a unique perspective of an Italian, living far from his hometown, looking at Italy with a different vision. 

In supporting the completion of this project, you will not only be giving me the opportunity to feed ITALIA DOLCE VITA, but purchasing some interesting artistic opportunities for yourself. In fact my return to Italy will coincide with various opportunities for my funders, also to take a workshop with me or just a coffee. I thought to a social media site like Indiegogo,  because despite to be a professional photographer today is still hard and I can’t think to sustain a project like this without your help.



Currently this is the only way for me to come back to my hometown for almost a month, in order to complete this project: I need the money overall to cover the cost of accommodation and travel, reaching different places in Italy in order to document different territories and stories.This is why I'm asking for your contributions, whether you have five Euro to offer or fifty thousand.

The minimum Euro amount for the realization of this project has been set at Euro 10,000.  This amount of money will allow me to go in Italy , without worries and fears while completing my work for my fans. 

In support of my fans, I have created an awesome perks section, located on this page.  Look there to view the numerous perks in store for those who participate in this artistic endeavor.  There is something for everyone in this section, whether you are a friend, art lover, photographer, brand or just someone looking to help a photographer to complete this documentary project.



CHECK OUT THE PERKS

I prepared exciting perks for my funders. The great thing of this project in fact is that the project already exists and needs just to be completed. This means any funder will receive the rewards independently from the goal achievement To make it real I need your contributes. This can be through a donation or also just with spreding the word.



To those that will contribute: Thanks for your support.  I really mean that. This project is very important to me and I really hope we all together can reach the goal.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust.



What I Need & What You Get to reach the goal and make this possible


  • Until this point this entire project has been self-funded. I didn’t want to be influenced by corporate sponsors and I didn’t want to crowd finance without having work to show. I am asking for your help to finish the project. Your donations will go towards accommodations, travel costs, and general living expenses when in Italy. I am very passionate about this project because I feel to document what I love and what I know better so deeply appreciate your generosity towards completing what I hope will be an enduring documentation of a particular period in Italia’s history.
  • I thought about exciting rewards for my supporters, from personalized e-books and books to a whole day with me doing photo in a unique workshop in the streets. 
  • If I will no reach the goal the funds will go in any case to create a new photographic project in Mexico and I will reward in some way all my funders.
  • I need to stay in Italy at least a month to make my work, and I need the money that will go towards accommodations, travel costs, and general living expenses when in Italy. Just in this way I would be able to visit more places during the permanence in Italy.


Risks & Challenges

Frankly, the biggest challenge of this project is simply completing this project in order to offer something different for approach and vision: as a photographer I am focused on positive things, despite the many problems of everyday life . As a street and documentary photographer I want to document my hometown, from a special point of view, that of a man no longer living in his country.

As a photographer, my main challenge is the next picture! As a commercial photographer working on assignment I have the skills to work under pressure and I know how to make a fantastic photographic work.

The project already exists and the fulfillment of this is less of a challenge, as the rewards are chosen from images and services that already exist, and i can offer immediately to the funder. If you make a donation to the project, what you see is what you will get: this means there is no danger of a reward not being produced.

When everything is finally defined because we have achieved there will be brands with me during the time of realization of this project in Italy.

OTHER THINGS CAN HAPPEN WHEN IN ITALY

If I will reach the goal there will be other side events I will make. In particular:

- Free Workshops in Rome, Florence, Milan;

- Meetings and conferences;

- An exhibition;


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Its a dream come true to this project. Words cannot describe how excited I am for the opportunity to back in Italy to complete the project and give on your hands this book.

  • Please share this video, promote it, talk about it, tell your mom, dad, aunt, grandma, grandpa, or anyone who might share this, or buy it!!!

  • Indiegogo has a share button! Now Go share it!

  • If you need more info about the project or you are interested to meet me when in Italy, contact me at alex@alexcoghe.com

  • To see some social links click below.

  • I am perfectly aware not anyone can send money, but sharing the project and spreading the word is a great way to support me!!!

On the web:

https://www.facebook.com/italiadolcevitaproject

http://www.alexcoghe.com/italia-dolce-vita/

http://italiadolcevitaproject.tumblr.com/


THE PHOTOGRAPHER

Alex Coghe is an Italian established editor and photographer currently based in Mexico City whose professional activity ranges from photojournalism to fashion photography. Internationally recognized for his street photography he worked on assignment for Leica Camera AG in 2013 for “People of Chapultepec” a photo story published on the Leica X catalog distributed worldwide. Currently he is documenting "life in the barrio", showing the daily life in popular neighborhoods of Mexico City, and his most recent work published has been ITALIA, DOLCE VITA: 100 photographs between Rome, Florence and Turin dedicated to his documentation of Italians and their lifestyle, always filtered by his vision as a street photographer.  He already has many books published along with prestigious collaborations and important exhibitions in the Los Angeles and Miami (US), Roma, La Spezia, Viterbo (Italy), Hamburg (Germany) and Barcelona (Spain). As a publisher and editor he started this year The Street Photographer Notebook, a monthly edition pdf ebook magazine. He is also a photo trainer giving workshops in three different languages on his own but also for institutes and at the University of Communication in Mexico City. Recently Alex has become X Photographer for Fujifilm.

I wait you in Rome. ITALIA, DOLCE VITA!!!


ITALIA, DOLCE VITA: a printed book documenting the lifestyle of Italians through the eyes of an Italian street photographer, currently based in Mexico. 








Hey everyone, my name is Alex Coghe.  I am an Italian street 
photographer; I am currently based in Mexico.  After 3 years in 2013 I 
managed to return to Italy for a month.
During that time I started a 
photo project, titled ITALIA DOLCE VITA between street photography and 
documentary and this work has become something more than I could have 
ever expected.  I recently published the first part of this project with
 the clear intention to complete it when I will have the opportunity to 
come back in my hometown. To make this real I need your support and donations.
WHAT DESTINATIONS WILL HAVE YOUR DONATIONS IF I WILL ACHIEVE THE GOAL?
Achieving the goal will lead me to realize a printed  book, a series 
of e-books, special posts on my blog, and when in Italy conferences, 
workshops and an exhibition. There will be also the opportunity to meet 
me for those supported the project in Italy and I will insert them on my
 printed book.

A PRINTED BOOK

2 FREE STREET PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOPS IN ROMA (ITALIA)*
1 FREE STREET PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP IN FIRENZE (ITALIA)*
1 FREE STREET PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP IN MILANO (ITALIA)*
A WEEKLY EDITION MAGAZINE "ITALIA, DOLCE VITA" PDF E-BOOK EDITION I WILL PROPOSE FOR ALL MY STAY IN ITALY 

SEVERAL E-BOOKS CONTAINING SPECIAL PHOTOS FROM THE PROJECT, PRESENTED AS MINI-PROJECTS

A SPECIAL E-BOOK CONTAINING PHOTOS MADE IN ITALY FROM STREET PHOTOGRAPHERS, CURATED BY ME
A PERSONAL DIARY PUBLISHED THROUGH MY BLOG ABOUT THE EXPERIENCE IN ITALY, WITH CONTINOUS UPDATES

Accomodations and Travel expenses for me in Italy (the air travel Mexico-Italy-Mexico is very expensive)


*THE WORKSHOPS WILL BE FOR A MAXIMUM OF 5 ASSISTANTS EACH WITH THE CLASSIC FORMULA INCLUDING MY GUIDE TO STREET PHOTOGRAPHY, ILLIMITED FEEDBACK, PARTICIPATION CERTIFICATE AND PUBLISHING OPPORTUNITIES

WHAT IF I WILL NOT ACHIEVE THE GOAL?
I really would not want to take even consider this hypothesis, but in any case the project already exists and the perks that I thought for my funders are sent almost instantly (24h max.). There are perks as you can see with rewards that I can offer only when the goal is achieved, but to the deadline, depending by the result of the campaign, I considered alternative stuff to honor and thank the funder.
The formula is the Flexible Funding: this means in any case the money donated is mine. If we will be near to the goal I could think to make an effort and going to Italy in order to complete my project, clearly, with a lower budget and some programs will be reviewed, in any case any donor is sure of his reward. 
If the donations collected will not allow to go in Italy the money will be invested to feed my other project here in Mexico dedicated to barrios.
Whatever will be the result the funders and me will be winners.


You can already download a special free e-book edition to get familiar with this project:http://issuu.com/alexcoghe9/docs/italia_dolce_vita_free_ed/1In fact I feel the first 100 photographs 
realized are just the start up of a project documenting Italy from a 
particular point of view. In the title I mention the golden age 
(1958-1964) in a style known throughout the world, LA DOLCE VITA, the 
sweet life of the famous Fellini movie with the unforgettable Marcello 
Mastroianni and Anita Ekberg, where it was evoked remarkably that 
indulgence typically Italian, that pleasure induced by eating well and 
dine a good wine, to enjoy staying at the table to talk, to crowd the 
beaches during the summer, maybe singing the last smash hit. In this 
project, aided by the physical distance from my country lasting three 
years, I want to document a country that basically has not changed too 
much in his research of being and living well, with food culture and art
 that permeates every level of Italian society, where even if you do not
 care much about Art and History you’ll anyway influenced because it is 
everywhere and permeates the lives of everyone who lives in the Old 
Boot.
The Italians know how to enjoy life despite the economic 
crisis, despite the political situation. So you can see them still 
there, at the bar in the morning to drink their coffee, maybe eating a 
croissant. You can see them come together in the streets, well-dressed 
with fine linen shirts and sunglasses, with a newspaper under their arm.
 A lifestyle that ends up to involve the many foreigners who flock to 
the peninsula, even just  as tourists. I wish that those who observe 
this project consisting, at the moment, of 100 photographs,  focus on the 
clothes and colors, on the details of each photograph because it is with
 this approach that I decided to photograph and present this project. 
Through the many color images I tried to tell my country, now that I see
 it inevitably with different eyes, although I am still absolutely and 
proudly Italian. Now even more than before.I went back 
to review and edit these photographs only now. After two years of their 
creation, in May of 2013. I published the first part of this ongoing project on my official website and I created a facebook page dedicated to this project. I was surprised to dwell
 on some of these images because they appear  timeless in my eyes, like a
 slightly faded memory. Some photographs could be taken in the 70s or 
80s and very little would change, I think. I want to think about this 
series of photographs as an open project, because I desire to return to 
continue to document my beloved Italy. Italia Dolce Vita.
This 
project wants to be not just a set of visually appealing images, but I 
see it as a vehicle and a means to further fund my goals to create a 
book with this work.  With the help of you guys, this can be the next 
step in the direction of coming back to my country to complete this 
project. Your contributions will enable the completion of this project, 
which wants to provide a unique perspective of an Italian, living far 
from his hometown, looking at Italy with a different vision.  In 
supporting the completion of this project, you will not only be giving 
me the opportunity to feed ITALIA DOLCE VITA, but purchasing some 
interesting artistic opportunities for yourself. In fact my return to 
Italy will coincide with various opportunities for my funders, also to 
take a workshop with me or just a coffee. I thought to a social 
media site like Indiegogo,  because despite to be a professional 
photographer today is still hard and I can’t think to sustain a project 
like this without your help. 
Currently this is the only way for me to 
come back to my hometown for almost a month, in order to complete this 
project: I need the money overall to cover the cost of accommodation and
 travel, reaching different places in Italy in order to document 
different territories and stories.This is why I'm asking for your contributions, whether you have five Euro to offer or fifty thousand. The
 minimum Euro amount for the realization of this project has been set at
 Euro 10,000.  This amount of money will allow me to go in Italy , 
without worries and fears while completing my work for my fans.  In 
support of my fans, I have created an awesome perks section, located on 
this page.  Look there to view the numerous perks in store for those who
 participate in this artistic endeavor.  There is something for everyone
 in this section, whether you are a friend, art lover, photographer, 
brand or just someone looking to help a photographer to complete this 
documentary project. 
CHECK OUT THE PERKSI 
prepared exciting perks for my funders. The great thing of this project 
in fact is that the project already exists and needs just to be 
completed. This means any funder will receive the rewards independently from the goal achievement To make it real I need your contributes. This can be through a donation or also just with spreding the word.
To those that will contribute: Thanks for 
your support.  I really mean that. This project is very important to me 
and I really hope we all together can reach the goal.Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. 



  What I Need & What You Get to reach the goal and make this possible
   Until this point this entire project has been self-funded. I didn’t want
 to be influenced by corporate sponsors and I didn’t want to crowd 
finance without having work to show. 

I am asking for your help to finish the project. Your donations will go 
towards accommodations, travel costs, and general living expenses when in Italy. 

I am very passionate about this project because I feel to document what I love and what I know better so deeply appreciate your 
generosity towards completing what I hope will be an enduring 
documentation of a particular period in Italia’s history.


I thought about exciting rewards for my supporters, from personalized e-books and books to a whole day with me doing photo in a unique workshop in the streets.  
If I will no reach the goal the funds will go in any case to create a new photographic project in Mexico and I will reward in some way all my funders.
I need to stay in Italy at least a month to make my work, and I need the money that 
will go towards accommodations, travel costs, and general living 
expenses when in Italy. Just in this way I would be able to visit more places during the 
permanence in Italy.    


  Risks & Challenges
Frankly, the biggest challenge of this project is simply completing this project in order to offer something different for approach and vision: as a photographer I am focused on positive things, despite the many problems of everyday life . As a street and documentary photographer I want to document my hometown, from a special point of view, that of a man no longer living in his country.
As a photographer, my main challenge is the next picture! As a commercial photographer working on assignment I have the skills to work under pressure and I know how to make a fantastic photographic work.
The project already exists and the fulfillment of this is less of a challenge, as the rewards 
are chosen from images and services that already exist, and i can offer immediately to the funder. If you make a donation 
to the project, what you see is what you will get: this means there is no danger of
 a reward not being produced. 
When everything is finally defined because we have achieved there will be brands with me during the time of realization of this project in Italy.
OTHER THINGS CAN HAPPEN WHEN IN ITALY
If I will reach the goal there will be other side events I will make. In particular:
- Free Workshops in Rome, Florence, Milan;
- Meetings and conferences;
- An exhibition;
Other Ways You Can Help 
 

Its a dream come true to this project. Words cannot describe 
how excited I am for the opportunity to back in Italy to complete the project and give on your hands this book.
Please share this video, promote it, talk about it, tell your 
mom, dad, aunt, grandma, grandpa, or anyone who might share this, or buy
 it!!!
Indiegogo has a share button! Now Go share it!
If you need more info about the project or you are interested to meet me when in Italy, contact me at alex@alexcoghe.com

To see some social links click below.

I am perfectly aware not anyone can send money, but sharing the project and spreading the word is a great way to support me!!!

  On the web:https://www.facebook.com/italiadolcevitaprojecthttp://www.alexcoghe.com/italia-dolce-vita/http://italiadolcevitaproject.tumblr.com/THE PHOTOGRAPHERAlex Coghe is an Italian established editor and photographer currently based in Mexico City whose professional activity ranges from photojournalism to fashion photography. Internationally recognized for his street photography he worked on assignment for Leica Camera AG in 2013 for “People of Chapultepec” a photo story published on the Leica X catalog distributed worldwide. Currently he is documenting "life in the barrio", showing the daily life in popular neighborhoods of Mexico City, and his most recent work published has been ITALIA, DOLCE VITA: 100 photographs between Rome, Florence and Turin dedicated to his documentation of Italians and their lifestyle, always filtered by his vision as a street photographer.  He already has many books published along with prestigious collaborations and important exhibitions in the Los Angeles and Miami (US), Roma, La Spezia, Viterbo (Italy), Hamburg (Germany) and Barcelona (Spain). As a publisher and editor he started this year The Street Photographer Notebook, a monthly edition pdf ebook magazine. He is also a photo trainer giving workshops in three different languages on his own but also for institutes and at the University of Communication in Mexico City. Recently Alex has become X Photographer for Fujifilm.

story:
OUR HISTORY

Three years ago we started Settentrionale Sicula with a strong belief in the necessity of independent and free investigation journalism in Sicily. Since then we are going on struggling criminality, corruption, mafia, with the idea to provide our area, Eastern Sicily, with an independent publication that shed light on social and political issues through good old-fashioned story telling.

During this time our staff has grown from a handful of brave and crazy people to a thriving volunteer staff. Settentrionale Sicula is a labor of love for each of us.  It costs a lot to print our seasonal issues, as well as pay for our working/meeting space and keep the public events we organize every month going on running. That's where you can help us keep Settentrionale Sicula alive, giving us the possibility to grow and supporting indipendent journalism in Sicily.

Here you can find our blog: http://settentrionalesicula.blogspot.com

and our magazines: http://issuu.com/settentrionalesicula/docs

THE POWER OF LOCAL INVESTIGATION JOURNALISM

To build an independent journalist voice in Sicily is something extremely difficult. Our territory is dramatically tied to an historical culture of silence, something that every sicilian perceives as an inescapable fact. Our presence, our work, made a little change in our area during the last 3 years. We had to defend ourselves against threats, attacks, insults, but we showed to the people that it is possible to build something different, that is possible to make a change. We have become a reference point for all the people that feel to react to the mafia culture in Western Sicily, thanks to our reports but also thanks to the events that we organize every month in every little village around the city of Messina.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Settentrionale Sicula is asking for your financial support to mantain, expand and develop our investigation journalism, to reach and involve more people.
We're focusing on three specific goals right now:

1. To gain exposure and let become our work more visible we want to renovate our online space, creating an official website that will work together with our blog.

- To build our new platform we´ll need to ask to a professional webmaster, so this would cost around $2.500 and $3.000

2. We decided to realize a videodocumentary about the buildings confiscated to Mafia all around Sicily. The documentary will show the conditions of neglect of these buildings (apartments, villas, old factories, farms, agricultural lands), managed by the local institutions and completely forgotten. We think these properties should be renovated and than delivered to sicilian people in order to increase the possibilities to use public spaces and give a strong signal against criminality.
The documentary will be realized, for free, by Mauro Mondello and Nunzio Gringeri with the cooperation of the Settentrionale Sicula team. Mauro Mondello, 30 years old, is a free lance journalist, director of Settentrionale Sicula, with a long experience as a correspondent from South America and Middle East. Nunzio Gringeri, 31 years old, Settentrionale Sicula art director, is a videomaker and student at the Italian Experimental Centre of Cinematography. In 2012 Mauro e Nunzio realized "Stateless", http://vimeo.com/51201940, a documentary about the dramatic daily life of thousands of migrants fled from Lybia after the rebellion against Gheddafi. Stateless has been screened in many festival around Europe.

- To realize the documentary we´ll need to consider equipments, editing and production costs, that will be around $4.500 and $5.000

3. We´ve been thinking about the possibility to establish an investigation training center with our editorial staff. The idea is to involve as many people as possibile in our project through training courses in radiojournalism, videojournalism and reporting. The training courses will be held, for free, by qualified member of Messina University and Settentrionale Sicula members.

- To go on with the training center project we´ll need to cover equipment and running costs for $3.000

All levels of donations come with a gift to show our vast appreciation, listed on the right hand side of this page. Every dollar counts. And please help us spread the word!

 

How can I help if I don't have much to give?

Share our IndieGoGo project on social networks - We also have accounts on Facebook and YouTube!

Offer ideas - We are always looking for like-minded individuals and organizations to collaborate with. Please write us at settentrionalesicula@gmail.com with any thoughts or suggestions!

story:
Short Summary

Napier Photo Collective involves fourth year photography students from Edinburgh Napier University who, every year, come together to plan an ambitious exhibition as part of the Free Range festival in London.

Now that this academic year has come to an end, we will take our graduate work to exhibit in London at The Free Range Graduate Art and Design exhibition, the largest of its kind, where universities from all across the United Kingdom will showcase their work. Throughout June and July, this space is host to graduates from creative degrees and, from the 21st to the 25th June 2018, we will display our work alongside other photography graduates from across the country. Free Range holds invaluable networking and exposure opportunities for both ourselves as individuals, as well as a group collectively representing Edinburgh Napier University.
The work that will be exhibited at Free Range will offer a variety of stylistic approaches that represent the members of the collective, as well as the university as a whole, at the highest possible standard.

The funds raised during this campaign will be used to finance the production and transportation of our exhibition.

 

The Photographers:

 

Cirstyn Brown - https://cirstynbrown.com/

Lara Cappelli - http://www.laracappelli.com/

Oliver Forde - https://oliverforde.com/

Egle Kisieliute - http://www.eglekisieliute.com/

Agata Kozlowska - https://akozlowska.com/

Katariina Leinonen - http://katariinaleinonen.com/

Cameron MacDonald - https://cameronmacdonaldimaging.com/

Sandi Beth Macdonald-Haig - http://ruadhimages.format.com/

Laura Prieto - https://www.lauraprietophotography.com/

Calum Rafferty - https://www.calumrafferty.com/

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Despite having launched an Indiegogo campaign earlier this year which raised over £1000, we are still struggling to make ends meet. The money we have raised so far has helped us with costs towards production, accommodation and refreshments for the opening night. This art business doesn't come cheap though!

Our goal with this new campaign is to raise £600 to cover the cost of hiring a van to transport our work down to London, as well as producing high quality catalogues to offer our audience at Free Range. 

 

We are extremely grateful for all the financial help we have already received, and we really hope you'll be able to help us a little more to make this adventure of ours work! 

To help us achieve our goal, we have come up with a number of different juicy perks that you can choose from. We'd love to give something back to you and make you a part of the exhibition, so we are offering a number of prints from the work we will be exhibiting in London (see gallery at the top), as well as the catalogue of the exhibition itself! 

If amazing perks just don't do it for you, don't worry! You can also pick any other amount to donate to our cause - all help given is greatly appreciated!

 

Other Ways You Can Help
 

In addition to any financial support, you can also help support our campaign by spreading the word about the amazing work we've produced. Follow us on Facebook and Instagram, share our posts and Indiegogo page!

https://www.facebook.com/napiercollective/

https://www.instagram.com/napiercollective/

story:
What is "Serenity of the Smokies"

"Serenity of the Smokies" (formerly called Spirit of the Smokies) is a passion project for artist Willy Adkins. Adkins was inspired by his life long love of the Smoky's and after a few years of park research and planning, he began the project in 2006 with the ultimate goal of publishing a coffee table photo book featuring the natural beauty of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park. Since beginning the project, it has now grown to include a feature length DVD and also a soundtrack CD both featuring original music by Dc McAuliffe (www.dcmcauliffe.com).

What We Need To Finish This Project

Still needed to complete the Book/Movie/Soundtrack:

  • 1 trips back to the national park (I'm located in Illinois) this November to finish off Photo & Video including Black Bear, Elk, and Autumn color scenes.  (This obviously involves costs in travel, my largest expense in this project and equipment rentals).
  • Book proofing, editing (as I hope to include inspirational quotes and/or information about the Smokies) and printing (hardcovers don't come cheap).
  • For the movie, post production software, original music score, DVD menu design (and software), physical DVD copies and two hard drives.
  • For the soundtrack album, original music, jewel case design, physical CD copies.
  • And of course marketing and advertising of all the various media types.

The Impact

As the creator of this nearly decade long passion project that has been inspired by a life long love for the natural beauty and serenity of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park, seeing this all come together into a finished product will be a joy comparable to welcoming a new child to the family.  The creation of this project has brought me peace within the surroundings and my entire purpose is that feeling with all of you through various media.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute?  No worries!  You can help in other ways!

  • SHARE this campaign page with friends and family!  By spreading the word, they might be able to contribute and even if they can't, they might share it to someone who can.  At the same time, you are helping spread the word and build awareness of what we are doing.. Word of mouth marketing is the best!
  • PARTNER WITH WILLY ON A TRIP!  That's right, make contact with Willy privately about possibly joining him on his November 2013 travel back to the Smoky's as he finishes up.  Spiting costs makes this all so much easier, gives him some company and lets you too experience the natural beauty of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park first hand! (this does involve some hiking and is out amongst wildlife, just an early caution).
  • VISIT, LIKE AND OFFER POSITIVE WORDS on our facebook fan page (linked below)! Then share it with your friends!  Several of the earliest images shot for this project can be seen there!

THANK YOU!

Thank you for taking the time to even peek at this page!  This entire project is about natural beauty, positive thinking and serenity.  I hope that you will be a part of something so beautiful!  ~ Willy Adkins

A photo I took of my father Kenny Adkins during my last travel to The Smoky's at Abrams Falls.  It was a 5 mile hike to get there and probably the last time he will ever attempt to do anything like that again.  This photo certainly carries much value to him and I both.

And of course marketing and advertising of all the various media types.





The Impact
As the creator of this nearly decade long passion project that has been inspired by a life long love for the natural beauty and serenity of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park, seeing this all come together into a finished product will be a joy comparable to welcoming a new child to the family.  The creation of this project has brought me peace within the surroundings and my entire purpose is that feeling with all of you through various media.




Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute?  No worries!  You can help in other ways!

SHARE this campaign page with friends and family!  By spreading the word, they might be able to contribute and even if they can't, they might share it to someone who can.  At the same time, you are helping spread the word and build awareness of what we are doing.. Word of mouth marketing is the best!
PARTNER WITH WILLY ON A TRIP!  That's right, make contact with Willy privately about possibly joining him on his November 2013 travel back to the Smoky's as he finishes up.  Spiting costs makes this all so much easier, gives him some company and lets you too experience the natural beauty of The Great Smoky Mountains National Park first hand! (this does involve some hiking and is out amongst wildlife, just an early caution).
VISIT, LIKE AND OFFER POSITIVE WORDS on our facebook fan page (linked below)! Then share it with your friends!  Several of the earliest images shot for this project can be seen there!


THANK YOU!
Thank you for taking the time to even peek at this page!  This entire project is about natural beauty, positive thinking and serenity.  I hope that you will be a part of something so beautiful!  ~ Willy Adkins

A photo I took of my father Kenny Adkins during my last travel to The Smoky's at Abrams Falls.  It was a 5 mile hike to get there and probably the last time he will ever attempt to do anything like that again.  This photo certainly carries much value to him and I both.

story:
• I'm a photographer from Zagreb, Croatia, passionate about black&white photography. 
  • More about my work at http://kresimirkopcic.zenfolio.com and kresimirkopcic.com 
  • This is my first book of photographs

 

  • The target funds is 2500 € to cover all the costs of book production and promotion
  • The book will contain 128 photographs and texts in Croatian and English

  • Hard cover 22 x 21,5 cm

  • Offset print / 170 g/m² paper

  • 400 copies

  • The publisher is Kadar36, which already has experience in publishing some top Croatian photographers http://www.kadar36.hr/knjige

story:
Short Summary

In April, I made the decision to take my photography hobby and turn it into a career. It has been by far one of the best and most challenging decisions I have ever made. I had never really photographed people until this year as my focus was always on wildlife and landscape. I never dreamed just how rewarding and humbling it would be to work with people in this way. Capturing the love and those big moments that we experience is one of the most important things in life. These images last a lifetime and show us new things about ourselves and they can help us remember what once was.

I've got a great start, but I can tell that I need to continue to learn. I found out about Let's Go!! Workshop via some photographers I follow on Instagram and it seemed like the perfect fit. I'll be learning from industry experts on topics from posing to editing and more. And here's the big thing: I'll be capturing some styled shoots that will help strengthen my portfolio so that I can take things to the next level. My dream is to photograph intimate weddings, elopements, and destination weddings which is exactly what this workshop is geared toward. Plus, it's on the coast of Oregon so it's in basically the dreamiest spot ever and the results of the styled shoots are bound to be amazing! But this all comes at a price, one that's a little hard to afford as a freelance artist/single income family. 

That's where you come in! I've secured my spot in the workshop, but am looking for a way to help offset the cost by offering mini-sessions in exchange for donations.

What We Need & What You Get

There are perks to donating.

  • The cost of the workshop is $1500 and the ticket to PDX about $250. I'm trying to offset as much of this cost as possible, so the goal is to raise about $1750.
  • Been dreaming of getting some up-to-date family photos but not so thrilled by the idea of $350-600 for a session? Have an anniversary coming up that you'd like to document? Donations above $50 will receive mini-sessions in the local SD, OC, and Riverside county area. Donations above $100 will receive a full session in the area.
  • If I don't reach the full $1750, whatever I do raise will still go to helping offset the cost of the trip.

The Impact

This workshop will have a huge impact on my life and career. It may well be the thing that really gets things going for me! It'll certainly be a foot in the door for the destination/intimate wedding industry, and that's priceless. 

Links

Website: www.randikphotography.com

Workshop: http://www.letsgoworkshop.com

story:
*UPDATE*  Just to let everyone know, the book will be printed and shipped to all supporters, even if the final goal amount is not met.


I'm making a photography book about the Appalachian Trail.  This collection of photographs highlights the natural beauty and spirit of the trail, including those unique individuals who hike it.  To find out more information on the trail, please watch my video or visit the Appalachian Trail Conservancy website. 


All funds will go directly to the production costs of making the book.  This includes printing, binding and packaging.  Shipping will begin summer, 2012. For a sneak peak at the book, please visit my website.


There are a few different levels of perks being offered, but this essentially is a way for you to pre-order the book.  Please note that shipping to the USA and Canada is included in the price.


Also available, is a very limited edition, handmade version of the book, signed, printed and bound  by yours truly.  Each book will have 1 of 5 different images transferred to the cover via Polaroid Emulsion lift.  Contact me for more details.


Special thanks to Michael Plater Findlay for allowing me to use his beautiful song, "A Sunday Interlude".

 


The 5 images available as prints or digital wallpaper.


#1

 

#2

 

#3

 

#4

 

#5

story:
Our Story

Charles was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis (MS) in May, 2003. For several years he has been the MS patient who no one knew he had any neurological issues, especially MS. He walked on his own, he was active, he ran his own photography business and, taught figure skating to kids a couple days a week. In June of 2011, things drastically changed. (for him). He started noticing that the shins on his right leg were numb. He just took it as part of his MS letting him know it was there. Soon he began tripping and falling a lot--which was unlike him. His doctors diagnosed him with a symptom of MS called Drop Foot. Drop foot occurs when the brain sends a signal to the nerves in the foot to lift up when people walk but the message never reaches the foot. It's very similar to a 'short' in electrical wiring. When the toes don't lift up, you trip and fall a lot. Charles' condition has progressed since then and he has had to stop working and stop teaching skating. He walks with a cane and despite the use of an Ankle Foot Orthotic (AFO) he still trips and falls 3-5 times a week. Because of these issues, he deals with a lot of spasticity in his legs where the muscles lock up and make moving very difficult and extremely painful. This is not a safe scenario for anyone at any age.

 

In December Charles' doctors wanted him to try a new electronic stimulation brace to see if it would be of any benefit. It's the Bioness Ness L300. Charles did a 10 day trial of the brace and the results were amazing. He was able to walk unassisted, no fatigue issues, no tripping, no falling and, no spasticity issues for the entire 10 days he used the brace.  He was able, for the first time in months, to get his life back! He was able to take hikes and, most of all, he was able to work, shoot images and not worry about tripping or falling. He was shooting more images in those ten days than he had in the previous 18 months. At the end of the trial period, he had to return this 'MAGICAL' brace which had done so much to help him.  He just fell right back where he had been prior to using the brace, a brace which had worked wonders. His doctors and physical therapist could not believe the improvement during the brief time he used the brace.

 

The doctors began the paperwork necessary to file with his insurance company, a company which denied the claim. Multiple doctors wrote letters of medical necessity; however, the company continues to deny the claim. The Bioness L300 has been on the market for well over five years and has FDA approval for MS patients who suffer from Drop Foot. The insurance company deems the brace as "experimental," thus providing them a 'way out' of covering its' cost of $6,500.00. A device which would allow Charles the independence necessary to return to work and become a productive member of society, all of which are key points for someone who is 35 years old and has two daughters, ages 15 and 8.

 

There are so many people who are milking the system and getting state and federal assistance.  Then you have someone like Charles who has a business he desperately wants to return to and become a productive member, not  just to his family but, to society as a whole.  This one device could give him back what Multiple Sclerosis has taken away in the recent months.  

The Impact

If enough money can be raised to purchase this device, it would give Charles his life and his independence back. He would be able to walk without constant fear of falling. It would also eliminate much of the spasticity he has in his legs. Charles would be able to go back to work and reopen the business he loves and be able to, once again, teach tomorrow's skaters. Inability to obtain this brace means none of this will be possible.

What We Need 

The Bioness L300 price is $6,500.00. Our ultimate goal is to raise enough to purchase a brace for Charles. Bioness also has a program by which patients can rent a brace for $600.00 per month and the monies spent on brace rental can be applied to the purchase price. We just need help with raising the funds to either begin renting a brace each month or to purchase the brace out right. It's time to allow people to become more cognizant of the fact that not everyone is as frigid as insurance companies. It's time to ban together and return Charles to his independence, get his creative jucies flowing so that more beautiful images may be created. To see first hand the types of work Charles is capable of go to www.crawfordimaging.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word! Spread the word on Linkedin, Google , Twitter, and Facebook. We need as much help as possible in order to let everyone know about this and help us reach our goal of raising $6,500.00. Got ideas that you think would help? Email Charles he would love to hear from you!charles@crawfordimaging.com

story:
My project aims to help ensure that the media and art world ‘discover’ my historic WTCsunsets photographs before the end of the 15th anniversary of 9/11.  Select any Perk here and you’ll soon get, as a bonus, my upcoming version 4 and ‘v5’ art postcards. 

Meanwhile, here’s a variation on my recent v2 card. I built four of these LED-backlit WTC Window Treatments for a show in Vegas this summer. They measure a mere 11 by 14 inches, and mistakes were made, so getting them put together nearly did me in.  The WTC 3 W.T. shown here is also available, in a quantity of one, as a Perk:

My WTCsunsets series was keep private for more than five years after the Twin Tower tragedy out of respect for its victims, and are the only images of their kind. The photo below has the appearance of a face within the ‘Angel Face’ in the cloud.  These faces were something that no-one around me noticed until years after I selected the 4 as my first postcard (v1):

It’s serendipitous that the building from which I took these photos is suddenly becoming famous. As noted above, the hot and highly respected new novel by Tim Murphy, “Christodora” is set in and titled after this 88-year-old brick skyscraper that towers over Manhattan’s entire Lower East Side from its park-side corner at 9th Street and Avenue B.

I have ambitious interlocking plans for promoting myself and my creative work over the next year. Luckily for me, circumstances have recently dictated that I become highly organized...

My 60 day plan calls for me to do one of the following every 10 days: either produce a new postcard or post new perks and/or a fresh video here. Meanwhile, here is my latest brand-new work, a4-ft.-wide hardwood construction of frames in a frame, titled “WTCsunsets Red, White & Blues." (It required that I drill 24 dowel holes almost precisely 3/8 inches deep, and gave me something to shoot for my v3 postcard.)

Use of funds: I’ll work to gain national recognition for the memorial WTCs through:

1. Entering art contests: Although I had become the most frequently selected artist in ArtJury.com competitions by 2011, and have since had WTCs up in five minor shows, I have yet to get represented by a major gallery or gotten art magazine (or any other) media coverage.

2. Developing novel art displays / constructs: I concocted the WTC Window Treatments (WTC WTs) this June for a month-long Emergency Arts show here in Vegas . They were my most-est cleverest art constructs to date.  And, as you've seen, I followed that up with my first-ever WTC WaLT (Wall Treatment), which actually went together without a single hitch. Thus re-invigorated, I may even now have a follow-up idea or two.

3. Getting into prestigious galleries and shows. Through a spring competition, I was selected to hang works in the secondary Spectrum section of the art world’s important Art Basel/Miami show this December. They have now accepted my proposal to hang a WTC Red White and Blue WaLT above a set of my wee W.T.s.

This could be great for me, and definitely expensive, but if the art world remains asleep at the switch this could be a necessary catalyst to making the WTCsunsets renowned. Meanwhile, those works are now hanging in the heart of our Art District, where they're owning their own freestanding wall.

4. Charity: Even though gallery commissions and taxes will take big bites out of sales, I will be donating 7% of all net proceeds to Doctors Without Borders or other institution or cause. Since I’m not only broke, but  launching this campaign before any sales from my major September art show (and now about $3,600 freshly down in card charges) I might donate the 3/5 print to NYC’s Engine Company # 10 and give myself a credit against that 7% vig. 

As for my current art show, here's the deal. Basically, I’ve got a 150 sq. ft. freestanding wall alongside a 250 sq. ft. lobby floor space leading into the doors of Jana’s Red Room.  That’s ground floor in The Arts Factory (aka 'Arf?'), where my WTC Wall will feature temporarily hung WTC Works on 9/10 (Jana’s annual by-invitation-only art party), during an afternoon reception on 9/11, and for an Industry+ closing party 9/19. 

On other times and days, I’ll just have my underlying ‘placeholder posters’ showing.

Then, in early October, I’m once again slated to show works in public. This time at the (Covered) ‘Bridges of Madison County’ show, in my Iowa birthplace (also John Wayne’s). The theme of the festival is Pioneer Days, so I plan to build an authentic-looking 10’ by 10’ Meyer’s Specific Store to show off some of my works. (Think rustic window frames with surprising window views out from within, frames-in-a-frame groups of same-site photos from my Missouri “Show Me Silos Series”,  etc.)  Regional news coverage would be likely because there is really, like, not all that much going on in nearby Des Moines.

I might also stage a pop-up art show in Kansas City on 11/11, WWI’s Armistice Day and the 10th anniversary of the day I unveiled the WTCs - although I’d rather be caught up in a massive online casting competition for up to 5 SeaBabe movie roles just then (see the Become a Movie Mogul perk here).  

Otherwise, that show, in the city where I grew up, would feature my cool patriotic Double Ought 7 (aka ‘007) Lib. Mem. photos. Captured in 2007, this series offers inspiring/cool images of our majestic National WWI Liberty Memorial.  Shown below, "007 Force" and the "Double Ought 7 Salute."

Meanwhile, my v3 postcard has been going out to about 330 of my contacts.

Lastly, the image below is of the WTC #2, and the # 3 of 5 prints is being offered here as a highly collectable perk.

Anyway, that’s about it from here if I ever want to get everything else for this campaign polished and uploaded sometime this century.  Under the Extras tab here, you can learn a lot more of the interesting backstory to the Christodora and its WTCs.

Anyway, that’s about it from here if I ever want to get everything else for this campaign polished and uploaded sometime this century.  Under the Extras tab here, you can learn a lot more of the interesting backstory to the Christodora and its WTCs.

story:
Hey guys, Austin here. 

(If you do donate, and are ok with it, please leave your email address in the info so I'm able to contact you- especially if you choose a "perk").

I need to get a new camera.

Starting a company from scratch is certainly no easy task. It takes the blood and tears of the business owner to make the dream a reality. A lot of hard work, time, dedication, and especially money are necessary to make it to the first anniversary. As everyone knows, new business owners are the last to be paid during the first years of any start-up because every extra dollar goes back into the company.

Accepting donations was a difficult decision, but here I am. I just figured, for probably the first time ever, I would reach out to you guys and see where we ended up. Regardless of the final amount donated, every cent donated here WILL go towards the purchase of a new camera- because that's my goal here. 

I know my goal amount seems high (because it is). Until about a year ago, I had no idea how expensive quality camera equipment was. A lot of the time, lenses are equally or more expensive than the body itself. With my slow growing passion for photography, and the long lifetime of most equipment of this sort, the prices make sense. This is also something I'll be able to use for my personal use, as that's something I'd also like to pursue in the future. 

Now that you know the why, here's the what. I've done a little research and have decided to go with the Canon 5D mark III(<-link). The body runs about $3500, and a good lens around $1500 (I haven't decided on an exact one yet since there are so many options). I'm currently using a Nikon D5100 (<-link) so this would be a big upgrade. It would also significantly increase the quality of our images. 

This could be a long process, or I could soon be taking even better photos for the site very soon. Either way, I think it goes without saying that any help isEXTREMELY appreciated. Regardless of the amount donated at the end, I will be thinking of something that I can do to thank everyone when the time comes. This is to assist in the development and growth of my business.

If you have any questions, I'm more than happy to answer anything at all. You can find me on my Twitter and Facebook. 

In advance, thank you all so much!

Austin

story:
Help Me Introduce Photography
to Underprivileged Children

Hello, my name is Tim Coburn. I'm a commercial photographer in Washington, DC. As part of my French immersion program in Cameroon, I will volunteer with The Humanity Exchange’s Youth Engagement project at a youth center that provides theater, dance, music, art, and other cultural opportunities for disadvantaged children. In addition to sharing my experience in theater and radio, I will create workshops to teach photography. I hope to instill a passion for the art form I love so much.

The youth center cannot provide equipment and supplies, so I’m relying on the generosity of my family, friends, and colleagues to help me raise money to purchase six Polaroid Instant Print Digital Cameras and a year’s supply of paper cartridges for the youth center kids to use in my photography workshops and after my six weeks in Cameroon.
                                            

How You Can Help

My volunteer site has limited technology infrastructure and unreliable electricity. In order to minimize the need for computers, printers, and electricity, I will use Polaroid Instant Print Digital Cameras. I need $3,652 to purchase six Polaroid Instant Print Digital Cameras and a year’s supply of paper cartridges so that the youth center can sustain the photography program after my volunteer term ends.

I am covering my own travel costs and the French immersion program fees. I’m staying with a host family whose hospitality I deeply appreciate—despite not having hot running water, reliable electricity, or internet access, which we all take for granted every day. I’m asking you to donate toward the purchase of cameras and paper cartridges so I can bring photography to the youth center.

Any amount raised over my goal will support the youth center or other local needs.

Besides my eternal gratitude, in exchange for your gift, you’ll receive email updates on my Cameroon experience and an invitation to a thank you reception at my studio after I return. For donations of $200 or more, you’ll receive an original Tim Coburn photograph of my Cameroon experience.

The Impact

I chose The Humanity Exchange specifically because it includes a volunteer component in its language program. I’ve studied French for the past year in preparation for this trip and I’m ready to put my skills to the test.

I can’t wait to introduce a new art form to children who have never experienced it before. With your help, by the time I leave Cameroon the children at the youth center will have a new way to express their hopes and fears, their joys and sorrows, and perhaps be inspired to embark on a career that can lift them out of poverty.


Please help spread the word about my campaign by sharing my request with friends and family. You can use the Indiegogo sharing tools to post on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media outlets.

Timeline

I leave for Africa on November 6th. I need to order the cameras and supplies by November 3rd in order to have them delivered before I leave. Please donate today!

Other Information

Because your support is a personal gift to me, not The Humanity Exchange, your gift is not tax deductible.

Despite extended planning, my clone wasn’t ready to run Tim Coburn Photography while I’m in Cameroon, so the business is closed during my volunteer assignment.

Thank you for supporting me!

story:
Hello!

     My name is Victoria ("Vico") Velez and I'm a 23 year old photography student and aspiring fashion, beauty and music photographer. My passion for this medium and my burning ambition have driven me out of my hometown of Mexico City, to the city of Los Angeles in order to pursuit a career in this field and an education. That same ambition led me to my idol's doorstep, where I now intern with one of the world's greatest photographers who fuels my inspiration every week. The same man I would admire from the age of thirteen, sitting at home, watching the Dirrty music video following Christina walking through fire, sweaty body builders and mud, with my jaw near the floor.

      One of the lessons I've learned in the passed six months of my photographic adventures, involving sexy ladies I've covered in all sorts of stuff (donuts, chocolate, flowers, water, jello, gold paint, glitter, snakes, fake snow, ice cream etc), and through experiencing a real life running professional studio is something that is pretty obvious to some, but slowly and painfully becoming more real to me: BUDGETS. I've realized how much the little things add up, and how much money my little creative mind has racked up in the passed months.

     My little brain has churned out an amazing idea for a photo shoot, that well, financially it can use some help. Here's what it came up with for my Valentines Day themed photoshoot:

Three to four beautiful bombshells, one hotel room. Pillow fight, rose baths, chocolate fountains, champagne, silk sheets, fog machine, glitter confetti, strawberries, heart balloons, lace lingerie, silk robes, body paint, glam hair and makeup, and a bunch of coffee and music to keep these people up long enough to get at least a good 10 different shots and scenes.

     You can see how that can add up, right?

Who is my team?

Photographer - Me, Vico. My web portfolio can be found here www.vicovelez.com
I work very well with very vibrant colors and contrast. I believe in returning women their sexuality, and pushing away the social studies term of "objectification of the female body". I believe in feminism as a sex positive woman. I believe in romance, and I believe in the beauty of sensuality. Women in the world of photography have been cornered in a gray area between "the male gaze" and "sex sells".  In my opinion, women should be free to explore and portray themselves however they choose, and if this particular model feels sexy in some lingerie and her own skin, I believe I am the right type of person to photograph that.



Hair and Makeup -  McKenzie Gregg, and her wonderful and extremely talented vision. You can find her makeup here: www.mckenziegregg.com



Models (as of now, we're still looking for two more perfect ladies)
Jess and Paige

   


What can we share in return?

    We can share behind the scenes photos, prints, video of the shoot, Valentines Day signed or unsigned greeting cards, and depending on how much reach our funding gets, we could even make prints on canvas. Every contributor will receive a link to the photos once this is done.


Here is some of my work for reference!

   

  

  




We would highly appreciate any and all support received for the funding of this photoshoot. We can't do this without you!

story:
Our Mission

Tumblr and Humans of New York are teaming up to raise money for the victims of Hurricane Sandy. For ten days beginning November 11th, we will be documenting and sharing the stories of those affected by the storm. We hope to show all sides of the story, featuring not only the victims of the storm but also the first responders and volunteers who are helping them recover. Hurricane Sandy revealed the power of nature, as well as the power of humanity. We aim to document both. By doing so, we hope to encourage YOU to contribute the relief efforts.

The purpose of this fundraiser is to collect donations. However, to spice things up a bit, Tumblr and HONY are teaming up to provide incentives and rewards for donating. Tumblr is throwing in some cool Tumblr gear, and HONY is providing prints and other goodies. We are covering these expenses ourselves so absolutely all money raised will be going to relief efforts.

Where the Money is Going

100% OF PROCEEDS will be going to the Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Foundation-- a highly respected, family-run charity which has been officially endorsed by many NYC officials. The money will immediately be used to provide much-needed resources to those areas hit hardest by the storm. Tunnel to Towers is very proud of the fact that no donations are being spent on overhead, and ALL hurricane funds are going directly to relief.
