story:
Inhabited: a clear view from the sky

Get an artist going! I have gallery space, I have the photos, the cards, the book is designed... It just needs to be printed!

Check this video to know more about me and my work: 

I have been flying since I can remember; a couple years ago I decided to bring together my passion for photography and my passion for flying; I took off on a solitary trip in the West Australian bush with my camera and paraglider. The product of this is "Inhabited : a clear view from the sky" which brings together flight, photography and reflection on our relationship to land and space.  

The images immediately received positive feedback and I decided to keep going with my undertaking. I have since won a couple of awards and have been exhibited in Europe and in Australia (Perth-Melbourne). 

I am now at a turning point where I am getting gallery space, and venues to sell my prints, cards, and my book. However, the costs to produce such an amount of prints and products such as books and cards are high. I need your help!!!

I am represented by Boranup Gallery (Margaret river area, WA) and I will be feature artist at Apsects in King's Park (Perth, WA) in October. I need products for both galleries! 

Why does the project matter other than for me being in the spotlight?

As Rebecca Solnit says: 

“Places matter. Their rules, their scale, their design include or exclude civil society, pedestrianism, equality, diversity (economic or otherwise), understanding of where water and garbage goes, consumption or conservation. They map our lives.” 

I am deeply interested in these questions which are primordial issues to be addressed in our challenging social and ecological times. I believe that the relative abstractedness and the change of viewpoint of my images trigger curiosity and subsequently reflection about the viewer's relationship to the content of the photo i.e. land. We don't all feel the same about places, a place might be source of comfort for some, while the same place may be a source of discomfort for others. This varies between individuals and between cultural groups. Gaining insight into how different people relate to land may possibly increase the variety of ways we deal with space and its resources rather than limit ourselves to one narrow perception. Let's widen our horizons by changing perspective and aknowledging other possible perceptions, and give ourselves a broad framework to define what it is we want for our country, our planet, our universe.

Set aside the contextual importance of the project, for me to be able to fly and to produce beautiful images that trigger reflection is a dream come true. 

Your contribution would both help an artist set up, and support a project which resonates with today's challenges.

 

What I need, what you get!

I need:

  • $6000 to produce 500 copies of my environmentally friendly book.
  • $500 to produce 600 environmentally friendly A5 cards.
  • $3000 for 6 large prints mounted on Aluminium (I funded the prints for the other gallery)
  • $5000 to produce the high end perks.
  • $580 for the 4% Indiegogo takes.

You get:

Top quality, beautiful visual products - for you, your friends, your family!

You might just want a few cards, or a copy of the book (we all love coffe table books, at least I do!), or you might want to get a striking art piece for your home - or a combination of both!!!

I am making an extended list of perks to make sure you can choose exactly what would suit you best! Feel free to contact me if you would like another combination of perks.

Check the gallery below to see which image(s) you like best:

 

The large format prints (30x45" and bigger) are limited series of 20 prints. The medium format prints (16x24") are limited series of 50 prints. You're not just buying photos, you're investing in art!

The cards and the ready-to-frame prints look amazing!

 

The book will simply look stunning, I just can't wait to see it finished!

 

How it looks when it's printed and hung!

 

Any amount would go a long way!

If I receive too little to reach my goal I'm still closer than I was to pay for the printing of the large formats and the printing of the book. Too much, and I can finance the print of more books and organise another trip to cover more landscapes and take the project further.

  • You've thought of being a patron of the arts before? Well here is your opportunity to support an artist set up for as little as $10! Or purchase your own limited series print or the book!
  • You would love to purchase a limited series print but you don't have the money right now? Contribute $10 now and get %10 off any print you might buy later on! Give me a little help now, get a discount later!
  • You're serious about our contemporary ecological challenges? Help me and my project share awareness of issues about interaction with land and resources.
  • I've already received great feedback, showing that the photos resonate with people and that the project needs to jump to another level. I believe in it, help me make it a reality.
  • The project is happening no matter what, I have invested pretty much all my time and money in this and will continue to do so in the future, a little help would however go a long way.

Other Ways You Can Help

You'd love to contribute, but you can't? SHARE MY CAMPAIGN ON THE NET!!!

use the indiegogo sharing tools!

Go to my website check the images first hand: www.gwenvelge.com

Go to my Facebook page and like it

Remember folks, whoever is first to give $300 or more to the campaign gets the perks, and the 1 of 20 limited series 30x40" print winner of the people's choice Award of the Consevation Council of WA's Environmental Art Awards, and finalist at the Brunswick Gallery "Picture this" photo competition!

THANKING YOU ALREADY FOR ANY HELP YOU MIGHT GIVE TO THIS PROJECT

use the indiegogo sharing tools!

story:
Hello!

First! About me! My name is Cara Nicole. I am also known as AZ Powergirl. I cosplay, edit comics, write and color art professionally. I am also the model for Magic: The Gathering's Emmara Tandris. 
Ok, gonna break this down real quick...Me, you, Photobook 2. Let's do this. Thirty-two pages of my cosplay extravaganza coming your way!  Stories, articles, even jokes fill this comic sized, action packed, photo book. 

What We Need & What You Get

**FUNDED and off to the printer!!*** Yes you can still get books and the other perks but NO ADVERTISING can be honored as this book has already been sent to the printer.
SO, I have been working very hard on getting 'Photobook: The Sequel' done and believeyoume IT IS DONE! And I thought long and hard and instead of just selling it, I concluded it would be awesome to offer it on IndieGoGo and give you, my loving fans, an opportunity to contribute and get some special goodies AND get a new audience to experience Cara Nicole AZ Powergirl! ALSO, it will allow me to offset-print a healthy amount of copies. My goal is 3,000 copies! Yup. Sounds to me like we all win!
So here is the detail of what the funds will be used for...
1) Printing and shipping to you.
2) Well, pretty much just number 1! There are no other production costs as I have this already completed!


The Impact

The benefits of funding this project are huge! The first Photobook was one of the first of its kind and it was wildly successful. I sold out of the first run the very first day and I reprinted 4 times. I want to go bigger! One of my biggest goals is championing cosplay and adding to its legitimacy as a valid art form. I feel that Photobook: Part Deux, with a wide audience, will help to advance this cause. 

As the proverb goes, you vote with your wallet. If you want cosplay, support it and more of it will come!

Risks & Challenges

I've taken on a substantial investment by curating images, building the book and finding good printing. This is on top of the time and effort of having built the costumes, shooting with the photographers and editing the images.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge at this time, you can definitely share this on social media like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, etc etc AND you can talk to your local comic book store about carrying it in their shelves.


MORTALS! BEHOLD!

This is the Thor print that goes with the Thor perk!


Canvas and Metal Print Perk

Canvas and Metal Print perk supporters! Any art and cosplay print in our store is available as a perk for this level (exclusives excluded). Please send me a message as to which you want to get!
See here for selection: http://183degree.storenvy.com/




GOAL MET!!!

Thanks to all who have been contributing! We are now at like 700% of the initial goal! Keep the love coming and keep sharing the Indiegogo! Thanks so much!!


STRETCH GOALS

Thanks for all the support and especially for all the shares! It means a lot to me. As you may be able to tell, I was more than willing to put my own money into this book so I set the goal low ($500) and we more than surpassed it. Now, the one thing that is really important to me is giving a bunch of these books a good home, SO I am setting some stretch goals. 

Without further stuff and things, here they are:

GOAL:  50 book perks claimed   REWARD: Everyone participating in those pledges receives a free comic book sized print of me as Bikini Black Cat (below)

UPDATE!!

We are at 50 contributions! So here we go. Added bonus! Comic sized PG pool pic to go along with my Black Cat pool pic. There is still time to get in on this deal. These prints are only available with this campaign.


GOAL: 100 book perks claimed   REWARD: I will make a video of me singing in a special new cosplay.

GOAL: 200 book perks claimed   REWARD: Adding Perk making a LIMITED amount of Photobook 1 available!

BONUS GOAL: $7000  REWARD: 10 never before seen high resolution digital downloads of my most popular cosplays to all who participate in the campaign.
story_txt:
Hello!
First! About me! My name is Cara Nicole. I am also known as AZ Powergirl. I cosplay, edit comics, write and color art professionally. I am also the model for Magic: The Gathering's Emmara Tandris. 
Ok, gonna break this down real quick...Me, you, Photobook 2. Let's do this. Thirty-two pages of my cosplay extravaganza coming your way!  Stories, articles, even jokes fill this comic sized, action packed, photo book.    What We Need & What You Get
**FUNDED and off to the printer!!*** Yes you can still get books and the other perks but NO ADVERTISING can be honored as this book has already been sent to the printer.
SO, I have been working very hard on getting 'Photobook: The Sequel' done and believeyoume IT IS DONE! And I thought long and hard and instead of just selling it, I concluded it would be awesome to offer it on IndieGoGo and give you, my loving fans, an opportunity to contribute and get some special goodies AND get a new audience to experience Cara Nicole AZ Powergirl! ALSO, it will allow me to offset-print a healthy amount of copies. My goal is 3,000 copies! Yup. Sounds to me like we all win!
So here is the detail of what the funds will be used for...
1) Printing and shipping to you.
2) Well, pretty much just number 1! There are no other production costs as I have this already completed!

story:
my name is olivia zabrocki.  i take photographs. 

photography is an art form. too many people take advantage of the fact that almost every cell phone has a beautiful digital camera and share their work daily, only to have it be seen a few times and forgotten about amidst all of their other newsfeed posts.  it seems that people have forgotten about how beautiful a photo is when you can hold it in your hands and truly cherish it in the way it’s meant to be loved and shared; not just through a computer screen.

over the past few years, i’ve been taking photos, not just to be “artsy” and “different,” but to truly capture a moment. that’s what photography is meant for, right? (you: right!)  i want to be able to share these photos with you in a way that not many people think to do; to have something tangible that you can pick up and view rather than breeze through a newsfeed.  

my little summer project, other than playing video games at a ridiculous length, is to self-publish a photo book for your viewing pleasure. pictures will range from shows i’ve attended, people i surround myself with on a daily basis, or beautiful sights i’ve encountered along my merry little way.  some of these photos you may have seen before; others have been locked away for my own private viewing; and here’s the kicker - some of them haven’t even been taken yet.  through your aid and donations, i can carry on and take photos just for this photo book to make it extremely special for the backers of this project. 

i want people to see that photography is something to be cherished and not taken advantage of. i can only hope to do that through bringing photographs to life in a tangible book that you can take on the go, leave on your coffee table, occasionally use as a coaster for your alcoholic beverages and/or tv dinners, or grab some inspiration for the day.  

the book will be approximately 50 pages (of course, there's always room for more), full color, and 6"x9". as for this moment in time, it will be a limited run of 100 copies (which can change in the blink of an eye if more people want a lovely little copy).

story:
You can still Pre-Purchase #SANDY at www.hashtagsandy.com


About The Book

#SANDY is a book of iPhone Photos by acclaimed photographers who captured the tragic devastation caused by Hurricane Sandy in New York City, New Jersey, and Connecticut. #SANDY will be published by Daylight Books in 2014 but when you purchase now, you will get an early copy in October 2013!

100% of the royalties from the book will be donated to Occupy Sandy to support the rebuilding efforts in New York City and the Sandy Storyline project.


PLUS, ALL NET PROCEEDS FROM OUR INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN WILL BE DONATED TO OCCUPY SANDY!!! 

 

The book is only available for purchase through our IndieGogo campaign and you will receive it by the first year anniversary of Hurricane Sandy in Late October 2013. If we do not meet our funding goal, the book will not be published.  

Featured photographers include Benjamin Lowy, Stephen Wilkes, Ed Kashi/Vll, Richard Renaldi, Hank Willis Thomas, Lyle Owerko, Wyatt Gallery, Ruddy Roye, Craig Wetherby, Andrew Quilty, 13th Witness, Michael Christopher Brown, Yosra El-Essawy, Erica Simone, Giles Clarke, Sam Horine, Stanley Lumax, Dylan Chandler, Brent Bartley, and Nicole Sweet.

This book is the first of it's kind to showcase the impact of the iPhone combined with Social Media to inspire others to make a difference while simultaneously reporting the news.

 

#SANDY EXHIBITION + PREVIOUS SUCCESS 

Following the success of our fundraising exhibition at FOLEY Gallery last November 2013 where we sold almost 400 photographs and donated $19,000 to Occupy Sandy and Third Wave Volunteers, we are now publishing this powerful 8x8" hardbound book to continue to raise awareness that people are still in need of assistance. The book will contain approximately 100 photographs.

 

About The Photographers

Each of these photographers has achieved substantial success in their career including numerous awards, grants, exhibitions, and major publications. They are some of the top documentary and fine-art photographers in the field today. Please visit www.hashtagsandy.com to learn more about these accomplished award-winning photographers. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to publish this first of it's kind book, we must raise at least $22,000 to pay for production costs like: Printing, Design, and Shipping. 

This is an amazing opportunity to 

  • Support Sandy rebuilding efforts
  • Raise awareness that people still need our help
  • Collect a powerful book of photographs by acclaimed photographers
  • Collect art at a fraction of the normal price
  • Attend the invite-only book signing event in NYC
  • Have dinner with some of these outstanding photographers 

Please visit the Image Gallery above to view the 15 Curated photos you can purchase.

 

The Impact

This book is important because it will remind the public that many people are still in need of assistance in order to rebuild their lives and homes.  Together, we can make a difference and be the change. 

 

FEEL GREAT by Being A Giver, Tweet, Post, Shout it out!

We invite you to at least give $10 to this campaign and also we'd love to encourage you to Tweet, Facebook post, Instagram, and email this campaign to your friends and followers. That is a BIG way to help! Use the share tools right here on the site.

 

 

Photo By Wyatt Gallery

 

 Photo by Benjamin Lowy

  

Photo by Benjamin Lowy

 

Photo By Lyle Owerko

 

 Photo by Ruddy Roye

 

 Photo By Hank Willis Thomas

 

 

 Photo By Benjamin Lowy

 

Photo by Ruddy Roye

 

Photo by Richard Renaldi

 

 

Photo by Craig Wetherby

story:
Hi, everyone! The Indiegogo campaign is over but  you can still purchase your special price book on www.cornelbrad.com, until 1st of September. Enjoy!

 “Interludes – in a photographic key”

by Cornel Brad

“Interludes” is a photography book with around seventy portraits of internationally venerated conductors, soloists and dancers together and many other pictures of members of the philharmonic orchestras and a modern dance company.


My name is Cornel Brad and I’m a photographer born and living in Bucharest, Romania. I worked as a bookseller, magazine editor and environmental project manager. In the last years I found that my deepest passions are photography, people and music. All these came together in 2013, when I was granted access behind the scenes of Romanian Athenaeum, Royal Palace Hall and Romanian Opera during the twenty-first edition of “George Enescu Festival”.

“Interludes” is a photographically composed score created between famous artists, between unforgettable shows, between emotions, with extraordinary music around. It is not yet revealed to the public, not even to its subjects.

“Interludes – in a photographic key” portrays Sir Neville Marriner, Marek Janowski, Murray Perahia, Antonio Pappano, Boris Berezovsky, Claire-Marie le Guay, Anika Vavic, Boris Brovtsyn, James Gaffigan, Christian Zacharias, Ottavio Dantone, Dimitry Sitkovetsky,Egils Silins, Emanuel Ax,Sakari Oramo, Louis Langree, Truls Mørk, Otomo Naoto, Jordi Savall, Semyon Bychkov, Katia & Marielle Labeque, Vladimir Jurowsky, Alexandra Dăriescu , Maxim Vengherov, Vadim Repin, Alina Bottez , Alissa Margulis, Amanda Forsyth, Pinchas Zukerman, Angela Cheng, Anders Hillborg, Andrew Litton, Evgeny Kissin, Fazil Say, Eric Halfvarson, Stephen Hough, Thomas Duis, Vlad Stănculeasa, Horia Andreescu, Enrique Mazzola, Iosif Ioan Prunner, Petra Lang, Sorin Coliban, Elisabeth Kulman, Cathrine Foster, Stefan Vinke, Valentin Vasiliu, Simina Ivan, Anita Hartig, Antonio Meneses, Michaela Kaune, Maria Jinga, Günther Groissböck, Daniela Denschlag, Irina Iordăchescu, James Judd, Jean-Claude Pennetier, Laurent Albrecht Breuninger, Julian Rachlin, Mariss Jansons, Lawrence Foster,Cristian Mandeal, Ioan Hollender, Claudia Martins, Rafael Carrico and members of Orchestra dell'Academia Nazionale di Santa Cecilia, London Philarmonic Orchestra, Orchestre National d'Ile-de-France, Corul Academic Radio, Lucerne Symphony Orchestra, Royal Philarmonic Orchestra, Orchestre de Chambre de Laussane, La Capella Reial de Catalunya, Russian National Orchestra, Saint Martin in the Fields, Die Munchener Philarmoniker, Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra Amsterdam, Royal Stockholm Philarmonic Orchestra and Vortice Dance Company.




A music coming from gods, a music starting on paper from black lines and dots to reveal a series of black and white photographs of strong or sensitive personalities and intangible oddities around a classical music show.

Objectives:

Printing 1.000 “Interludes”with aproximately 170 pages, page size 23/28 cm, high quality art paper, hardcover, English and Romanian version, with a cost of 12.000 euro.

Contributors will be rewarded for their support from the many offers available.

Purchase of a presale copy or any other offer from the perk list will help to fund the production cost of printing 1,000 books in this first limited edition. The goal amount however does not cover any of my costs for pre-productions, post-production work on the images, nor the hours of work that me and a couple of extraordinary friends have spent on graphic, video and sound  design,  editing the book and on its promotion.

If your eyes are more focused on e-books than in a classical browsing approach, you are invited to bid for an e-book version of “Interludes”.


How I will use the funds:

Printing the “Interludes”, the book seen in the video is now only a “blueprint of a score”, a mock-up.

The graphic and design of the book are finalized and ready to be printed using craft processes for binding and finishing in a classical printing house. I aim to keep the classical touch of the images given by my Leica camera. To ensure the quality of the printing, from start to finish, I will closely supervise the production of the book.

How I will use (hopefully) the extra-money:

Any funds exceeding the goal amount  will first be used to print a 30/45 cm artist signed portrait as a gift for each artist featured in the book, as many of the artists will return to Bucharest in 2015, for the 22nd edition of “George Enescu Festival”, and then to frame twenty pictures of 40/60cm for an exhibition held during 2015 festival (total of approximately 2,500 Euro). 5% of any extra-money will be donated to support the renovation of Enescu’s childhood home in Mihaileni, a place where Enescu loved to compose and where he found inspiration and relaxation. The rest of the money will be used to print more books. The box seen in the movie is optional.

Please join this crowd funding campaign for the opportunity to connect the worlds of music and photography and to produce “Interludes”!

Please spread the word!



Please e-mail “Interludes” campaign to a few people who love the artists and their music and would be interested in this book. As well, post this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Blog pages. Spreading the word is really important!

Please note: Prices for the book are discounted during the campaign. Please add 5 Euro for Bucharest, 10 Euro for rest of Romania,  20 Euro for Europe and 35 Euro for outside the Europe for postage and packing costs.

Thank you!

story:
The Idea

Help us tell the tale of 500,000 Edinburgh inhabitants, one human at a time.  We plan to turn our monumental virtual art exhibition into a physical reality.  

Humans of Edinburgh was started by Ollie Buchanan and Zishan Ashraf in January 2014.  The concept is gracefully simple: everyday we searching the streets of Edinburgh for one human, one photograph, one quote.

14,000+ likes and plenty of media coverage later, we want to bring the project to life.    From 1st - 25th August, we want to partner with just Festival to create a physical, outdoor photography display to bring the exhibition back to the streets which created it.

   

What We Need & What You Get


We need £600 to print 60 of our favourite Humans of Edinburgh photographs, and a few special unseen and behind the scenes photos.  This will also cover hanging materials and printed publicity costs.


Giving isn't a one-way street, so to say thank you our partner just Festival have some special perks for contributors.  Depending on how much you can contribute, you could receive:   

- personal invites to the Humans of Edinburgh exhibition Opening and Closing events  

- personal invites to the just Festival Launch, Opening and Closing events  

- a limited addition Humans of Edinburgh pin badge (UK postage only)

- two tickets for the fantastic just Festival Conversation of your choice taking place 4th - 22nd August 6.30pm - 7pm

- one ticket to see the amazing Simply Soweto Encha at just Festival between 1st - 25th August 8.30pm - 9.30pm

- your choice of one of the Humans of Edinburgh photographs printed A3 and framed for you to keep (UK postage only)

If we don't reach the goal of £600, we will still aim to create the exhibition, but on a smaller, simpler scale.

The Impact

In August, Edinburgh swells to almost double it's size.  With so many people rushing past to get to their next Festival show or scrambling home to avoid the crowds, Edinburgh can feel almost inhuman.  This exhibition will allow people to stop and get to know one another, face to face, one person at a time.  It is a chance to reconnect with the fellow human beings living around you, so they are not a nuisance, getting in the way, but an individual with hopes, worries, and story to share.     

The exhibition will be located outside St John's Church, Prince Street, Edinburgh;  the busiest spot in Edinburgh city centre with 1,343,456 people counted during August 2013 according to Essential Edinburgh.  So this exhibition has the potential to be seen by over 1 million people.  

We are working with just Festival, who have 14 years experience, to ensure that exhibition is run to deadlines, high quality and has the maximum impact.  

We are two recent University graduates with dreams of creating a fantastic photography exhibition in the heart of Edinburgh, sharing the lives of ordinary people.  We hope to make people stop for a moment and think about the humans who live, often silently alongside them.  However, we can't do this without your help.  Your contribution means everything to us and this project.  Lets create something amazing and celebrate humanity together, one tale at a time.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know times are tough and there is not always a lot of money to go around.  So there are other ways you can help.  

  • Do you know any printing companies who would be willing to help us decrease our costs?  
  • Do you know anyone who you think would like to contribute?  Then help us spread the word.  Shout about this campaign on Facebook, twitter or to your friends and family face to face.   
  • Most importantly, come and visit the exhibition and be part of the Humans of Edinburgh
story_txt:
The IdeaHelp us tell the tale of 500,000 Edinburgh inhabitants, one human at a time.  We plan to turn our monumental virtual art exhibition into a physical reality.  Humans of Edinburgh was started by Ollie Buchanan and Zishan Ashraf in January 2014.  The concept is gracefully simple: everyday we searching the streets of Edinburgh for one human, one photograph, one quote.14,000+ likes and plenty of media coverage later, we want to bring the project to life.    From 1st - 25th August, we want to partner with just Festival to create a physical, outdoor photography display to bring the exhibition back to the streets which created it.   What We Need & What You GetWe need £600 to print 60 of our favourite Humans of Edinburgh photographs, and a few special unseen and behind the scenes photos.  This will also cover hanging materials and printed publicity costs.Giving isn't a one-way street, so to say thank you our partner just Festival have some special perks for contributors.  Depending on how much you can contribute, you could receive:   - personal invites to the Humans of Edinburgh exhibition Opening and Closing events  - personal invites to the just Festival Launch, Opening and Closing events  - a limited addition Humans of Edinburgh pin badge (UK postage only)- two tickets for the fantastic just Festival Conversation of your choice taking place 4th - 22nd August 6.30pm - 7pm- one ticket to see the amazing Simply Soweto Encha at just Festival between 1st - 25th August 8.30pm - 9.30pm- your choice of one of the Humans of Edinburgh photographs printed A3 and framed for you to keep (UK postage only)If we don't reach the goal of £600, we will still aim to create the exhibition, but on a smaller, simpler scale.The ImpactIn August, Edinburgh swells to almost double it's size.  With so many people rushing past to get to their next Festival show or scrambling home to avoid the crowds, Edinburgh can feel almost inhuman.  This exhibition will allow people to stop and get to know one another, face to face, one person at a time.  It is a chance to reconnect with the fellow human beings living around you, so they are not a nuisance, getting in the way, but an individual with hopes, worries, and story to share.     The exhibition will be located outside St John's Church, Prince Street, Edinburgh;  the

story:
The Darkroom Project is a group of local photographers who love the look and feel of the film tradition, and luckily, has been given access to the historic Roy Studio darkroom in downtown Peterborough; Canada's longest continuously operating darkroom (1856-2010). We want to revive the historic darkroom, continue to operate it, and make it a world-class centre for the production of handmade images.

Part of the legacy of our space is that it was a family-run photography business for nearly a century, and the site where the Balsillie Collection of Roy Studio Images was created (an archival image collection of nearly half a million negatives and photographs documenting the City of Peterborough from 1896-1992, currently held by the Peterborough Museum and Archives).

A couple years ago the space was rented by an artist who converted the darkroom into a kitchen, but now we are using the darkroom again, and want to open it up to the whole community. Peterborough's last commercial public darkroom closed last year, and now there is no where for people to learn about and experiment with film photography production, outside of their own homes.

There are currently a dozen members interested in using and supporting the space. We've acquired several donations of equipment, and now we're asking for public support, to help us with our first year's operating costs, including maintaining donated equipment, and purchasing new items that expand the range of options we can offer to members. Right now we can develop prints from 35mm Black & White negatives, but we want to expand that to larger formats like 120, colour, experiment with historic processes like ambrotype and cyanotype, develop film, and offer classes in a range of formats and techniques. That's where your help comes in.

Supporting this project will directly support the maintenance and upkeep of a historic space, and will ensure that the tradition of handmade image making continues in Peterborough for future generations.

Here are a few things we'll be needing as we grow:

Right now we're set up for use but we want to make improvements... for instance, we need an Eye Wash Station and an ongoing supply of paper towels, for starters. Then we get into equipment, like a film drying locker, newscreening for our print drying racks, easels, paper cutters, developing trays in larger formats, negative carriers, and filters. We would also love to upgrade our electrical, put in a fume hood/ventilation system, purchase a negative scanner, install a spinning light proof door, register as a not for profit, and pay someone to create an amazing website that shares what we're doing with the public. We estimate that all that equipment, if bought, plus a year's rent on the space, will cost $21, 967.

We expect that we'll continue to recieve offers of donated equipment, as many people want their old darkrooms to go to good use instead of the landfill. But old equipment requires maintenance, and we can't count on getting everything we want from people's basements. We want to create a world-class site for film photography production in Peterborough, one that brings people here to participate in. That can happen with your help. Please share this campaign, please give, you'll be keeping a legacy alive.

Key terms: Photography, Living History, Fine Art, Film, Analog, Darkroom, National Treasure, Photo Tourism, Equipment Library, and Camera Museum.

story:
RYSQ is going to LA BIENNALE DI VENEZIA 2018

The purpose of this campaign is to support a large scale piece of  my artwork to be fabricated and shipped overseas .

Context: The ItsLiquid Group Exhibition entitled SPACES is located at Palazzo Ca'Zanardi in Venice, Italy. This gallery exhibit will be on display from September 28th - November 25th.

  • Being accepted into an exhibition of this caliber in the context of Biennale has been a dream of mine since starting RYSQ in 2005.
  • Since pursuing my Masters in Architecture at Tulane University, I made a promise that one day I would be able to experience the La Biennale Di Venezia too.
  • This 32 piece mosaic will be printed on in 4 x 4 sets on Concrete, Resin, Metal, Wood.
  • See the SQRYPT for Details.
  • Through the support of family and friends, this piece of art will truly be brought to life.

PEOPLE ARE PEOPLE OF PEOPLE

So essentially in order to make this happen. Let's be REAL. $

The SQRYPT mosaic goes from NYC to Ca'Zinardi Exhibition Space.

Material. $. Printing on a Flat Bed JFX printer that can print onf Concrete, Metal, Resin, Wood. Costs $. Packaging material. $. Expedited Shipping. $. Exhibition Fees for Marketing, Display, $.  We're sensing a theme here, right? It's adding up quickly. Estimating $1800 at this point.

The most critical part  is the Participation Fee. The original quote for the full size piece at 72x 72  = 1625 euros. By scaling down the size of the piece, the cost has dramatically been reduced to 800 euros which is approximately $926.60

If this is successful, then a piece of RYSQ is going from JFK to VCE.

CONTEXT BRINGS CONTENT

Over the years, those who have followed the growth of RYSQ, may have acquired a coaster, magnet, greeting card, postcard, mousepad, keychain, even some limited edition pins were in circulation. With every donation  to support this endeavor, expect a limited edition piece of RYSQ in return. See perks for details

LEARN TO LEARN

I have always taken calculated risks in my life, hence the reason i chose to cultivate the design collective of RYSQ over the years. RYSQ is inquistive with a Y & Q, not selfish with a I. There is a FIRST TIME for everything though and if something new and exciting falls into my lap, in this case an International Exhibition during the LA BIENNALE DI VENEZIA then I need to embrace this opportunity and will do whatever it takes to make it happen. 

IN THIS CASE. THE CALCULATED RISK I AM LOOKING TO TAKE ON IS ASKING FOR HELP AND BUILDING A PROPER BUDGET SO AS NOT TO GET CARRIED AWAY WITH MY IDEAS TO BUILD THIS PIECE OF SQRYPT IN TIME FOR THE EXHIBITION. 

PEOPLE ARE PEOPLE BECAUSE OF PEOPLE

  • Feel free to share this link with your SQuad.

If you made it this far. Thank you for reading. Constructive criticism is always welcome. So please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions, or suggestions.

story:
Hi, I’m Wes Lynch, creator of MyPictureDay. Having worked as a lead at the Boeing photo lab for 23 years—and doing youth sports photography on the side—I can see that with today’s smart phone it’s time to change the way we do picture day. I love photography and the precious memories that every photo holds, but it doesn’t need to be so expensive. In the photo lab, I provided prints that had a nice background, but what was missing was the ability to add personalized writings to the prints. To do so would be just too time consuming, which would impact the photo lab’s bottom line. 

With the MyPictureDay app that all changes. You get to make picture day happen in your own way. We help you compose your shot, create a photo package, and add your personalized writing and quotes. We do the prints and have them to you in about week. 

All we need to get up and running is the commercial grade printing equipment. Even though we’re smart with our money, these machine aren’t cheap! We plan to buy professional inkjet printers from Fuji. The dyes in inkjet prints can last up to 200 years, enabling your memories to endure for generations. Your contributions will help make this a reality. Imagine families saving money on their pictures,  especially when it’s already expensive to enter a child in a sports program. Registration fees, uniforms, equipment, and traveling to games—it adds up fast. Think of the families that never can afford to pay for the overpriced photography. With MyPictureDay, now they will! It’s time to disrupt the professional youth sports photography industry. You can help by contributing to this campaign. 

Our regular prices are as follows: $2.49 for 5x7, $4.49 for 8x10. However, by contributing to our campaign, you will enjoy these prices slashed by 51%. In turn, your contributions will help us purchase four Fujifilm Frontier-S DX100 photo printers, along with high quality photo paper and ink. These printers are simple to operate, which will allow us to adapt quickly to the needs of our growing customer base.

Reward time ;-) We want to thank you with big savings! At the time $25 level you get (10) 5x7 and (6) 8x10 prints. And as a continued thank you, you’ll get 5% off ALL future purchases. Use this at anytime. At the $50 level we double the offering with (20) 5x7 and (12) 8x10 prints. And we double the lifetime future discount as well, giving you a commendable 10% off all future purchases. And our Grand Slam level: A $100 donation will quadruple our initial offering, giving you (40!) 5x7 and (24) 8x10 prints. Of course, we’ve saved the biggest discount for last, coming in at a whopping 20% (I’d choose this one!) Don’t forget that each one of our rewards contains the same incredible benefit—lifetime use, unlimited number of orders.

What if we don’t get fully funded? We’ll buy as many printers as we can afford, and we’ll get right to work! We think our future is bright, and we’re always working hard to grow our business!

Our goal is to help parents capture lasting memories. Our mission statement says, “making positive and encouraging life memories.” Isn’t that what photography is all about? The templates we offer in our app encourage parents to write their personalized message to their children. We are making picture day something that will benefit your family for years to come. Partake in the movement, contribute today. And please spread the word to all your friends!

Our biggest challenge is that this could become big, fast. And keeping up with that much growth will be the real challenge. That’s one of the reasons we’ve chosen to use inkjet printers, due to their ease of setup and operational flexibility. 

If you can contribute right now, please do so! Also, please tell all your family and friends. We will need LOTS of help as we DISRUPT the professional youth sports photography industry.

story:
FOTON

We are a group of enthusiastic people, who share the same passion for photography.

Our main goal is to organise various photography related events such as outdoor and indoor photo sessions, lectures and trainings. We have been acting for a months now and we have been delighted with the positive impact so far. We have received growing interest in our local area.

Up to date we have organised many events which resulted in a collection of interesting photographs which can be viewed on our website and Facebook fanpage: 

www.fotonart.co.uk

What's the plan?

We are planning to organise an exhibition showing the creativity and talent of members of our group. The photos will show a great selection exploring Aberdeenshire and Scottish landscapes as well as human nature and much more.
This will take place in Aberdeen at
Newave Gallery
49 Castle Street
Aberdeen
AB11 5BB
8th Jan - 2nd Feb 2016
Monday-Saturday  10:00-17:00
We hope that the growing interest of FOTON coupled with the prestigious Gallery will attract a high number of guests.

What We Need

Organising such an extraordinary event involves a lot of organisational and financial effort from us, however we are a non-profit organisation and we need your support.

We would like to ask you to be a part of it. We believe that your support will conclude the preparation to an exhibition and the event itself will become a substantial contribution to the cultural development of Aberdeen and Scotland.

Get involved:

  • Like our funpage
    www.facebook.com/fotonartisticsociety
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Go to our web site and find out more about us. Feel free to join us!

Our aims

  • We hope to collect a full amount. We need it to cover all the cost:
    - Rent a gallery space (3 weeks)
    - Printing (A3)
    - Framing (passepartout)
    - Brochures
    - Photobook

  • In scenario when we collect more than we need we will keep the money in budget of Foton for the future events. 

  • All money earned from sale of our works will contribute to future development of the group (we are a legal non-profit organisation).

  • In the unlikely case when we don't manage to collect the full amount we are obligated to send all the Perks which we sold, undisputedly. However, we won't be able to print all of our works and we will have to meet many compromises, including the printing and framing quality, as well as the catering for the vernissage. The exhibition won't be as professional as we aspire to, it will be completely different and will have lower impact.

story:
7 pictures in 7 days. One week project, a creative photo competition in Hemsedal, Norway.

The best photographers within ski and snowboard in the northern scene get together to create an exhibition in 7 days. Every photographer will bring a team of three awesome skiers or snowboarders. They have 5 days to get the pictures they need, and on the 7th day it’s time to print and get it up on the wall. The competition and party begins.

One week project has been a huge success two years in a row, and we would love to continue this tradition. This is a nonprofit event hosted by Mari Söderholm, Kalle Hägglund and Anki Grøthe. All three of us are creativethat live and work in Hallingdal. Our vision is that OWP (one week project) exists to bring photography forward for the photographer and the viewers. 

And we are proud to say that this competition is not an online voting event. The cool part is that you get out there, attend the event, you have a good time with your friends and vote for your favorite picture.

----------

New this year is that we will have a jury of 3 fine photo experts to judge which photographer will win the OWP 2016. They will carefully examine all their work. Their ruling will be based on creativity, trick, composition, light, color, the story and of course the finished layout on the wall.

So we have both the jury that crowns the winner, on all 7 pictures. And the audience (you) crowns the best picture. There are two prizes this year!

-----------

What We Need & What You Get

The founding we need goes to three posts.

1.  Prints on kapa. This is the most expensive post. And until today the photographers have paid their own prints. New this year is that we would have them mounted on kapa plates. It will give the exhibition a long-lasting and nicer finish. 

2.  Payment to a jury. Behind all the fun and games. In the end there will be only one winner. To pick one winner out of 10 awesome photographers is not easy. That is why we want the best jury possible. A team of photo-experts and photo-editors with a lot of experience.

3.  Winner takes it all. We would love to send the winner home with a bag of not just great pictures and happy memories. But some well earned cash as well.

Help us make OWP the best it can be. Every krone/dollar matters. If you can’t support us with money. Please help us share this site to all your friends and family. Get the word out there. Hopefully we will reach our goal.

In return we offer the best event of the season. Free of cover charge for everyone that wants to join us. Write down OWP Hemsedal Café in your calendar on the 6th of February 2016. It’s been full house two years in a row now. With a kick-ass DJ, the dance floor will be hot, and you might even make a new friend under your favorites picture.

If for some reason you have something else to do on Saturday the 6th. The exhibition will be open everyday for a month.

If you can countribuate here on Indiegogo.com we will give back by a fun lottery for every contributor. Some lucky people will get a signed print in the mail from the OWP 2016 collection!

----------

http://cargocollective.com/oneweekproject

#OWPHemsedal

Thanks to Hemsedal Café for hosting the event.

Are you, or do you know a working or up and coming ski/skate/snowboard-photographer that would love to know more about entering OWP 2016? Please email us. 

ankigrothe@gmail.com

Photo Daniel Bernstål OWP 2016. Rider Ludvig Billtoft.

Photo Marius Svendsen OWP 2016. Rider Preben Loktu


photo by Anki Grothe OWP 2015. Rider Tobias Hjertonsson.

Photo by Martin I. Dalen. Rider Thomas L. Johannesen.

Photo by Troels Rosenkrantz.
story_txt:
7 pictures in 7 days. One week project, a creative photo
competition in Hemsedal, Norway.
The best photographers within ski and snowboard in the
northern scene get together to create an exhibition in 7 days. Every
photographer will bring a team of three awesome skiers or snowboarders. They
have 5 days to get the pictures they need, and on the 7th day
it’s time to print and get it up on the wall. The competition and party begins.
One week project has been a huge success two years in a row,
and we would love to continue this tradition. This is a nonprofit event hosted
by Mari Söderholm, Kalle Hägglund and Anki Grøthe. All three of us are creativethat live and work in Hallingdal. Our vision is
that OWP (one week project) exists to bring photography forward for the
photographer and the viewers. 
And we are proud to say that this competition is not an
online voting event. The cool part is that you get out there, attend the event,
you have a good time with your friends and vote for your favorite picture.----------
New this year is
that we will have a jury of 3 fine photo experts to judge which photographer will win the OWP 2016. They will carefully examine all their work. Their ruling
will be based on creativity, trick, composition, light, color, the story and of
course the finished layout on the wall.
So we have both the jury that crowns the winner, on all 7
pictures. And the audience (you) crowns the best picture. There are two prizes
this year! 
-----------
What We Need & What You Get
The founding we need goes to three posts.
1.  Prints
on kapa. This is the most expensive post. And until today the photographers
have paid their own prints. New this year is that we would have them mounted
on kapa plates. It will give the exhibition a long-lasting and nicer
finish. 
2.  Payment
to a jury. Behind all the fun and games. In the end there will be only one
winner. To pick one winner out of 10 awesome photographers is not easy. That is
why we want the best jury possible. A team of photo-experts and photo-editors
with a lot of experience.
3.  Winner
takes it all. We would love to send the winner home with a bag of not just
great pictures and happy memories. But some well earned cash as well.
Help us make OWP the best it can be. Every krone/dollar
matters. If you can’t support us with money. Please help us share this site to
all your friends and family. Get the word out there. Hopefully we will reach
our goal.
In return we offer the best event of the season. Free of
cover charge for everyone that wants to join us. Write down OWP Hemsedal Café
in your calendar on the 6th of
February 2016. It’s been full house two years in a row now. With a kick-ass DJ,
the dance floor will be hot, and you might even make a new friend under your
favorites picture. 
If for some reason you have something else to do on Saturday
the 6th. The exhibition will be open everyday for a month.
If you can countribuate here on Indiegogo.com we will give back
by a fun lottery for every contributor. Some lucky people will get a signed
print in the mail from the OWP 2016 collection! 
----------
http://cargocollective.com/oneweekproject#OWPHemsedal
Thanks to Hemsedal Café for hosting the event.

that would love to know more about entering OWP 2016? Please email us. 

ankigrothe@gmail.com

story:
Shutter Hub is a UK-based photography organisation providing opportunities, support and networking for creative photographers worldwide. We have around 1000 members and are regularly invited to partner with major organisations such as the London Art Fair, Format Photography Festival, World Photography Association and Foam Fotografiemuseum in Amsterdam. 

 

As part of London Photomonth 7 October – 1 November 2016 we held an exibition, Girl Town, celebrating the culture of the female in the 21st century, curated by Shutter Hub and the Old Girls Club and exhibited at St Margaret’s House in Bethnal Green. 

 

Girl Town came together through an open call promoted by Shutter Hub and The Old Girls Club, which invited participants to enter up to 5 images via Instagram using the hashtag #girltownPM and the images were captured and printed directly from Instagram, with support from Metro Imaging. Using social media in this way created opportunities for a wide range of photographers with varied practices to get involved (at no cost to them at all) and resulted in a diverse and challenging display.

 

The exhibition was hugely popular and very well received by thousands of viewers, and the acclaimed Whitechapel gallery featured it in their top 5 exhibitions to see that month. A series of talks, discussions and screenings were held throughout the duration of the exhibition and included speakers from The Guardian, Wall Street Journal, Photovoice and the Director of Photomonth East London.

 

We have been invited to show the "Girl Town"'exhibition at  Alfred Gallery in Tel Aviv for 1 month from 14 October, which is a fantastic opportunity for all the photographers involved as well as creating an exciting and important ongoing cultural exchange.

 

Our intention is for members of the Shutter Hub team (2 of us, volunteering, both females working in the photographic industry) to travel to Tel Aviv to install and launch the exhibition and document our experiences, for which we have had interest from national and international press.

 

Metro Imaging are generously providing prints of the images for display, but we are looking for support to cover travel, accommodation and basic supplies for the volunteers facilitating the exhibition installation and events in Tel Aviv.

 

We are asking for whatever we can raise to contribute towards covering these costs.

 

Complete financial breakdown, based on 2 volunteers :

 - Travel - flights: £1300

 - Travel - transfers etc.: £300

 - Air B&B: £600

 - Basic groceries: £100

 - Flyers/invites: £140

 - Exhibition sundries: £80

 - Private view: £250

 

If there are any additional funds after covering all essential costs we will put them towards further promotional materials for the exhibition and extending the reach of the project and discussion.

 

Everyone who has contributed and donated will be thanked on the Shutter Hub blog and on a printed list of supporters which will be displayed with the exhibition - please let us know if you would prefer to remain anonymous.

 

Due to technical difficulties this campaign was moved from BackHer to Indiegogo, but we will honour our commitment to donate $1 per $100 raised to the Rise Together Fund as promised in our original campaign.

 

Thank you for taking the time to read about our project - we do hope you might consider supporting us in this opportunity and would be grateful if you could share our campaign!

story:
What is Blackbox?

BlackBox is a two-week photography festival hosted by 85 B.A. students at Nottingham Trent University.

The Festival will comprise of a series of events which will begin on the 19th of May and end on the 6th of June. It aims to span over 16 venues throughout the city of Nottingham and marks the continuation of a unique tradition, which was started by the University in 1997.

Our work aim's to highlight the diverse quality of NTU's creative community and will act as a platform for young photographers to distinguish themselves in front of a multitude of industry recognised professionals. We hope that BlackBox will bring to Nottingham a celebration of art and culture that will reach and captivate a wide audience.

What we Need?

We are looking to raise an unfixed amount for the running of the show. The more we raise, the more we can achieve.

Funds raised will be used for:

·  Printing.

·  Framing.

·  Hosting.

·  Site management.

·  Administration.

·  Marketing.

·  Entertainment.

Please support our endeavour with an affordable contribution. Every donation no matter how big or small has the power to make a huge difference.

Follow our journey at:www.blackboxfestival.com

Or on:

FACEBOOK: www.facebook.com/blackboxfestival

INSTAGRAM: blackboxfestival

TWITTER: @blackboxntu

For more information please feel free to contact us directly at blackboxntu@gmail.com

Thank you for your time, we look forward to your support.

story:
PANORAMA

is a collection of horizontal and vertical panoramic film photographs created over twenty years by acclaimed photographer Seth Taras.


ABOUT THE ARTIST

Taras is most well-known for his brand campaign for the History Channel, KNOW WHERE YOU STAND, which has been translated into 30 languages and published in 130 countries. The campaign of four images has gone viral many times and is the subject of dozens of articles around the world:

'When Seth Taras juxtaposed ghostly black and white fragments of our past over snapshots of the present for his worldwide brand campaign Know Where You Stand for the History Channel, the mesmerizing works quickly brought him viral fame and various awards, including the Luezer’s Archive 200 Best Photographers Worldwide Prize. Rightfully so: he not only created a surreal narrative where time collapses, he also reminds us how history will always affect our present.'

'Furthermore, his mastery of the camera allows him to manipulate vertical and horizontal planes to depict urban landscapes, either brimming with life or deserted, but nonetheless animated by shadows and lights. Beautifully captured buildings, a black and white exciting First Kiss with a Cigar or a lone dog basking in a pool, whatever his subject, his stories are recognizable, yet almost dreamlike due to his nuances and subtlety.' - K.O. Jewel

In one of the the most popular article ever on artweekla.com, art critic, A. Moret, says of Taras' work, 'whether the subjects are opulent interiors, studies of found objects on the street, or candid and often times voyeuristic profiles of beautiful people basking in the comfort of their own flesh, the photographs resist ever feeling as though they are landscapes, portraits, or street scenes, but rather are connected by a common “strain” of the artist’s own fascination.' Read the article here: Urban Origami: An Investigation Into the Photographs of Seth Taras


Seth is one of Luerzer's Archive's 200 Best Photographers Worldwide and winner of numerous awards including a Cannes Lion, Silver Cube, Belding Bowl, Lucie Award, (2) Communication Arts Annuals, Millay Fellowship.

His pictures hang in collections around the world.

ABOUT THE BOOK: Taras will partner with Edition One, publisher of the finest independent art books on the market, to create a stunning color + b/w monograph with over 100 pages.

ABOUT THE PICTURES: All pictures are direct prints from original film with no digital alteration. There will be dozens of all new photographs in the book.

ABOUT THE PRINTS: Signed, Archival Pigment - (museum-grade, fine-art inkjet print made on premium paper with pigmented inks that offer a high-degree of longevity).

Taras oversees the scanning and printing of every image with ICON photo lab in Los Angeles, the best fine art printers on the West Coast. 


WHAT WE NEED

Nearly all of the images for the book have already been created so we only need production costs:

1. Hi-resolution drum scans: Every photograph in the collection is a direct print from original film with no digital alteration. But we do need impeccable scans to create amazing prints.

2. Printing: Initial book print run of 1,000 copies and museum prints.

3. Shipping.


What You Get

There are great perks to the campaign including signed copies of PANORAMA and limited edition museum prints up to 60".

Seth will continually add new items to perk tiers over the course of the campaign.

FAQs

Q: Why self-publish?

A: The ability to personally oversee every aspect of production and distribution.

Q: When will I get my perks?
A: Within 45 days of choosing your print.

Q: Do you ship anywhere in the world?
A: Yes! But ground shipping in the U.S. is free. International shipping is extra.

story:
Fourward

As students of the University of Central Florida's BS in photography program, we are putting together an exhibition that will showcase our thesis projects. The thesis is created over the length of our final semester at UCF, and can be seen as the culmination of our scholastic and artistic careers. The name "Fourward" comes from the number of students featured in the show: Alicia April Adams, Hannah Glogower, John Hilton, and Pedro Lopez. Couple that with the idea that we are moving on and forward. This is our chance to show our friends, family, and the rest of the world how much we have grown in our craft. We're asking you to be part of this adventure!

For more information:

www.fourwardshow.com

What We Need & What You Get

After much consideration, we have decided these are the funds necessary to make this exhibition a reality.

  • Entertainment & refreshments for opening night - $630
  • Framing, matting, hanging supplies - $600
  • Promotional materials & catalogue - $500
  • Miscellaneous - $270

The Impact

For most of us, this will be the first chance at exhibiting our artwork in a public forum. As artists we hold this as one of the highest accomplishments. Your contribution will not only impact the outcome of this show, but it will also push us forward into our careers as photographers and artists. Please join us for the exhibition opening on May 2, 2015 from 5-7pm.

Fourward is a one night only pop-up gallery in a renovated warehouse space in the Mills/50 neighborhood of Orlando, Florida. 

Located at:

1300 Brookhaven Drive

Orlando, FL 32803

story:
As a small town, self-taught photographer, I have always enjoyed telling stories through my work. Over the years, I have traveled across North and Central America documenting people, cultures, and history, collecting stories and life lessons along the way. But documentary photography is only one aspect of my work. Another, larger part is my work with models, portraying not just their beauty but also their personalities, working to convey the true essence of these women, presenting them as individuals and not just as pretty faces. Now I want to take all of the knowledge and skills I’ve accumulated and head to Europe. But to do that, I need your help.

With only my trusted friend Lola Agnosia coming along as a skilled and reliable assistant, the ultimate goal is not only to capture creative and beautiful images in some of the most magical locations in the world, but make a book offering a complete chronicle of our daily discoveries, hilarity, and setbacks that all trips of this kind involve. I've spent a lifetime studying European history and am clearly aware of the enormity of visiting and photographing these culturally rich areas. More importantly, after much work, back-scratching, and favor-calling, I have already arranged to work with several talented models in the areas we will be visiting.

SPONSORS-ONLY BLOG and PERKS

Every contributor at every level of donation will have access to the online day-to-day diary of the trip. This sponsors-only blog will include photos and videos documenting everything, from our preparations and behind-the-scenes events to finished images and even pages from my personal journal. As perks for your support I am offering everything I can, including signed prints, personal handmade photo booklets, life drawings I have done of some of my favorite models, your own personal photo shoot, and so much more. Look closely for the perks you like best!

 

BE A PART OF THIS JOURNEY

 

We can’t do this alone.

While we have been planning and saving our money for this trip for a long time, we are not there yet. However, we are not just asking for your support — we want to take you with us and we want you to be (and feel) involved. Not only are we offering some great and personal incentives, but we are hoping to keep an open discussion with our supporters throughout the entire trip. As we visit famous and historical landmarks and discover things no guide books could ever show, we hope to translate it for those of you who are unable to physically come with us. Do you have tips or a certain place along our path you think we should stop at? Tell us. We are more than open to suggestions and making your own personal desires come true. You will be able to ask questions, give advice, and comment on what we are doing via the sponsors-only blog. If you have ever wanted to explore Europe but have never had the freedom, you can do it with us!

Lola and I are both hard working, low-maintenance, and are used to roughing it and living simply, but we have many miles to cover. Most of the funding will go to actual travel costs as we move by plane, train, automobile, and occasionally boat across over 2500 miles of the European landscape, from London to Paris, Berlin to Prague, and finally to Rome. The closer we get to our final goal, the further we can travel and more places we can document. However, we are cutting costs in a variety of ways, from staying with friends along the way to blatant attempts at fasting, always limiting ourselves to only the bare essentials. The remaining funds will go into post-production of the book, including professional design, editing, and layout.

 

OTHER HELP

We realize times are tough. If you don’t think you can afford to financially help out, we completely understand, but there are other ways you can help: Please post this link on your Facebook and Twitter, as well as e-mail all your friends and family who you think might be interested in supporting us. Even the smallest donation will help us get closer to our goal.

Once again, your interest and involvement in this project is more appreciated than you could ever imagine. My photography started from nothing, from a dream in a small town where such dreams are rarely understood and often never realized. Thank you for taking the time to read all of this and get ready to come along with us for the journey of a lifetime!

My photography started from nothing, from a dream in a small town where such dreams are rarely understood and often never realized. Thank you for taking the time to read all of this and get ready to come along with us for the journey of a lifetime!

story:
Searching for Sero is a mental wellness project created by professional photographer, John Rathwell and writer, Tracy Guenard. Sero being short for serotonin – the chemical believed to contribute to the feeling of happiness. The photo project will share the stories of people who are passionate about outdoor adventure as the key to happiness, well-being and balance in their lives. We call them Sero Stories! 

THE PLAN

Spring 2016, John and Tracy embark across North-America in their 1991 Westfalia camper van to find and share the most inspiring Sero Stories. 

THE GOAL

We want to shine some light on mental wellness and suicide prevention. If we can motivate just one person to seek help and begin their journey down the road to recovery the project will be a success. Suicide has more than one victim. Friends and family also suffer when one chooses to take their own life. So let's talk about it. Let's make the changes we need in our lives to be mentally well.

Once the project has ended, a selection of our best stories and photos will be collected in a coffee table book in hopes that the conversation about mental wellness will continue on. Proceeds from book sales will be donated to mental health awareness and suicide prevention charities.

WHY WE ARE DOING IT?

  • Happiness: It's what our ultimate goal should be. But that goal often gets challenged by social norms for a stable career, wealth and consumerism. Let's get back to the basics and strive towards a life filled with well-being and mental heath. What better way to do this than to return to the outdoors to play again?
  • Community: Searching For Sero just isn't about the stories we are telling. It's about community and sharing all of your #FoundSero moments. What is a #FoundSero moment you ask? It's your happy place, rather it's on top a mountain, the edge of a waterfall or sleeping on dirt. Everyone has a happy place. What's yours?
  • A Movement: We don't want to make this just another road trip, we want to make Searching For Sero a movement! We want to motivate and inspire people and ourselves. We want to encourage and create. Help us start the movement and keep it rolling by sharing and reflecting on all your #FoundSero moments.

WHAT YOU WILL HELP CREATE?

  • Sero Stories: Every week, a new Sero Story will be published featuring an inspiring person who has enriched their life with sport and outdoor adventure completed with set of about 20 amazing photographs by John Rathwell. Take a look at the stories posted so far. 
  • Blog:  A weekly blog post will also be posted on the website. As we travel North-America and live the van life, we want to share our own experiences, both the good and bad. Blog post topics will touch on a variety of subjects: van life, adventures, guest posts, behind the scenes or creative collaborations. You can already read some here!
  • Social Media: We want to create enriching content on all forms of social media so fans can keep in touch with us throughout the entire project. Find and follow us on; Facebook, Instagram (@SearchingForSero), Snapchat (@Searching4Sero)  and Twitter (@Searching4Sero)
  • Newsletter: A monthly issue of our e-newsletter will be sent to subscribers and will be comprised of a recap of the best moments, stories and photos of the month. Don't miss a single moment, sign up here!
  • Français: Although this crowd funding campaign is in English only, our website and all its content is fully bilingual. Que votre langue de prédilection soit l'anglais ou le français, vous serez servi!

WHO ARE WE?

John Rathwell

John is an internationally published and acclaimed action sports photographer. He has been commissioned by Red Bull, Outside Magazine, and The Enthusiast Network over the last several years, just to name a few.

John’s motivation for this project came after his father passed away in 2014 from suicide. His father focused his life on working long hours, overtime and any shift he could take. John watched his father's lifestyle as he grew up and could see that life needed to be more balanced. Throughout the project, John is hoping to motivate people to put a little more focus on outdoor adventure and hobbies that bring happiness to their lives by sharing the stories and photographs of how others live theirs. 

Tracy Guenard

Tracy is a traditional 9 to 5 worker. She has years of experience working in criminology and youth intervention as well as business organizational analysis. People’s life choices and behaviours have always intrigued her.

Her interest in Searching for Sero comes from the desire to dig in and understand the human-being in the choices they make. She hopes to grasp these people’s relationship to happiness and how they can play an active role in their own mental wellness. What is worth living for? Life! Life is worth living for and Tracy wants to find out more about the inspiring stories of these people and their passions, share them, and prove that the feeling of amazement still exists.

Rain Dog

A road trip isn’t complete without a furry, four-legged friend. Rain is a beagle/lab mix with an obsession with playing fetch. I guess you could say, chasing tennis balls are her Sero moments.

Rain’s role on the trip is navigation and security. Her strong sense of smell should lead us in the right direction. We will also rely on her experience as a veteran traveler - this hound has already been across Canada and the U.S.A. on two separate journeys. Her ability to chase squirrels will also play a key part in the project… we just aren’t sure how yet.

If you get the chance to meet Rain, remember that if you toss the ball once, it will never end. She will play fetch forever and never seems to get tired.

The Van

When we decided to hit the road, we knew that there was only one van for the job, the Volkswagen Vanagon Westfalia Camper. Why a Westy? It offered us the best compromise to living space and fuel economy. We could never afford to fuel a big RV around North America, but we needed a little more living space than a Toyota Yaris. What we ended up with is a beautiful 1991 Westfalia. She has 360,000km on her, but the 2.1 litre engine has already been replaced. Top that off with new mechanical parts, rack system, solar system, a fresh paint job, lift kit, and all-terrain tires and it makes for a pretty ideal adventure mobile.

BUDGET

We need your help to hit the road. The van has already been purchased and we are working on the restoration (with the help of GoWesty and Diesel Rover). We just need you to put gas in the tank! 

Expenses So Far 

  • 1991 VW Westfalia: $9,600
  • Van repairs and Restorations: $10,500
  • SUB TOTAL: $20,100

Budget For The Road (One Year) 

  • Fuel: $10,000
  • Food (Human and Dog): $9,000
  • Van Repairs/Maintenance: $3,600
  • Camping Fees/Park Passes: $2,600
  • Insurance: $1,200
  • SUB TOTAL: $26,400

TOTAL FOR 2 YEARS PLUS EXPENSES SO FAR: $72,900

We realize that the cost of our project sounds ridiculously high, but it is the reality of what things cost these days. We will be living as frugal as possible on the road and we believe our planned budget is worst case scenario. Also, we know we will be investing a lot of our own savings into the project, and we are okay with that. We are not asking you to fund the entire budget, but anything helps and will be put to good use! If we do not meet our funding objective, we will still go forth with the project but on a reduced scale. We just need your help to make it epic!

PERK DETAILS 

Choose your perk by selecting it from the right hand column at the top of the page.

 

$10: One Inch Button

Want to show your support by wearing it around? Then this is the reward for you. We will send you a 1 inch round button with one of our favourite Instagram picture from @SearchingForSero on it or #FoundSero!

 

$20: Desktop and Mobile Background Packs

Who doesn't want fresh digital background for their desktop, mobile and tablet devices delivered straight to their email every month? With this perk, you will receive our best photos from the project sized perfectly for all your digital devices.

 

 $25: Die-cut Vinyl Sticker Pack

Two beautiful die-cut vinyl decals for your car. One "Searching For Sero" logo and one "#FoundSero" sticker. Each about 8 inches on the long edge in white

 

$30: 4x4 Instagram Print

At some point during the project, we will send you one of our favourite photos from the @SearchingForSero Instagram in a beautiful 4"x4" print with a hand written thank you note on the reverse. Stand it up on your desk, stick it to your fridge, pin it to your clipboard. The options are endless!

 

$50 - $60: The Supporter Pack(s)

Have you noticed we have 2 Supporter Packs that are the same thing? What is the difference? Well we are offering an awesome deal to our first 50 supporters so get it while you can and save yourself some serious coin!

 

$70: Donate A Tank of Gas

Just looking to support a rad project? Donate a tank of gas to Searching For Sero. Your $70 (approximate cost of a tank of gas) will get us about 450km in the Westfalia.

 

$100 - $250: Framed Prints

A sample of the framed print perk. Choose either 1 or 3, depending on how much wall space you have! Pick your favourite images from the @SearchingForSero Instagram feed. If you love an image we have already posted, you can choose it, or wait until we post one you love even more! The call is yours.

$500: 24 x 36 Canvas of your Choice

Instagram squares not your thing? Have a lot of wall space to fill with some awesome art that will get you motivated to get outside? How about an amazing 24x36 inch canvas? Choose any photo from one of our Sero Stories and we will make that happen. You can pick a photo from an existing story or wait until we post one you love even more! This perk will look very similar to the canvas pictured below, but with a photograph of your choice.
 

$750: 24x36 Dane Jackson Canvas

Score this very limited edition signed canvas print of 2015 World Freestyle Kayak Champion, Dane Jackson. This photograph was captured by John Rathwell during the Red Bull First Decent Michoacan project. The photograph shows Jackson dropping off Las Truchas Falls on the Alseseca River in Veracruz, Mexico.

 $1000 - $1750: Road Trips

Thinking about one of the road trip perks? Awesome! We are stoked you would like to take part in our adventure. Once you have chosen a place you want to visit and determined with us when we are going to be there, you just have to find a mean to make it there. We will pick you up at an airport or train station and host you in our Westy for a week. Because our adventure mobile sits and sleeps 4, we can also offer the week trip for two. It will be an authentic van life experience, space will be tight! Expect an adventurous week of camping, hiking, smiling, and any other activity possible in the area. You may even get to take part in creating a Sero Story! Please note that this perk does not include the transportation cost to and from the meeting location. 

 THE IMPACT

 Inspiration, because we hope that people who will follow our adventures and stories will be inspired to go out and create their own adventure.

Happiness, because we believe the adventures you go on will bring that to your life, just like it does for us and all our subjects.

Mental wellness and suicide prevention because we think prevention is the best way to ensure the health of your body, mind and soul, and that we can play an active role in our own mental wellness by going outside and doing what brings joy to our lives!

So go on, read our Sero Stories, share them, influence others to take that route, get out, play and tag your adventures with #FoundSero and be an Sero ambassador.

FEATURED ON

   

           

 

    

 

    


    

SPONSORS 

  

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Low on funds? How about giving our campaign a share?

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Follow us on Facebook: Searching For Sero
  • Like us on Instagram: @SearchingForSero
  • Keep up to date on Twitter: @searching4sero
  • Join in on the journey on Snapchat: searching4sero
  • Web: www.SearchingForSero.com
  • Email: Info@SearchingForSero.com
  • Hashtag: #FoundSero

 

Thank you so much for your donations.

— John Rathwell, Tracy Guenard, and RainDog

#FoundSero

story:
My name is jenny ariella laura ISHIMWE I study Clinical psychology at Université lumière de Buja classée parmi les 3 premières university in the country. Photography has always been my passion. Burundi has a lot and alot of things to show from lakes, 

there is also many water falls (shute) such as shute de Mwishanga, shute de Kagera etc which really many people haven't seen till today


local food

it looks like any other normal bar-b cue but hey come on taste it and u will feel the difference.



let not forget nice people


and some really happy happy happy ones


lets not forget amazing crocodiles...etc



What We Need & What You Get

 I need you contribution so that i could buy professional camera and in return I will mail you a special signed photo of anything that is available in Burundi. 

$800 will buy camera $200 will be the shipping plus tax.

$400 will buy Laptop which I will use to view and upload my pictures. $200 will be its shipping and tax.

you are free to ask any question anytime

The Impact

I want people to see exactly what we see here through an image. It might not be the same but this will give you an idea of where you are going once you plan you next trip to Burundi.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • you can use you word of mouth tell your freind about it for me that is contribution too
  •   use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all. Thanks for taking your time
