story:
About the book

Waves of immigration and its rich indigenous history make Toronto the most diverse city in the world. One big wave of immigration occurred directly after World War Two. Arriving on boats from all parts of Europe, people looked to escape devastation, poverty, and turmoil in a land with few conflicts and many opportunities.

Italian immigrants, like others from Ukraine, Poland, and many other countries, arrived in Toronto at this time and were quickly confronted by a city where customs, language, and climate were different than their own. St. Clair West was a place to seek refuge in the familiar. More specifically, Tre Mari Bakery on St. Clair at Dufferin, a business owned and operated by my family since the 1950s, became a place for people to hear Italian sounds, eat Italian foods, and feel the warmth of the country and people they left behind. As a fixture of the neighbourhood, the bakery is part of Toronto’s culinary and cultural history.

Souls of St. Clair tells the stories of people who have lived different lives, but who have shared this street and this bakery in common over the past half-century. Theirs are stories which must be captured now before they, and a part of this city’s rich history, are gone.

This book features the portraits and words of 10 men and 14 women, ranging in age from 75-96, all of Italian descent, and all members of the St. Clair West community. I want to showcase their fragility and strength, wisdom and doubt in equal measure. This book serves as both an archive and a celebration of Toronto and of Canada’s cultural diversity. Communities, places, and stories like the ones featured in this book made our city what it was, and have paved the way for what our city will be as we continue to welcome successive waves of immigrants to struggle, settle, and thrive.

 

What backers will receive

All backers of this project will receive a copy of Souls of St. Clair — a 60-page, hardcover, 10" X 10" photography book. The book features the portraits and words of 10 men and 14 women, ranging in age from 75-96, all of Italian descent, and all members of the St. Clair West community in Toronto.

Backers who choose to support this project at the $140-level will receive one 16" X 16" black & white print of their choice, in addition to the photography book. Backers can choose which print they would like to receive from any of the portraits that appear in the book.

Backers who choose to support this project at the $300-level will receive a 1-hour portrait session* with photographer Franco Deleo (me). This session includes 3 digital images and 1 printed image up to 16" (length or width).

(*Must be located in GTA. Must be scheduled within 180 days after purchase.)

 

About my work as a photographer

I have been a photographer for 13 years. I’ve always been drawn to portrait photography and especially black and white photographs. I was very inspired by Richard Avedon and Irving Penn’s celebrity portraits that attempt to distill the eternal from the transitory as well as Diane Arbus’ photography which does the same with everyday people, amplifying and capturing their pains and pleasures in one striking frame. My background in fashion photography is the reason you’ll see these subjects posed with props and stylized to engage the narrative potential of the image.

At the beginning stages of Souls I had to build trust with my subjects. That trust started in the bakery and by being a part of the Italian community. I understand the history and culture, I speak the language, I grew up in the neighbourhood. I am theirs just as they are mine. My family in a sense laid the foundation for trust when they founded Tre Mari. After getting to know my subjects, I asked them if I could photograph them in their homes. I figured if they feel comfortable allowing me into their personal spaces then they would be comfortable entering my studio space which is a short walk from our bakery. The studio setting is an important element for the project. The gray walls of the studio backdrop erase anything that would distract from the subjects' appearance, allowing the viewer to focus in on the uniqueness of their facial expressions, from the wrinkles in their faces, the fabric of their clothing, details on stitching, and especially important details of their hands, such as lines and callouses. Hands are one of the themes of this series. Hands have so much character and detail: they are as unique as a person's face.

I chose a square format to lay out the photographs—they are intentionally cropped squares so that I could play with the subject's position in a square frame. In some photos the subjects are positioned front and center so the viewer can focus on their strong facial expressions, hands, and eyes. In other photos the subjects are given breathing space, allowing the viewer to notice the subject’s clothing detail, animation and stance. I imagine the pages of the book to be printed with matte paper which has a soft, tactile quality that I believe showcases the black and white photos well. The images have texture and detail so I think it’s important that that paper mirror that quality, and echo the theme of hands.
story_txt: About the bookWaves of immigration and its rich indigenous history make Toronto the most diverse city in the world. One big wave of immigration occurred directly after World War Two. Arriving on boats from all parts of Europe, people looked to escape devastation, poverty, and turmoil in a land with few conflicts and many opportunities.Italian immigrants, like others from Ukraine, Poland, and many other countries, arrived in Toronto at this time and were quickly confronted by a city where customs, language, and climate were different than their own. St. Clair West was a place to seek refuge in the familiar. More specifically, Tre Mari Bakery on St. Clair at Dufferin, a business owned and operated by my family since the 1950s, became a place for people to hear Italian sounds, eat Italian foods, and feel the warmth of the country and people they left behind. As a fixture of the neighbourhood, the bakery is part of Toronto’s culinary and cultural history.Souls of St. Clair tells the stories of people who have lived different lives, but who have shared this street and this bakery in common over the past half-century. Theirs are stories which must be captured now before they, and a part of this city’s rich history, are gone.This book features the portraits and words of 10 men and 14 women, ranging in age from 75-96, all of Italian descent, and all members of the St. Clair West community. I want to showcase their fragility and strength, wisdom and doubt in equal measure. This book serves as both an archive and a celebration of Toronto and of Canada’s cultural diversity. Communities, places, and stories like the ones featured in this book made our city what it was, and have paved the way for what our city will be as we continue to welcome successive waves of immigrants to struggle, settle, and thrive. What backers will receiveAll backers of this project will receive a copy of Souls of St. Clair — a 60-page, hardcover, 10" X 10" photography book. The book features the portraits and words of 10 men and 14 women, ranging in age from 75-96, all of Italian descent, and all members of the St. Clair West community in Toronto.Backers who choose to support this project at the $140-level will receive one 16" X 16" black & white print of their choice, in addition to the photography book. Backers can choose which print they would like to receive from any of the portraits that appear in the book.Backers who choose to support this project at the $300-level will receive a 1-hour portrait session* with photographer Franco Deleo (me). This session includes 3 digital images and 1 printed image up to 16" (length or width).(*Must be located in GTA. Must be scheduled within 180 days after purchase.) About my work as a photographerI have been a photographer for 13 years. I’ve always been drawn to portrait photography and especially black and white photographs. I was very inspired by Richard Avedon and Irving Penn’s celebrity portraits that attempt to distill the eternal from the transitory as well as Diane Arbus’ photography which does the same with everyday people, amplifying and capturing their pains and pleasures in one striking frame. My background in fashion photography is the reason you’ll see these subjects posed with props and stylized to engage the narrative potential of the image.At the beginning stages of Souls I had to build trust with my subjects. That trust started in the bakery and by being a part of the Italian community. I understand the history and culture, I speak the language, I grew up in the neighbourhood. I am theirs just as they are mine. My family in a sense laid the foundation for trust when they founded Tre Mari. After getting to know my subjects, I asked them if I could photograph them in their homes. I figured if they feel comfortable allowing me into their personal spaces then they would be comfortable entering my studio space which is a short walk from our bakery. The studio setting is an important element for the project. The gray walls of the studio backdrop erase anything that would distract from the subjects' appearance, allowing the viewer to focus in on the uniqueness of their facial expressions, from the wrinkles in their faces, the fabric of their clothing, details on stitching, and especially important details of their hands, such as lines and callouses. Hands are one of the themes of this series. Hands have so much character and detail: they are as unique as a person's face.I chose a square format to lay out the photographs—they are intentionally cropped squares so that I could play with the subject's position in a square frame. In some photos the subjects are positioned front and center so the viewer can focus on their strong facial expressions, hands, and eyes. In other photos the subjects are given breathing space, allowing the viewer to notice the subject’s clothing detail, animation and stance. I imagine the pages of the book to be printed with matte paper which has a soft, tactile quality that I believe showcases the black and white photos well. The images have texture and detail so I think it’s important that that paper mirror that quality, and echo the theme of hands.

story:
Who are we?

We have been studying at Napier for 4 years now, and our degree show in Edinburgh is just around the corner. This is it, what it has all come down to so we want to make the most of our efforts and take our work to the Free Range show on Brick Lane.

This is an amazing opportunity to present our work to a new, much broader and more influential audience. Free Range is an event in which many people gain amazing contacts and initial commissions so as a group we are confident it is the next step in building our photographic career.

 

What? You want to help?

As you can imagine, there are lots of expenses which add up on a project like this, below is an outline of our major costs;

The space at Free Range

Walls to hang our work on

Materials and frames

Travel expenses and transport of work from Edinburgh

Accommodation in London

Promotional Materials

Oh, and cake 

 

Cool Stuff

We have come up with some great perks so that you have an incentive to support our cause, from prints to T-shirts you can be sure that you're getting  great deal, at a special price.

 

Remember to choose a perk when you decide to donate! If you accidentally donated without choosing we can sort you out. For print perks we will send you a link to a selection of images to choose from.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Strapped for cash? Why not follow us on social media and watch for updates, we have group Instagram, Twitter and Facebook profiles where you can check our progress on the run up to our exhibition. Oh and come along to see our work from the evening of the 22nd to the 26th of June!

 

https://www.facebook.com/napiercollective/

https://twitter.com/napiercollectiv

https://www.instagram.com/napiercollective/

story:
About me

Born in April 5, 1994, I took my first steps in photography and video at the age of 15. Meetings with industry professionals and the opportunity I had to exercise as a photographer and cinematographer on commercial projects and volunteers helped me to build an experience of the image during this self-learning.

I've always been fascinated by the aesthetics and image rendering and every project I participated in contributing improve my work.

I like to accomplish my first photo book a story through the eye on a young photographer. 

What I Need and What You Get

I hope to raise 2500$  by crowdfunding to cover 50% of the costs to produce my photo book. I will produce 100 books. All raised money will be spent for gear and  printing.

Each donator will be reward by a book and pictures printed (free shipping).

(There is a possibility of photoshoot too.)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford financial support, linking, like or spreading is also a huge help.

story:
The Campaign

The campaign is very important to us as it seeks to engage with audiences to raise awareness and visibility of the UK’s older transgender community that I have been working on for 3 years. To be achieved through an exhibition, a film, talks and workshops. Hen will promote a better understanding of integration amongst and outside of the transgender community. We will exhibit a series of 30 photographic portraits in varying sizes and a newly commissioned film featuring subjects over the age of 40.

Hen is an anthropological study on gender fluidity and an exploration into the lasting impact societal restrictions concerning sexual identity and gender roles have upon us. It examines how gender stereotypes have affected the older transgender community and questions how we define gender and if as a society we should, as well as exploring the inherent social and cultural problems within these alienating classifications.

The exhibition will take place in London at the Herrick Gallery from the 1st April 2019 for 1 week, following on from Trans Day of Visibility on March 31st.

Unfortunately, we were originally counting on Arts Council Funding to fund this project but it fell through so we are now relying on crowd funding to make it happen :) 

Your donation will be so valuable as it will help bring the exhibition and film to life. We have already confirmed press from major publications and broadcasting channels including the BBC, Vogue Italia, Dazed and Confused, Refinery 29 UK, It’s Nice That and i-D Magazine to name a few.

Collaborators

Bex Day is a fashion and documentary photographer and filmmaker born in London. 

Her editorial and commercial clients include Adobe, i-D Magazine, The British Journal of Photography, Stella McCartney, AnOther, Topshop, Garage Magazine, Dazed and Confused, Twin Magazine and Vice to name a few.

She has given lectures about her work at Cambridge University, The Hepworth Gallery, Recylart, Brussels, and the Vogue Italia Female Gaze Exhibition 2016, as well as being nominated for the Magnum Graduate Award 2016.

Since 2017 she has collaborated with William Esdale and Sandrine Servent on Hen.

Sandrine is the project manager and curator of Hen. She works as an agent, producer and curator. After a couple of years working as an agent and producer for DMB Represents - a photography agency representing artists such as Martin Parr, Bruce Gilden, Simon Roberts to name a few - she launched Mina Raven in 2018, an organisation working with public and private institutions to produce and promote photography between UK and France.

William is as an artist, curator, publisher and art technician based in London. William is also co-founder of BKN Magazine and BKN Online. BKN is a print and online resource for photographers, writers and curators.

We have partnered with Stonewall Housing, a charity that ensures LGBTQ+ people live in safer homes where the community can celebrate identity and support each other to achieve full potential which coincides with the aim of Hen. Stonewall Housing opened the UK’s first Trans* only supported accommodation in 2016. Stonewall Housing will be conducting intergenerational workshops throughout the week to challenge these issues in the hope that the younger and older communities can gel and learn from one another as well as educating those who are not transgender. We have happy to announce we have also confirmed Press For Change as another partner from February 2019. Press For Change are leading experts in transgender law. PFC is a UK-based campaign group focusing on the rights and treatment of transgender people. Its aim is seeking respect and equality for all trans people in the UK. The group led the campaign for full legal recognition for transgender people living in Britain including the right to marry.

50% of print sales will go to Stonewall Housing and 20% of print sales will go to Press For Change.

The exhibition partners include Chan Photographic Imaging, Ray's Glass & Frames, Art Rabbit, Old Blue Last Beer and the Herrick Gallery.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £15,000 to cover the costs of putting on the exhibition and documentary.

The money raised will pay for the equipment for the 3 workshops throughout the week hosted by charity Stonewall Housing, and the panel discussion, the transport and installation of the artwork, a catalogue for the work exhibited and each bio of everyone included, framing, the gallery hire for 7 days and the documentary (film editing, colour grading and equipment expenses).

To get this project off the ground the exhibition and film does need funding. If I don’t reach the entire goal I will prioritise the gallery space, framing, equipment for the workshops and the panel discussion, the transport and installation of the artwork.

The Impact        

This is a valuable and meaningful project as it is more than just an exhibition. It is an opportunity to help Stonewall Housing grow as a charity as well as pushing transgender education and awareness forward, particularly regarding the older generation and devising a way of bringing the younger and older generations of transgender individuals together in a safe and accessible space.

Hen aims to encourage integration between older and younger generations of the transgender community. With this integration the main goal is to inspire them to interact, which will provide a safe-space for education and social development. The project is a reaction to the lack of information in the media and visual arts about the older transgender generation.

Risks & Challenges

If we do not raise the exact amount then we will have to make cuts in other areas and continue to put our own money into the project as we are true believers in this project and what it can do for the community. The exhibition will travel across the UK after the London show so that it can be accessible to many different areas of the UK.

*With your donation of any amount, your name (if provided) will be included on a Contributors List in the printed exhibition catalogue for my show to express my full gratitude. If you choose a donation with a perk, you will also receive that perk no later than May 2019 after the exhibition has taken place. 

If we do run into any further problems, we promise to keep our community updated on our progress.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute, don't worry, we understand and appreciate your support regardless.

You can still help out by spreading the word and sharing our pages below!

Indiegogo

Hen Website

Aside from that feel free to drop us a message and say that you enjoyed reading about this, because all artists who are putting their work out there need the validation to help us produce more art. Really, anything helps.

story:
Short Summary

Symbiosis is a photography exhibition organised by the Hexagon Collective from Edinburgh Napier University. We are seven young photographers from seven different countries and we are extremely excited about our first self-organised exhibition. Although our fields of interest differ in terms of genres and techniques explored, this exhibition gives us the chance to come together and thematically focus on the connection between our interests.

Symbiosis - A Photography Exhibition focuses on the interaction between two beings, and how that codependence affects their perception of themselves. The exhibition will explore these symbiotic connections through a variety of genres ranging from landscape, portraiture and still life photography. Each photographer will approach the theme of the exhibition from different angles, turning their lens on the natural symbiosis between two entities as well as focusing on a more conceptual notion of symbiosis as the way in which an individual interacts with their body or their familiar bondings. 

The funds donated will be used to finance the production of the exhibition.

 

The exhibition will be held at Whitespace in Edinburgh, Scotland on 17.-23. March 2017. Free admission.

 

Members of Hexagon Collective:

 

Lara Cappelli // laracappelli.com

Katariina Leinonen // katariinaleinonen.com

Roksana Rychlik // rrychlik.com

Calum Rafferty // calumrafferty.wixsite.com

Laura Prieto // lauraprietophotography.com

Egle Kisieliute // eglekisieliute.com

Julia Nemfield // nemfield.com

 

If you have any questions, contact us at hexagonphotocollective@gmail.com or on our Facebook page.

Instagram @hexagon.photocollective

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise £950 for costs related to the production of the exhibition. We have estimated personal costs for printing, mounting and framing, and shared costs such as graphic design, printing of posters and leaflets, and miscellaneous costs like fuel and hanging materials. Previous to the campaign have received a small grant through our university, and that helps us cover the cost of space. The more we raise, the more we get to use for the work itself.


The perks you get will be made for you. Instead of sending you a print that is one of a thousand, we print it for you according to your wishes.

The Impact

In this digital age we are used to looking at photographs on the screen. Our phones, our computers, our tablets. It is quite something to print a photograph on quality paper, and to put it on a wall. There is something exciting about making small prints and flipping through them in your hands or spreading them on a table. What we are about to do is a step further: a gallery space, full bodies of work and an official opening. We get to explore a challenging topic and interpret it each in our own way, produce the work and to show it to people. We are unspeakably excited about this, and we would love you to be a part of it as well! 

Come to the opening night to meet us and discuss the work with other photography-lovers. Come some other day, when it’s calm and you get to look at the work for as long as you want. Contribute to the campaign and help us make it happen. Receive prints or a postcard and experience what we are so excited about!

Risks & Challenges

We have a secure exhibition space and a week to exhibit. Now it is up to getting the work on a physical surface (printing) and getting some eyes on it (advertising)! So technically we have an exhibition and without any major disasters (hard drive problems or destruction of film) everybody’s work will make it on the wall! All that is left now is making the experience as good as possible for everybody visiting the exhibition.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to any financial support, you can also help support our campaign by spreading the word. Talk to the people around you, follow us on Facebook and Instagram, share our posts and Indiegogo page! We appreciate all the love.


Also, come to the exhibition! We would love to see you face-to-face. The opening night is at 6pm on Friday the 17th March! Bring all your photography-loving friends.

story:
Short Summary

 

Hi everyone my name is Shaun and I'm trying to start a photography business not just for myself and for clients that will enjoy my work but also for my family. After getting turned down from many banks and loans I had no where to turn to. I was told to try Indiegogo so here I am trying to make the most of it.

About my business:
 I've been shooting for 8+ years now and now finally trying to make my passion into a career. I'm very versatile to what I shoot from landscapes, nature, stills, and modeling. (For more work examples please don't hesitate to ask.) If a project comes up that's completely different from what I do that won't stop me from trying it out and learning about it.

What We Need & What You Get

 

DSLR Camera, Accessories, Lighting, and Lenses
Props to consider for example: Vintage Furniture, Clothing for Models, Etc.
Travel Expenses: Hotels, Gas, Flights

I'll be doing photo shoots for contributors and also will be having shirts made up for my business as of right now my perks won't be up until later that and I will keep tabs on who does contribute and will contact you personally about what you want. 

this would be towards being in the Las Vegas area and if your out of town and coming here we can set up a date and time for it. and like I stated above I'll be keeping track on who does contribute and once my business kicks off I'll be willing to travel.

The Impact

I want to be able to show my creativity and stories behind my photography and for families and models alike to enjoy their photos.

Risks & Challenges

I work six days a week and i'm a father I'm trying to build something up for my family. I'm putting everything I got to this business that I probably won't have time to spend with my family but I'll do whatever it takes for this to work out and to have that future for my daughter and for myself.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Reach out to people as much as you can as for I will do the same, any help will do and I'll do my very best to give back what I have received with stories, memories, and career paths with my photography.

After getting turned down from many banks and loans I had no where to turn to. I was told to try Indiegogo so here I am trying to make the most of it. About my business: I've been shooting for 8+ years now and now finally trying to make my passion into a career. I'm very versatile to what I shoot from landscapes, nature, stills, and modeling. (For more work examples please don't hesitate to ask.) If a project comes up that's completely different from what I do that won't stop me from trying it out and learning about it.    What We Need & What You Get DSLR Camera, Accessories, Lighting, and LensesProps to consider for example: Vintage Furniture, Clothing for Models, Etc.Travel Expenses: Hotels, Gas, FlightsI'll be doing photo shoots for contributors and also will be having shirts made up for my business as of right now my perks won't be up until later that and I will keep tabs on who does contribute and will contact you personally about what you want. this would be towards being in the Las Vegas area and if your out of town and coming here we can set up a date and time for it. and like I stated above I'll be keeping track on who does contribute and once my business kicks off I'll be willing to travel.
  The Impact
I want to be able to show my creativity and stories behind my photography and for families and models alike to enjoy their photos.
  Risks & Challenges
I work six days a week and i'm a father I'm trying to build something up for my family. I'm putting everything I got to this business that I probably won't have time to spend with my family but I'll do whatever it takes for this to work out and to have that future for my daughter and for myself.  
  Other Ways You Can Help Reach out to people as much as you can as for I will do the same, any help will do and I'll do my very best to give back what I have received with stories, memories, and career paths with my photography.

story:
About

Hi – I am Philippe Braquenier, a documentary photographer from Belgium. I have spent the past five years traveling around Europe and beyond shooting photos for my project ‘’Palimpsest’’. From the Swiss CERN institute to the index cards of the age-old Mundaneum museum and Wikileaks, “Palimpsest” explores the makeup of the conceptual and physical landscape of Western cultural knowledge and heritage: how does contemporaneity assert itself from the penumbra of history? The primary task of the book is not so much to explain the past as it is to consider historical development and its visual expressions. Using photography, text and Universal Decimal Classification (UDC) as its means of investigation, the publication emerges from the intersections of science and culture, natural and man-made, analogue and digital, visible and hidden. On its pages, History and present converge through these seeming polarities and propose a persuasive argument to refigure temporality.

‘’Palimpsest’’ is an ongoing project that began in 02012 and like any ‘living’ archive, it keeps growing constantly. Approaching the book as a work-in-progress, I debunk the publication, and the idea of history itself, as inactive and immobile. The work illustrates how material history is constantly being altered and added on. It questions the methods mankind uses to preserve historical records — and knowledge overall.

Designed by 6’56’’, the book will be published by Art Paper Editions and printed in Belgium. The publication is designed as an archive of approximately 60 sheets and allows self-edit possibilities with the help of the UDC. UDC is the world's foremost multilingual classification scheme for all  fields of knowledge and a sophisticated indexing and retrieval tool. It is a highly flexible classification system for all kinds of information in any medium. In this publication, UDC is used to organise the theme of the image, its place and its date. In the same way, the cardboard used for the cover is acid free to preserve the book for the future in the best condition.

This crowdfunding campaign is going to support the production costs associated with the book, which includes printing, design and writing.

If we don’t hit our target then the publication just simply won’t exist. So please consider supporting the campaign by ordering a copy, picking up one of the rewards or sharing amongst your networks.

Thank you!

Palimpsest was exhibited and featured in :

Here are some articles online:
WIRED
Internazionale
Aint-Bad
BLOW Magazine
Urbanautica

Design 

Self-Edit possibilities

The architecture of the book itself allows to make your own edit and create new interactions.

Specification

Images : 113 color photographs
Extent : 60 sheets + cover 
Size and Format : 290 x 230 x 15 mm  
Print and Material : - 54 photographic sheets / Conda Matt Perigord 135 gr
                                       - 6 text sheets / Color plan real grey 135 gr / ISO 50001
                                       - Cover / Color plan real grey 700 gr / ISO 14001
Binding : Metal paper fastener

Why 8.000 €?

There are a whole range of costs involved in producing a book from research, commissioning writer, proofreader, designers, printing and distribution. The expenditure breaks down as follows :

Production (500 ex): 6.850€
Editorial/Design: 4.000€ 
Writer: 750€ 
Indiegogo Fees: 400€

Crowdfunding specials

Limited special edition prints

A special edition print of the CERN’s UPS. Edition of 20 / 20 x 25cm / Archival pigment print. Signed certificate of authenticity. 

A special edition print of the atomic clock at METAS. Edition of 20 / 20 x 25cm / Archival pigment print. Signed certificate of authenticity. 


The arrangements for the Medium and Large prints will be discussed together.


Project team

Photographer

Philippe Braquenier, born in 1985, is a Belgian artist working in conceptual and documentary photography. He received his BFA in photography from the HELB and has exhibited in Foto Museum Antwerpen, The Brussels Royal Museum of Fine Arts and Aperture Foundation in New York among other institutions and galleries. His work has recently been published in Wired, Wall Street International, Wallpaper, and BLOW Magazine.

Philippe is represented by The Ravestijn Gallery in Amsterdam.

 

Designers

6'56" was originally founded by Jurgen Maelfeyt who has been running his own studio since 2005. In 2010 he also started Art Paper Editions an then openend RIOT in 2014. 6'56" works with institutions and brands such as Belgian Pavillion Venice Biennale Architecture, 51N4E, Be-Part, Ghent Art Book Fair, Kask, Maarten Van Severen Foundation, Sofie D’Hoore, Sternberg Press, Toneelhuis, VAI as well as artists such as Hilde Bouchez, Ruth Van Beek, Tom Callemin, Bieke Depoorter, Pieterjan Ginckels, Jan Hoek, Paul Kooiker, Renzo Martens, Hana Miletic, Max Pinckers and Mariken Wessels amongst others.

 

THANK YOU !

story:
Hello! This is the fundraising page for the second fundraising stage for the Breaking All The Rules cosplay photobook project. The first round was a great success, with more than $3,000 raised. With that money, I've been able to interview and photograph cosplayers at Kumoricon 2012 and Nan Desu Kan 2012, and will be using the rest of the money to photograph even more cosplayers at Anime Matsuri 2013, Anime Central 2013, Metrocon 2013, Anime Expo 2013, and Dragon*Con 2013.

Although these are a varied number of conventions, there's definitely a big chunk of the United States missing in the cons I listed above, and that's the western US. The states of New Mexico, Arizona, Nevada, Utah, Idaho, Montana, Wyoming, Nebraska, the Dakotas, and even Kansas and Missouri have many talented cosplayers and I want to showcase them in the book. However, I don't have the funds to make it out there at this point. Donating to this second stage fundraiser will enable me to take a trip out to the west and include this region in the project.

At this point, I am hoping to attend AniMegaCon in Las Vegas (June 14-16) and SoDakCon in South Dakota (June 21-23), as well as perhaps another convention in the western Midwest. I would also like to make it out to Arizona and New Mexico and the more northern states. Cosplayers there may be more scattered, so I may have to take this last leg as a roadtrip and schedule meetings with cosplayers along the way. All of this will cost some money, and this is where I hope you can help!

If you are a western USA cosplayer from any of the states listed above, please feel free to contact me at ger.tysk@gmail.com - I'd love to interview you!

Thank you for all your continuing support. I'm already so grateful for all the help I've been given, from donations to the first fundraiser, to people spreading the word, to all those who have liked the Facebook page, and definitely to the cosplayers who have agreed to let me talk to them and photograph them for the project. I am incredibly humbled by all your generosity.

 

--------------------------------

 

Costume Play - a Japanese word originally coined describe the hobby of designing and dressing up in costumes. While that may bring up images of Halloween, costume players - or "cosplayers" - now go all out with painstakingly accurate replicas of their favorite costumes from TV shows, cartoons, comics, and movies. Cosplay has moved from a niche corner of Japanese geekdom to a global pop culture phenomenon that includes the United States.

Breaking All the Rules is a photobook that showcases the people behind the costumes. Cosplay is a hobby that breaks all the rules: anyone of any size, any race, any age, any gender, any background, can cosplay. For the past year, I've been traveling around the East Coast taking photos of cosplayers in costume and asking them why they're so in love with this hobby and the culture around it. I'd like to expand my travels to the rest of the country and interview cosplayers around the United States about their personal cosplay stories, and discover more about the history behind cosplaying and fan conventions.

This book will be a compliation of all those photographs and interviews, showcasing cosplayers in their own words. I don't have the money to make this book happen on my own, but thanks to Indiegogo, I want to make this project a reality.

 

 

This is a book for cosplayers, people who love cosplayers, and also those asking what cosplay is. While it may seem strange to express oneself through a costume designed for a fictional character, those characters are the most important part. People's lives are changed by stories, factual or fictional, every day. Those characters in those stories - the characters who they cosplay - have helped people discover new, different parts of themselves. Cosplay is the ultimate tribute, to say that yes, my outlook, my friendships, and my life have forever changed because of this story.

In this book, I'm sharing the new stories that have come about because of these tributes. The cosplayers I'm photographing and interviewing are everyday, ordinary people. They're students, waitresses, software engineers, musicians, chemists, retail assistants, and managers who, several times a year, put on a costume and become outlaws, fallen villains, ingenues, femme fatales, knights, and heroes starting out on their journeys. They are all extraordinary.

Even in the United States there are many hundreds of thousands of cosplayers, more than I could ever fit into a single book. But I hope this book is a beginning. I hope it can start dialogues between people, no matter how diverse their backgrounds. When asked, "why do you cosplay?" I hope someone can flip through the pages of this book and point to the cosplayers describing in their own words how cosplay has profoundly changed them and made their world a better place.

For more details on the project, please visit the official book website or the Facebook page. You can also read an interview I did with Nerd Caliber in late 2012, talking about the project.

Thank you for your support! I hope you'll join me in producing this celebration of self-expression all across the USA.

 

About me

I'm a cosplayer and photographer from Boston, MA. I started cosplaying in 2007 and attended my first convention, Anime Boston, in 2008. Being both a cosplayer and photographer has given me a unique perspective on the cosplay culture in America, and I hope to bring that to life in this book.

 

You've got more questions? Here are some answers!

Q: How is this book any different from other books on cosplay, like Cosplay in America?
A: The last thing I want to do is for this book to be perceived as a threat or slight against other people who have published books on cosplay! I don't think that we should stop writing books simply because one or two have already been published on the subject - if that were the case, bookstores would be out of business! I deeply respect the authors of books like Cosplay in America; without people like them, cosplay wouldn't be as widespread as it is today. This book is meant more as a way for cosplayers to tell their stories in their own words. I plan to put emphasis on the interview, with the pictures as an accompaniment. I want to give a voice to cosplayers around the country.

 

Q: What happens if the donation limit isn't reached?
A: Indiegogo has a wonderful option called "flexible funding," which allows me to keep the money that is raised even if the deadline passes without reaching the goal. Any money, even short of the goal, will help me at least get to AniMegaCon in Nevada.

 

Q: What happens if we go over the donation limit?
A: Printing a book costs so much money, as does traveling to get interviews and photos for the book! In the incredible event we go over the limit, the money will be used to fund printing costs for the book.

 

Q: How do I get featured in the book for an interview?
A: All my images are from photos I've taken or will take of cosplayers mostly at different conventions around the country. Right now I'm only looking for cosplayers from the western and southern US (not including the West Coast). Not all cosplayers who I photograph will be featured, as I'm trying to represent as large a cross-section  as I can, but I'll try to fit as many in as possible. Ideally, I'd like there to be around 50 cosplayers in the book. If you're interested in having a photo of yourself in the book by donating $50 or more, please see the next question!

 

Q: How does the $50 photo perk work?
A: Because I can't possibly feature everyone who wants to be in the book, I'm adding in a special perk for cosplayers who I won't have the chance to interview. By donating $50 or more, you will have the option of sending one photograph of you in costume to be included in a special user-submitted photo section of the book (size tbd, minumum 2"x3", maximum 4"x6"). The photos will include your name, your hometown, and the year you started cosplaying. Photos may be color or black&white, and may be taken by anyone provided that the photographer gives permission for it to be published. Full information about this perk will be emailed to everyone after the campaign ends on April 2, 2012.

 

Q: I want to donate but I see that rewards at the higher tiers are limited. Why?
A: I wish I could reward every single person who wanted to donate, but unfortunately, I have to factor in costs such as shipping the reward, adding extra pages to the book for names of donors, and giving away free books, which takes away from the number of books I have to sell. If the book does well, perhaps I'll have more projects and books to give out in the future!

 

Q: I want to donate, but I only have $1. Is that okay?
A: Absolutely! Every dollar helps. And even if you don't have money to donate right now, you can still help by letting people know about this campaign, and what I'm trying to do with this project. Sharing the website link and Facebook link are a big help in spreading the word.

 

Q: I want to donate, but I can't afford it right now.
A: There are so many different ways you can still help. Share the link to this campaign with anyone you can. Find me at a con and get some business cards from me; I'll give you as many as you want to hand out! :) Like the Facebook page and tell your friends. Also, if you think you'll have some funds later after the campaign is over and still want to help, you can always visit the store.

story:
LAST PHOTO MY CAMERA TOOK

Photography is my passion in life! More so than most know or maybe even would understand. It's not that I just like photography and getting out there with my camera it's much much deeper than that. I can't really put into words how photography and nature affects me to be honest. I've met very few people in my life that sort of understand where I am coming from and some that think they know but really don't. I don't want to get into details but this passion is what really keeps me going. It is my reason to exist. I feel everyone is put on this planet for certain reasons and I believe, for me, it is photography. At almost 40ys of age I have learned many things in life and one is that I am an artist and with that I suffer like most artists do. Not just financially but spiritually and emotionally. It is a constant struggle that I deal with all the time. I am driven within to get out to explore nature and photography. I prefer to be alone when I go and in my own world and state of mind. The connection I get through my lens with nature is unlike anything else in my life. If I have a busy week of work and can't get out to shoot for myself it really wears down on me. So today was an exceptionally difficult day. To help deal with some major life stress I headed back out to the spot I have been shooting at the past few weeks. Things are looking so incredible there now. The recent cold snap has created many neat ice shapes and formations. I was setting up to take a photo and that is when it happened. The camera fell off the tripod into the water. To say I was destroyed (and still am) is an understatement. Actually I was more in shock than anything else. The almost 2 hour drive home wasn't great. Thought I was going to have a panic attack. Anyway, it now sits in a sealed bag of rice in hope it will come back to life but I am very doubtful it will come back.

So moving forward, what can I do? Well, here is were I am hoping my friends, fans and followers of my work will step up to help out a bit. No I am not asking for anyone to buy me a camera but if you have $5, 10, $25 or more to spare and would like to see it go to more art from me then I would be beyond grateful. 

To be honest, I feel VERY uncomfortable posting a crowd-funding project like this. Struggling financially new gear is something I only dream about or wish for from Santa. I have wanted new gear for years now and using crowd-funding has crossed my mind in the past but I've always felt it is a form of begging and that people will look down on me for it. I still do think that but after a friend convinced me what harm can it really do I thought I would give it a try. 

Any money received through this CF project will go towards a new camera and lens. 

So if you love my work and have a few extra bucks please feel free to help my cause! 

I hope to be returning to taking photos again soon. For now enjoy, or rather shriek at, this image.

Thank you all so much for you support.

Sincerely,

Scott Kroeker
story_txt: LAST PHOTO MY CAMERA TOOKPhotography is my passion in life! More so than most know or maybe even would understand. It's not that I just like photography and getting out there with my camera it's much much deeper than that. I can't really put into words how photography and nature affects me to be honest. I've met very few people in my life that sort of understand where I am coming from and some that think they know but really don't. I don't want to get into details but this passion is what really keeps me going. It is my reason to exist. I feel everyone is put on this planet for certain reasons and I believe, for me, it is photography. At almost 40ys of age I have learned many things in life and one is that I am an artist and with that I suffer like most artists do. Not just financially but spiritually and emotionally. It is a constant struggle that I deal with all the time. I am driven within to get out to explore nature and photography. I prefer to be alone when I go and in my own world and state of mind. The connection I get through my lens with nature is unlike anything else in my life. If I have a busy week of work and can't get out to shoot for myself it really wears down on me. So today was an exceptionally difficult day. To help deal with some major life stress I headed back out to the spot I have been shooting at the past few weeks. Things are looking so incredible there now. The recent cold snap has created many neat ice shapes and formations. I was setting up to take a photo and that is when it happened. The camera fell off the tripod into the water. To say I was destroyed (and still am) is an understatement. Actually I was more in shock than anything else. The almost 2 hour drive home wasn't great. Thought I was going to have a panic attack. Anyway, it now sits in a sealed bag of rice in hope it will come back to life but I am very doubtful it will come back.So moving forward, what can I do? Well, here is were I am hoping my friends, fans and followers of my work will step up to help out a bit. No I am not asking for anyone to buy me a camera but if you have $5, 10, $25 or more to spare and would like to see it go to more art from me then I would be beyond grateful. To be honest, I feel VERY uncomfortable posting a crowd-funding project like this. Struggling financially new gear is something I only dream about or wish for from Santa. I have wanted new gear for years now and using crowd-funding has crossed my mind in the past but I've always felt it is a form of begging and that people will look down on me for it. I still do think that but after a friend convinced me what harm can it really do I thought I would give it a try. Any money received through this CF project will go towards a new camera and lens. So if you love my work and have a few extra bucks please feel free to help my cause! I hope to be returning to taking photos again soon. For now enjoy, or rather shriek at, this image.Thank you all so much for you support.Sincerely,Scott Kroeker

story:
Our Photographic Exhibition is based on the Post Nuclear Family. The Nuclear family is defined as 'a couple and their dependent children, regarded as a basic social unit.' However we know, particularly in todays society this is not the ONLY type of family. The diversity between the different types of families are huge, and no family should be considered any less of a family because it is 'different'.  

Throughout the build up for our exhibition work we will be exploring the different types of family, shining a positive light onto the diversity often stereotyped in the media as 'bad'. We believe it is extremely important to get this topic right, and do justice for the diversity. To do this  we need your help to complete this exhibition to the highest possible standard.

story:
(한국어 소개는 아래로 스크롤해주세요!)

Who are you?

Hi there, there, over there!

I am Seah, a Korean expat living in the Netherlands for 3 years now. I am not a professional photographer or craft maker, but I do love making photos and small little things for lovely people around me. Whoelse wouldn’t, right? :-)

I love making photos because I believe that photography is the most powerful means of engaging in and communicating experiences. I love hand-crafting things for people because it makes me happy to think about how I know them, how each of them plays a role in my life and, above all, to imagine smiles on their faces when they see what I have made for them.

Throughout this year, I have made sheep-themed cards because 2015 is the year of sheep. Next year is the year of monkey, so I will probably make monkey-themed cards in 2016! Around the end of last year, I made a 2015 calendar with photos I took in Amsterdam, to share my experience of Amsterdam with my friends and family in Korea.

What are you doing here on Indiegogo?

As approaching the end of year, I was thinking which experience of this year I want to share with others. The unforgettable experience of this year to me was a trip to Morocco (Marrakesh and Essaouira) in July. It was my first time to visit Arab culture-based country. Further, it has been a while to be where I can hardly communicate with people (as the most of Dutch people speak very good English, and Moroccan people barely speak English unless you are at luxurious hotels or restaurants), and to feel that much heat (as I always feel cold in the Netherlands). Of course it was not very comfortable to haggle over almost everything with very few French phrases I know, but it was part of Moroccan experience. I enjoyed walking around Marrakesh and Essaouira, indulging myself into exotic feelings from a whole different colors and materials they use; mosaics, geometric patterns and symbols everywhere with little stories behind; the concept of humble outside with amazing interior; and Arabic hymns repeating regularly at specific times of day.

Therefore, this year, I decided to make a birthday/event calendar with the photos I took in Marrakesh and Essaouira, to share my first impressions of Morocco. I already printed out 2 copies of this calendar: 1 copy on 120g Standard White Mat paper and 1 copy on 250g Natural White Mat paper. In order to print more copies with good quality papers, I need your support!

*The Korean letter after the number of month is the unit of month in Korean.

*the cover page of calendar

What are you going to do with my help and what will I get in return?

Your precious funding will be used for printing the calendars and delivery (packaging and shipping).

  • The first copy with 250g Natural White Mat Paper costed me around 13,52€ excluding 20% tax and spring wire task: 13 pages (cover + 12 months) x (0,85€ (color print fee) + 0,19€ (paper fee)).
  • The first copy with 120g Standard White Mat paper costed me around 11,83€ excluding 20% tax and spring wire task: 13 pages (cover+12 months) x (0,85€ (color print fee) + 0,06€ (paper fee)).

Basic color print fee will slightly go down as the number of papers to print increases although paper fee would remain the same. I will also look for other printing services which could give me a better deal as the campaign goes. In addition to the printing cost, shipping to the regions outside EU would cost me extra. So, your support will help me greatly to make this happen!

If the campaign reaches the goal, you will receive the following perks. Don't forget to check the details of perks in a stand-alone perks section:

  • 5$: a personal thank you card where 1 of photos from the calendar printed. 
  • 10$: 120g Standard White Mat Paper Printed Calendar.
  • 20$: 250g Natural White Mat Paper Printed Calendar.
  • 30$: 250g Natural White Mat Paper Printed Calendar + 120g Standard White Mat Paper Printed Calendar.
  • 40$: 2 x 250g Natural White Mat Paper printed calendar.
  • 50$: 2 x 250g Natural White Mat Paper printed calendar + 120g Standard White Mat Paper Printed Calendar.

If the campaign does not reach the goal...

If the campaign does not reach the goal unfortunately, I will use the money to send you a personal thank you card on which 1 of photos from the calendar is printed.

I had to pluck up some courage to publicly ask for support for what I enjoy doing like this. I am very excited with my first Indiegogo campaign but I am nervous at the same time. However, regardless of the campaign results, I am sure that I will learn something, which is already amazing! :-)   
Thanks!

***********************************************************************

누구냐, 넌?

한국에 계신 분들 그동안 안녕하셨습니까? 그리고 오늘도 지구촌 곳곳에서 새로운 희망 속에 열심히 살아가시는 해외 우리 동포 여러분들, 해외 유학생 및 근로인 여러분들, 그리고 해외 자원봉사원 여러분 안녕하셨습니까? 그리고 오늘도 푸른 대해를 가르는 외양 선원 여러분 원양 선원 여러분 모든 항공인 여러분 대한민국 국군 장병 여러분 안녕하셨습니까? 이 캠페인 담당자 인사 올립니다-♫

저는 네덜란드로 건너와서 살기 시작한지 이제 3년차 되는 월급쟁이입니다. 짬이 날때마다 사진을 찍고 이런저런 조그만 것들을 제 손으로 직접만들어 주변 분들께 전달하는 것을 무척이나 좋아합니다. 사진찍는 걸 좋아하는 이유는 사진이야말로 경험을 공유하고 전달하는 가장 효과적인 매개체라고 생각하기 때문이고, 자그마한 것들을 제 손으로 직접 만들어 전달하는 것을 좋아하는 이유는 이 과정에서 주변 사람들에 대해 더 깊이 생각하게 되고 아이디어를 손에 잡혀지는 것으로 만들어내는 과정을 매우 즐기며 무엇보다도 제가 만든 것을 전달할 때 받는 분들의 행복해하는 모습을 상상하면 행복해지기 때문입니다. 저는 전문 디자이너나 작가는 아니고 관련 교육을 전문적으로 받은 적도 없습니다만, 받는 사람에 대한 깊은 생각과 관찰 그리고 만드는 데 들이는 정성 만큼은 프로페셔널 못지 않다고 감히 생각해봅니다, 헤헤.

2015년에는 양의 해를 맞이하여 하얀 양 친구가 등장하는 카드들을 만들어서 지인분들께 전달했습니다. 내년은 원숭이의 해이니 아마도 원숭이 카드를 만들겠지요ㅋ 암스테르담 생활 2년차가 되어가던 작년 연말에는 제가 하루하루 살아가고 있는 암스테르담을 함께 나누고자 암스테르담에서 찍은 사진들을 가지고 2015년 달력을 만들어 한국에 있는 지인분들께 전달하였습니다.

무얼 갖고 왔는고?

연말이 다가오면서 올해 내가 했던 경험 중 다른 분들과 공유하고 싶은 경험은 무엇이 있을까 생각해 보았습니다. 올해 가장 인상깊었던 경험은 바로 7월에 다녀온 모로코 여행이었습니다. 1주일간 마라케시와 에사우이라라는 두 도시를 방문했었는데요. 아랍문화권국가를 처음으로 방문하는 것이 었습니다. 또한 무척이나오랜만에 사람들과 좀처럼 대화가 되지 않는 환경 (대부분의 네덜란드 사람들은 영어를 훌륭히 구사하고, 모로코 사람들은 영어를 거의 안 쓰기 때문이지요), 머리위에서 작렬하는 태양으로부터 오는 뜨거운 열기 (네덜란드에서는 늘 춥다고 느끼는 저입니다)를 접했습니다. 물론, 모든 것들을 손가락에 꼽을 정도로만 기억하는 빈약한 불어로 흥정해야 하는 상황이 그리 편안하진 않았지만, 그 역시 모로코여행의 일부였습니다. 모로코에서 돌아다니는 동안 지금껏 제가 익숙해있던 환경과는 전혀 다른 색깔과 재료들에서 신선한 아름다움을느끼고, 여기저기서 쉽게 볼 수 있는 모자이크와 기하학적 문양들이 가진 저마다의 이야기에 귀를 기울이고, 겉은 매우 소박하고 단순하지만 안은 수려하고 아름답게 가꾸는 컨셉에 경탄하고, 매일매일 똑같은 시간대마다 규칙적으로 들려오는 아랍기도 소리를 들으며 그 이국적인 느낌들을 있는 힘껏 받아들이고 즐겼습니다.

그.리.하.야.

올해에는  다른 분들과 나누고 싶은 경험으로 모로코 여행을 선택하게 되었고, 그래서 마라케시와 에사우이라에서 찍은 사진들을 가지고 생일/이벤트 달력을 만들기로 마음먹게 되었습니다. 우선 시험삼아  120g Standard White Mat Paper에 1부 인쇄를 해 보았고, 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 1부 인쇄를 해 보았는데요, 저 스스로는 결과가 꽤나 마음에 들었답니다. 그래서 좋은 종이에 더 많은 부수를 인쇄해 많은 분들과 나누고자 여러분의 도움을 청하게 되었습니다!


*달력표지

후원금은 어떻게 쓰이고 내게 돌아오는건 뭔가?

여러분들의 소중한 후원금은 달력을 인쇄하고 배달 (packaging 과배송비)하는 데에 쓰일 것입니다. 샘플로 달력 두 부를 인쇄해 보았는데요.

  • 120g Standard White Mat Paper에 달력을 인쇄하는데 (20% 세금과 스프링으로 묶는작업 제외) 대략 11,83€가들었습니다: 총 13페이지 (커버페이지 + 12개월) X 0,85€ (컬러인쇄 페이지당 기본비용) + 0,06€ (선택한 종이 1장당 비용)
  • 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 달력을 인쇄하는데 (20% 세금과 스프링으로 묶는 작업 제외) 대략 13,52€가들었습니다: 총 13페이지 (커버페이지 + 12개월) X 0,85€ (컬러인쇄 페이지당 기본비용) + 0,19€ (선택한 종이 1장당 비용).

인쇄하는 페이지 수가 늘어나도 종이  1장당 비용은 그대로 변함없지만, 컬러인쇄 페이지당 기본 비용은 조금씩 내려갑니다. 캠페인이 진행되는 동안 저 또한 제가 샘플인쇄를 진행했던곳 말고 다른 인쇄소에서 더 좋은 조건을 제시해 줄 수 있는지 알아보도록 하겠습니다. 인쇄비용에 더불어 유럽 이외의 지역으로 달력을 배송하는데에 적잖은 비용이 또 필요하기때문에, 이 달력들이 세상의 빛을 보는데에 여러분의 도움이 절실히 필요합니다!

캠페인 목표 달성시, 아래와 같은 선물을 받으실 수 있습니다:

  • 5$ 후원시: 당신의 따뜻한 마음이 느껴집니다! 제가 좋아하는 일을 할 수 있도록, 이 달력이 태어날 수 있도록 도와주셔서 너무나도 감사드립니다! 달력을 만드는 데 쓰인 사진들 중 하나가 인쇄된 카드로 감사의 마음을 전달하겠습니다.  
  • 10$ 후원시: 아름다운 그대여, 밀어주셔서 너무나 감사드리고 120g Standard White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력을 보내 드리겠습니다. 
  • 20$ 후원시: 사랑스러운 당신, 후원해주셔서 너무나 감사드리고 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력을 보내드리겠습니다. 
  • 30$ 후원시: 갈비뼈가 부러지도록 껴안아주고 싶은 당신, 이렇게 팍팍 밀어주셔서 너무나 감사드리고 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력  1부와 120g Standard White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력 1부를 같이 보내드리겠습니다.  
  • 40$ 후원시: 어머나, 당신은 멋쟁이! 이렇게 적극적으로 밀어주셔서 너무나 감사드리고 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력 2부를 보내드리겠습니다.
  • 50$ 후원시: 당신은 슈퍼스타! 이렇게 무조건적인 사랑으로 밀어 주셔서 너무나 감사 드리고 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력 2부와 120g  Standard White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력 1부를 같이 보내드리겠습니다.

만약캠페인목표를달성하지못하면…

아쉽게도 캠페인 목표를 달성하지 못한다면, 모아진 돈을 후원해주신 분들께 감사메세지를 전달할 카드(달력을 만드는 데 쓰인 사진들 중 하나가 인쇄된 카드)를 만드는데 쓰도록 하겠습니다. 


전문가도 아닌 제가 그저 짬나는 시간에 즐겨 만드는 것에 이렇게 공적으로 도움을 요청하기 위해 용기를 내야했습니다! 저의 첫 인디고고 캠페인인 만큼 매우 흥분되고 기대되면서도, 동시에 매우 긴장되고 떨리네요. 그렇지만 캠페인 결과와 상관없이 분명 이 캠페인을 통해 무언가를 배우리라 믿어 의심치 않기에, 전 이미 기쁩니다! :-)

감사합니다!

Basic color print fee will slightly go down as the number of papers
to print increases although paper fee would remain the same. I will also look
for other printing services which could give me a better deal as the campaign goes. In addition to the printing cost, shipping to the regions outside EU would cost
me extra. So, your support will help me greatly to make this happen!If the campaign reaches the goal, you will receive the following perks. Don't forget to check the details of perks in a stand-alone perks section:


5$: a personal thank you card where 1 of photos from the calendar printed. 


10$: 120g Standard White Mat Paper Printed Calendar.


20$: 250g
Natural White Mat Paper Printed Calendar.


30$: 250g Natural White Mat Paper Printed Calendar + 120g Standard White Mat
Paper Printed Calendar.


40$: 2 x 250g Natural White Mat Paper printed calendar.


50$: 2 x 250g Natural White Mat Paper printed calendar +
120g Standard White Mat Paper Printed Calendar.

If the campaign does not
reach the goal... If the campaign does not reach the goal unfortunately, I will use the money to send you a personal thank you card on which 1 of photos from the calendar is printed.I had to pluck up some courage to publicly ask for support for what I enjoy doing like this. I am very excited with my first Indiegogo campaign but I am nervous at the same time. However, regardless of the campaign results, I am sure that I will learn something, which is already amazing! :-)   
Thanks!

***********************************************************************


누구냐, 넌?


한국에 계신 분들 그동안 안녕하셨습니까? 그리고 오늘도 지구촌 곳곳에서 새로운 희망 속에 열심히 살아가시는 해외 우리 동포 여러분들, 해외 유학생 및 근로인 여러분들, 그리고 해외 자원봉사원 여러분 안녕하셨습니까?
그리고 오늘도 푸른 대해를 가르는 외양 선원 여러분 원양 선원 여러분 모든 항공인 여러분 대한민국 국군 장병 여러분 안녕하셨습니까?
이 캠페인 담당자 인사 올립니다-♫
저는 네덜란드로 건너와서 살기 시작한지 이제 3년차 되는 월급쟁이입니다. 짬이 날때마다 사진을 찍고 이런저런 조그만 것들을 제 손으로 직접만들어
주변 분들께 전달하는 것을 무척이나 좋아합니다. 사진찍는 걸 좋아하는 이유는 사진이야말로 경험을 공유하고
전달하는 가장 효과적인 매개체라고 생각하기 때문이고, 자그마한 것들을 제 손으로 직접 만들어 전달하는
것을 좋아하는 이유는 이 과정에서 주변 사람들에 대해 더 깊이 생각하게 되고 아이디어를 손에 잡혀지는 것으로 만들어내는 과정을 매우 즐기며 무엇보다도
제가 만든 것을 전달할 때 받는 분들의 행복해하는 모습을 상상하면 행복해지기 때문입니다. 저는 전문 디자이너나
작가는 아니고 관련 교육을 전문적으로 받은 적도 없습니다만, 받는 사람에 대한 깊은 생각과 관찰 그리고 만드는
데 들이는 정성 만큼은 프로페셔널 못지 않다고 감히 생각해봅니다, 헤헤.
2015년에는 양의 해를 맞이하여 하얀 양 친구가 등장하는 카드들을 만들어서 지인분들께 전달했습니다. 내년은 원숭이의 해이니 아마도 원숭이 카드를 만들겠지요ㅋ 암스테르담 생활 2년차가 되어가던 작년 연말에는 제가 하루하루 살아가고 있는 암스테르담을 함께 나누고자 암스테르담에서 찍은 사진들을 가지고 2015년 달력을 만들어 한국에 있는 지인분들께 전달하였습니다. 


무얼 갖고 왔는고?


연말이 다가오면서 올해 내가 했던 경험 중 다른 분들과 공유하고 싶은 경험은 무엇이 있을까 생각해 보았습니다. 올해 가장 인상깊었던 경험은 바로 7월에 다녀온 모로코 여행이었습니다. 1주일간 마라케시와 에사우이라라는 두 도시를 방문했었는데요. 아랍문화권국가를 처음으로 방문하는 것이 었습니다. 또한 무척이나오랜만에 사람들과 좀처럼 대화가 되지 않는 환경 (대부분의 네덜란드 사람들은 영어를 훌륭히 구사하고, 모로코 사람들은 영어를 거의 안 쓰기 때문이지요), 머리위에서 작렬하는 태양으로부터 오는 뜨거운 열기 (네덜란드에서는 늘 춥다고 느끼는 저입니다)를 접했습니다. 물론, 모든 것들을 손가락에 꼽을 정도로만 기억하는 빈약한 불어로 흥정해야 하는 상황이 그리 편안하진 않았지만, 그 역시 모로코여행의 일부였습니다. 모로코에서 돌아다니는 동안 지금껏 제가 익숙해있던 환경과는 전혀 다른 색깔과 재료들에서 신선한 아름다움을느끼고, 여기저기서 쉽게 볼 수 있는 모자이크와 기하학적 문양들이 가진 저마다의 이야기에 귀를 기울이고, 겉은 매우 소박하고 단순하지만 안은 수려하고 아름답게 가꾸는 컨셉에 경탄하고, 매일매일 똑같은 시간대마다 규칙적으로 들려오는 아랍기도 소리를 들으며 그 이국적인 느낌들을 있는 힘껏 받아들이고 즐겼습니다.
그.리.하.야. 
올해에는
 다른 분들과 나누고 싶은 경험으로 모로코 여행을 선택하게 되었고, 그래서 마라케시와 에사우이라에서 찍은 사진들을 가지고 생일/이벤트 달력을 만들기로 마음먹게 되었습니다. 우선 시험삼아  120g Standard White Mat Paper에 1부 인쇄를 해 보았고, 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 1부 인쇄를 해 보았는데요, 저 스스로는 결과가 꽤나 마음에 들었답니다. 그래서 좋은 종이에 더 많은 부수를 인쇄해 많은 분들과 나누고자 여러분의 도움을 청하게 되었습니다!




*달력표지


후원금은 어떻게 쓰이고 내게 돌아오는건 뭔가?


여러분들의 소중한 후원금은 달력을 인쇄하고 배달 (packaging 과배송비)하는 데에 쓰일 것입니다. 샘플로 달력 두 부를 인쇄해 보았는데요. 



120g Standard
White Mat Paper에 달력을 인쇄하는데 (20% 세금과 스프링으로 묶는작업 제외) 대략 11,83€가들었습니다: 총 13페이지 (커버페이지 + 12개월) X 0,85€ (컬러인쇄 페이지당 기본비용) + 0,06€ (선택한 종이 1장당 비용)


250g Natural
White Mat Paper에 달력을 인쇄하는데 (20% 세금과 스프링으로 묶는 작업 제외) 대략 13,52€가들었습니다: 총 13페이지 (커버페이지 + 12개월) X 0,85€ (컬러인쇄 페이지당 기본비용) + 0,19€ (선택한 종이 1장당 비용).


인쇄하는 페이지 수가 늘어나도 종이  1장당 비용은 그대로 변함없지만, 컬러인쇄 페이지당 기본 비용은 조금씩 내려갑니다. 캠페인이 진행되는 동안 저 또한 제가 샘플인쇄를 진행했던곳 말고 다른 인쇄소에서 더 좋은 조건을 제시해 줄 수 있는지 알아보도록 하겠습니다. 인쇄비용에 더불어 유럽 이외의 지역으로 달력을 배송하는데에 적잖은 비용이 또 필요하기때문에, 이 달력들이 세상의 빛을 보는데에 여러분의 도움이 절실히 필요합니다! 
캠페인 목표 달성시, 아래와 같은 선물을 받으실 수 있습니다:



5$ 후원시: 당신의 따뜻한 마음이 느껴집니다! 제가 좋아하는 일을 할 수 있도록, 이 달력이 태어날 수 있도록 도와주셔서 너무나도 감사드립니다! 달력을 만드는 데 쓰인 사진들 중 하나가 인쇄된 카드로 감사의 마음을 전달하겠습니다.  


10$ 후원시: 아름다운 그대여, 밀어주셔서 너무나 감사드리고 120g Standard White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력을 보내 드리겠습니다. 


20$ 후원시: 사랑스러운 당신, 후원해주셔서 너무나 감사드리고 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력을 보내드리겠습니다. 


30$ 후원시: 갈비뼈가 부러지도록 껴안아주고 싶은 당신, 이렇게 팍팍 밀어주셔서 너무나 감사드리고 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력  1부와 120g Standard White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력 1부를 같이 보내드리겠습니다.  


40$ 후원시: 어머나, 당신은 멋쟁이! 이렇게 적극적으로 밀어주셔서 너무나 감사드리고 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력 2부를 보내드리겠습니다.


50$ 후원시: 당신은 슈퍼스타! 이렇게 무조건적인 사랑으로 밀어 주셔서 너무나 감사 드리고 250g Natural White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력 2부와 120g  Standard White Mat Paper에 인쇄된 달력 1부를 같이 보내드리겠습니다.




만약캠페인목표를달성하지못하면…


아쉽게도 캠페인 목표를 달성하지 못한다면, 모아진 돈을 후원해주신 분들께 감사메세지를 전달할 카드(달력을 만드는 데 쓰인 사진들 중 하나가 인쇄된 카드)를 만드는데 쓰도록 하겠습니다. 

전문가도 아닌 제가 그저 짬나는 시간에 즐겨 만드는 것에 이렇게 공적으로 도움을 요청하기 위해 용기를 내야했습니다! 저의 첫 인디고고 캠페인인 만큼 매우 흥분되고 기대되면서도, 동시에 매우 긴장되고 떨리네요. 그렇지만 캠페인 결과와 상관없이 분명 이 캠페인을 통해 무언가를 배우리라 믿어 의심치 않기에, 전 이미 기쁩니다! :-)
감사합니다!

story: I will be driving from Chicago to Salt Lake City taking the backroads of the Northern part of our country in order to document the vanishing small towns that have been devistated by our countries current economic situation.  The main goal of this trip is to produced a small photo documentary of life in the the Mid and Northwest and also to get me home to be with my wife when her treatment ends and to be there for her 30th birthday.
story_txt: I will be driving from Chicago to Salt Lake City taking the backroads of the Northern part of our country in order to document the vanishing small towns that have been devistated by our countries current economic situation.  The main goal of this trip is to produced a small photo documentary of life in the the Mid and Northwest and also to get me home to be with my wife when her treatment ends and to be there for her 30th birthday.

story:
Links:     www.thru-at.com         www.joshuaniven.com 

Mission Statement

       Over the past six years a few of my closest friends and I have spent our summers and winters hiking sections of the Appalachian Trail (AT).  As an artist and photographer, the first time I set foot on the AT I  dreamed of creating a unique conceptual photography book that was beyond the typical pretty flowers and beautiful landscapes. Through abstraction, surrealism and hyper-realism, my work aims to reveal the inter-connectivity between human and nature.  

        This project is about more than just the hike – it is about redefinition, exploration, discovery, discipline, play, and inspiration. It is an all-American pilgrimage, a journey that brings me back to a different reality rooted in the wild Appalachian Mountains. The Appalachian Trail changed my life and view of the world.  This project will give back to the AT and serve as a big ol’ thank you to the volunteers who make it all possible.

        The Thru-Project will annually donate 25% of all proceeds from publication and print sales to AT volunteer conservation clubs and organizations in perpetuity!  We hope to continually serve as a catalyst for AT awareness and to encourage other artistic endeavors that support the conservation of the American wilderness.

        I will be creating this book with the help of The Thru-Project team and favorite people in the world. Joel Dallas is our writer and technical coordinator. Bryan Anderson is my photo assistant and jester. Jarred Douglas is the project’s Polish muscle and facilitator of all things wilderness survival. You can find their bios on the Thru-project’s website at www.thru-at.com.

Project over-view/ Risks and Challenges

      The Thru-Project has two core priorities. One is to hike the entirety of the Appalachian Trail (2,181-miles) in a single continuous effort. We are starting our journey in the second week of March 2013.  Another, and equally important priority is to create exceptional photography along the way. The Thru-Project aims to photographically and conceptually merge the beauty of nature and the visceral human struggle of existence within the wilderness. The Thru-Project team consists of four veteran hikers; blood brothers who are seasoned in the tribulations of nature’s serenity and violence.

     Challenges to accomplishing the thru-hike goal include logistical planning, mapping, maintaining healthy hiking machines and putting our minds over matter. Through experience the Thru-Project knows that at times it is very difficult to re-supply nutritional foods along the trail. In some instances there may only be a single gas station to buy food in a hundred mile stretch. Think about surviving on gas station food or the scant offerings of a rural grocery store, while hiking a marathon everyday for five days, and you get the idea.

      The Thru-Project will require care packages with nutritional supplements and essential gear (Pecans, cranberries, pistachios, oats, apricots, whey protein, water purifiers, batteries etc.) posted to them along the way in order to ensure optimal nutrition and to keep costs down.

      It is estimated that each mile of trail hiked costs $1-2 per person in food alone. It takes an absurd amount of calories (upwards of 6,000 per day) to move your body plus 40-50 lbs on your back up a mountain, and then down it, for five to six months. Funds will be necessary to buy healthy foods in bulk, and then to package and mail these essential items to the team at post offices along the trail.

        A main priority is the Thru-Project’s artistic and creative production. The necessary photographic equipment is far too heavy for a single person to carry along roughly 2,181 miles of trail. The equipment, food, and gear will need to be divided amongst the four members. Through this division of labor the team can move more efficiently, eat healthier, plan wisely, and create amazing photography. The Thru-Project’s creativity will thrive on inspiration drawn from our toils and visions on the mountain.     

       With the weight distributed and certain planning tasks delegated amongst the team members, the photographer will be lighter on his feet and capable of composing the images that will become the prints and pages for the Thru-Project book. The members of the Thru-Project team have hiked together and taken fantastic photographs before, but this is the first time that creating photography will be their priority.          

      Part of the ethos of the Appalachian Trail is that it is the people’s trail. The Appalachian Trail is the world’s longest and oldest volunteer maintained hiking trail.  The community surrounding the trail contributes not only to the maintenance of the trail, but also supports countless hikers with trail magic and kind assistance from trail angels. We want to give back to that community by taking this pilgrimage and creating art inspired by the culture of the Appalachian Trail.

     Completing a thru-hike is a dream the members of the Thru-Project have shared for several years now. Together, they have section hiked nearly half the trail in a yearly summer and winter ritual. They have been frozen into the crevices of the Tennessee-North Carolina border in the notorious ’09 blizzard, and have been rained on for a week and a half straight in the Pisgah National Forest. The members of the team know that the trail is no cakewalk and are adaptive problem solvers. They have honed their hiking skills over the years and are prepared for the journey ahead with a little help from you.

Check out www.joshuaniven.com for detailed images of the artist's work.

Map of the 2,181-Mile Appalachian Trail. Image from National Park Service

Examples of the aluminum prints that are part of the perk system below.

They have honed their hiking skills over the years and are prepared for the journey ahead with a little help from you.
Check out www.joshuaniven.com for detailed images of the artist's work.

Map of the 2,181-Mile Appalachian Trail. Image from National Park Service

Examples of the aluminum prints that are part of the perk system below.

story:
My Story

I have spent over ten years documenting the disappearing peasant traditions of Maramures, northern Transylvania, Romania. This work has just been released in my first book, The Color of Hay: The Peasants of Maramures. Twenty photographs have been curated in to the Folk Culture and Non-Material Heritage exhibition during the Xiang Sha Wan Photo Week in inner-Mongolia, China, July, 2011.

This show is an opportunity for a very different audience to see and appreciate the way traditions are both disappearing and persevering as modernity sweeps the developing world.

I’ve also been invited to accompany my work. And that is where I need help. While the show is offering money to defray the cost of the plane ticket, it doesn’t cover it all costs and I need to raise more in order to go.

The Impact

This is a fantastic cross cultural event focusing on the non-verbal transmission of traditions and this is exactly what my work is about. By attending in person, I will be able to answer questions in person, giving the attendees a much richer appreciation about this work.

For me, it will be an amazing opportunity to share in and be part of the Chinese photo community, one that is growing and emerging in the photo world. This will be my first exhibition in China and I hope attending in person will open up many more doors then simply sending the photographs.

What I Need

These are the remaining expenses:

$250 Airfare for inside China (Beijing – Baotou)
$180 Portfolio Shipping Case
$150 20x24 Paper
$200 Mat Board
$150 Ink for Prints
$130  VISA

Total: $1,000

Other Ways You Can Help

Pass the word on to your Facebook and Twitter friends! 

Thanks for your support.

Kathleen

story:
Von uns für Euch und zusammen für Alle: begrüßt die fesche Sopherl und die Pummerin! In ihrem früheren Leben waren sie mal Snowboards, aber wir haben ihnen zum Coming-out verholfen und sie zurück auf die richtige Bahn gebracht: als upcycled Longboards machen sie nicht nur Dich glücklich, sondern die Welt auch ein bisschen besser. Und so geht's:



Jedes RUFFBOARD ist ein Einzelstück, hergestellt aus ausrangierten, aber liebgewonnenen Snowboards und jeweils in einem einmaligen Design gestaltet.

Durch unsere einzigartige Technologie bleibt die originale Snowboardoberfläche erhalten, während die neuen Longboards die nötige Stabilität bekommen.

Mit Deiner Hilfe geben wir alten Snowboards eine zweite Chance!



Die Herstellung unserer RUFFBOARDS ist 100% umweltfreundlich: Wir produzieren mit Strom aus regenerativen Quellen und verwenden pflanzliche Harze - der schrittweise Ersatz aller umweltschädigenden Werkstoffe und Herstellungsverfahren ist zentraler Bestandteil unserer Produktion.

Seit den 90er Jahren wurden in Österreich rund 500.000 Snowboards verkauft. Dies entspricht etwa 2 Millionen Tonnen Sperrmüll. Durch die Produktion von 500 RUFFBOARDS, also das Upcycling alter Snowboards, ersparen wir unserer Umwelt rund 1,5 Tonnen Sperrmüll.

Umweltfreundliche Produktion statt Müllberge!



Die Zusammenarbeit mit dem Verein NEUSTART soll straffällig gewordenen Menschen durch praktische Resozialisierungshilfe unterstützen, ihren neuen Platz in der Gesellschaft zu finden.

In der professionellen Werkstatt entstehen so handgefertigte RUFFBOARDS in höchster Qualität und diese werden noch dazu mit Liebe und viel Engagement gemacht.

Auch Dein RUFFBOARD hilft, weitere Arbeitsplätze zu schaffen und noch mehr jungen Menschen die Chance auf einen erfolgreichen NEUSTART zu geben!




Die fesche Sopherl und die Pummerin finden immer mehr Fans. Mit dem Erlös aus der Crowdfunding-Kampagne werden dringend benötigte Arbeitsplätze für ehemalige Häftlinge geschaffen und ausgestattet.

Wir haben uns ganz bewusst dafür entschieden, mit dem Verein NEUSTART zu kooperieren und damit jenen  Menschen einen Arbeitsplatz zu bieten, denen von der Gesellschaft zu oft eine zweite Chance verwehrt wird.

Mit Deiner Unterstützung kurbeln wir unsere Produktion weiter an und schaffen bis Mitte 2015 fünf neue Arbeitsplätze!


SAVE A HORSE, RIDE A RUFFBOARD.


Du hast Fragen oder willst eins unserer Boards testen? Dann komm doch einen Sprung vorbei!

Am Samstag den 7.6. 2014 sind wir mit unseren boards beim Vienna Roller Derby.


Beginn 16:30 in der  Hopsagasse 7, 1200 Wien


Vom 13.6.-15.6. 2014 sind wir beim Fesch'markt in der Ottakringer Brauerei in Wien. Für mehr Infos zu diesem Event: Klicke hier!

story:
Hey guys,

This month marked three years of full-time work on this project. In the last three months, as you have noticed, I’ve almost had to stop. This week, I’m staring at the end. Some of you have expressed a desire to help me continue.

If you would like to do that, I would be very grateful. I have a postcard and a choice of any print you might like.

I dream of offering you bigger and better things, but I’m not quite there yet. Right now, I have no other options. Thank you!

http://portraits-of-america.com/

story:
Hello! I recently received a photography fellowship from the amazing organization, Soko, based in Nairobi, Kenya. Soko's mission is create the first online marketplace where international consumers can buy goods directly from artisans around the world. With the tools that Soko provides, artisans are able to participate in the global marketplace, find new customers, and share their handcrafted items with the world. They promote small scale, environmentally friendly production with materials that are locally sourced, up cycled, or recycled. Though they by no means exclude men from participating, empowering women and increasing access to economic opportunities for women is one of their goals. 
I will be traveling to Kenya for two months, working with Soko to photograph portraits of their artisans, their products, and teaching workshops to artisans in Nairobi and throughout Kenya on how to better photograph their goods using the cameras they have access to and use natural light as well as homemade light boxes to enhance their items. I believe that beautiful portraits can help connect a buyer to a seller and also boost sales. Being able to implement and establish a standard of photography for product photography will also bring in more sales, more acclaim, and will help establish the artisans as true artists in their fields. 
The artist portraits that I plan to shoot will show the public who these artists are, it will help define them, their work, their artistic process, and their stories. Soko will also be able to provide beautiful portraits and photographs of items to press and media and be able to further their mission of peer to peer international sales. I have previously worked with the non-profit Awamaki Lab, based in Peru, and the photographs that I took  for them have been used for press in magazines such as Vogue India, Elle Mexico, Blackbook, Martha Stewart Living, and others, increasing global awareness of the organization and its mission. I hope to do the same with Soko. Some of that work can be seen on my website at www.katereeder.com .
 
All in all, pretty awesome, but also pretty expensive. Though Soko will be able to assist me in finding and making connections with the artisans, help me navigate through the sometimes difficult nature of traveling to small and isolated towns, and provide me with a safe space to work and lead workshops, they are already stretched pretty tight financially and getting from New York to Nairobi can cost quite a bit. In order to get there with the resources and supplies necessary I'll need some financial help! Help cover the cost of my flight, accommodations, vaccinations, and travel throughout Kenya, and help bring better photography skills and resources to artists. With enough financial support I will also be able to invest in some digital cameras and lighting equipment that I can leave with Soko for their artists to come and use whenever they have need. 

Giving to this campaign won't leave you empty handed! Besides feeling like an awesome person for chipping in, I am also offering some pretty sweet perks! If you can't give financially but would still like to support this project please post a link to your Facebook/twitter/social media outlet of choice and spread the word! Thank you!!!!

What is Needed:
Flight from NYC to Nairobi - Avg. $1400
Vaccinations out of pocket - $450
Housing for two months in Nairobi - Avg. $1100
Monthly pass for City Transportation - $90 (for two months)
Two TableTop studio set ups for photographing small items-$170.00
One Used DSLR Camera - $200.00
Two Smaller Digital Cameras - $190.00

What You Get!
$10-A Postcard from Kenya! 

$15 - A set of three animal finger puppets of Kenyan animals

$30 - An 8"x12" photographic print of one of my portraits taken for the Obsessions in Portraiture series

$50 - A handmade Kenyan Insect embroidery framed in a wooden embroidery hoop, awesome for hanging on the wall!

$100 - An 11"x13" print of one of my portraits taken for the Obsessions in Portraiture series

$250 - An 11" x 13" print of one of my portraits taken for the Obsessions in Portraiture series matted and framed (US only)

$600 - A two hour portrait photoshoot with me anywhere in the TriState area! You can transfer this one to a friend rot loved one, anyone who wants an awesome portrait of themselves! I will come to you at your home or place of business to shoot. 

$1000 - A three hour photoshoot with me anywhere in the tristate area, Hudson Valley, NJ, CT, MA, RI, MD, DC, or Philadelphia area! This is a great one for engagement photos, pregnancy photos, newborn photos, a family portrait, or just a really fantastic portrait shoot for yourself or a friend. I will come to you at your home or place of business to shoot.
