story:
"Think of it as Humans of New York meets Wisden's Cricket Almanac, with a dash of Hunter S. Thompson..."


The Story



My name is Gregory Uzelac. I'm a writer, comedian, and photographer.

And I love cricket. 

In fact, I'm kind of obsessed.

---  

Growing up in a America, I found in the great British pastime a history, camaraderie, and link to my South African roots that nothing else ever offered. Cricket and its fan culture are wacky and eccentric like me, and the love of the game has taken me all over the world, playing in all kinds of places with all kinds of people. 

And I mean ALL kinds of people.  

The global fraternity of cricket does not discriminate, and I have made the acquaintance of people I would never normally come across if not for our mutual love of the game. 

And that's where I got the idea for writing a book.

Through portraits and interviews, I want to take readers on a personal journey as I chronicle the most interesting, bizarre, and heartwarming answers to the question: Why do you love cricket? And where better to find cricket fans from all over the world than at the upcoming 2015 Cricket World Cup in Australia and New Zealand.


From February 10 to April 3, 2015, I will backpack throughout Australia and New Zealand hopping from match to match, city to city, pub to pub (to pub), and more, exploring the landscapes, characters, and cricketing weirdness that shall be strewn about during cricket's biggest event.  

What separates my book from those of the past, is that my focus is not on professional players and administrators, but on THE PEOPLE who love the game and why.  It will be a journey of exploration and self discovery through the lens of a camera and the vantage point of a sports fanatic. 

In the end, the book is about more than cricket, it's about people like me who have an undying passion for something that seems crazy to outsiders and the equally crazy efforts I'll take to find them and tell their stories alongside my own. 

I want to explore the elements BEHIND the fandom.  What leads folks to cricket and why do they still follow it how they do? What role does it play amongst families, friends, and complete strangers? Furthermore, with my experience writing about music, movies, and current events, what does cricket tell us about loyalty in the modern age?  Basically, with so much media around us, how does a fairly complicated, silly game still hold such weight over nations and individuals and what replaces cricket in other cultures?

But I can't do this without your help...


About Me

I am a writer and photographer from New York City who has been published in The Cricketer Magazine and on ESPNCricinfo, amongst other non-cricket publications and websites.  I have played club cricket in the United States and China and have taken cricket photographs in the UK, India, Sri Lanka, South Africa, China, Bermuda, and USA.  To get an idea of my international allegiances, I support Middlesex, Kolkata Knight Riders, Trinidad and Tobago, and the Nashua Cape Cobras, and I own every South Africa ODI kit made since 2006.

14K is A LOT of Money, Greg...

Giving

Ah the part where I ask for money - never fun, but highly necessary. 

The good news is I have tickets to several matches including the Opening match in Christchurch, the Semi-Finals in Sydney, and the Finals in Melbourne and furthermore, I do not wish to solely meet people at matches, but out around the cricket and in small and large towns as well. But travel to and around Australia and New Zealand is pricy and the biggest financial obstacle ahead. 

Based off of Kayak and Expedia multi-city travel searches, transport and basic lodging from February 10 to April 3rd will cost me approximately $8000, with the most expensive (and crucial) flights being from New York to New Zealand (Part 1) New Zealand to Australia (Part 2) and then back home.

For transport within Australia and New Zealand, flights within these countries range from $100 to $300, and Hostels and budget hotels range from $30 to $120 a night. The $8000 transport and lodging budget should allow me flexibility to explore new leads and, well, not get stranded and attacked by renegade kangaroos. 

$1000 will go towards camera equipment, including (but not limited to):

Canon Speedlite 600EX-RT ($500)

Bolt VM-110 LED Macro Ring Light ($80)

3 x SanDisk 32GB SDHC Memory Card Extreme Pro Class 10 UHS-1 ($150)

The remaining budget (appx. $5000) goes towards primary publication, PR, and marketing of the book, which shall be done under new creative start-up, The Okazigo Media Company. This includes the initial production of 200 hardcover copies and social media and digital outreach and marketing, with a strategically estimated budget of $2000. 

 

--


What You Can Receive!

Now while my requests may seem daunting, the perks are pretty awesome! 

Perks range based on the amounts you contribute, with the most minimal of them ($50) being an addition to the book's "Member's Club", because at the very least, you should be recognized for your dedication to this creative endeavor.

However as the amounts get bigger, the perks get more fun, including signed copies of the finished book, interview and possible inclusion in the book, taking requests to hold up a sign at a match, and even tickets to world cup matches ($1000). 

For the $5000 donor there is a ticket waiting for them to join me at the World Cup Finals on March 29 and I will interview and photograph them for the book.* They will also receive a free, signed copy of the book. 

Please see the perks section for specific details and amounts. 


Other Ways You Can Help

While I am most in need of financial support, you can help Wickets & Weirdness in several other ways:
- SHARE this Indiegogo page! Do you know someone that loves cricket? Send them this link. Do you know someone who at the very least will enjoy the book? Send them this link. Let cricket loving friends know I am out there and looking to make my concept a reality! Use Facebook, Twitter, Email, your voice - anything. Spreading the word is the only way an eccentric billionaire will find out about my book and fund it! 
- Will you be Down Under during the World Cup? Let me know and I'm sure we can grab a beer and chat cricket.  Maybe you'll end up in the book!
- Got suggestions of cricketers and cricket fans Down Under that I should meet? Maybe your creepy grade school groundskeeper? What about your superstitious friend who never misses a match?  Your niece who is a batting prodigy equal to Don Bradman? Spread the word and put me in touch - I want to capture a full scope of cricket lovers. They don't have to even be that odd!
- Follow me on Twitter and on my cricket blog, Napoleon Einstein to get updates about my journey, including first draft photos, videos, and other surprises. 

Thank You so much for your support!


*This does not include transportation and I cannot guarantee you will make the final edit of the book.

This includes the initial production of 200 hardcover copies and social media and digital outreach and marketing, with a strategically estimated budget of $2000. 
 --



What You Can Receive!
Now while my requests may seem daunting, the perks are pretty awesome! 
Perks range based on the amounts you contribute, with the most minimal of them ($50) being an addition to the book's "Member's Club", because at the very least, you should be recognized for your dedication to this creative endeavor.
However as the amounts get bigger, the perks get more fun, including signed copies of the finished book, interview and possible inclusion in the book, taking requests to hold up a sign at a match, and even tickets to world cup matches ($1000). 
For the $5000 donor there is a ticket waiting for them to join me at the World Cup Finals on March 29 and I will interview and photograph them for the book.* They will also receive a free, signed copy of the book. 
Please see the perks section for specific details and amounts. 


 
  Other Ways You Can Help
While I am most in need of financial support, you can help Wickets & Weirdness in several other ways:
- SHARE this Indiegogo page! Do you know someone that loves cricket? Send them this link. Do you know someone who at the very least will enjoy the book? Send them this link. Let cricket loving friends know I am out there and looking to make my concept a reality! Use Facebook, Twitter, Email, your voice - anything. Spreading the word is the only way an eccentric billionaire will find out about my book and fund it! 
- Will you be Down Under during the World Cup? Let me know and I'm sure we can grab a beer and chat cricket.  Maybe you'll end up in the book!
- Got suggestions of cricketers and cricket fans Down Under that I should meet? Maybe your creepy grade school groundskeeper? What about your superstitious friend who never misses a match?  Your niece who is a batting prodigy equal to Don Bradman? Spread the word and put me in touch - I want to capture a full scope of cricket lovers. They don't have to even be that odd!
- Follow me on Twitter and on my cricket blog, Napoleon Einstein to get updates about my journey, including first draft photos, videos, and other surprises. 

Thank You so much for your support!

*This does not include transportation and I cannot guarantee you will make the final edit of the book.

story:
The Napier Photo Collective is a group of 18 photographers and filmmakers who are in their fourth and final year at Edinburgh Napier University. In June we will be travelling down to London to exhibit our work at Free Range (at The Old Truman Brewery), an annual event featuring the work of graduates from across the country and pulling in huge visitor numbers (in excess of 100,000). By exhibiting at Free Range we can expect to have our work seen by many more people than a traditional degree show or independent exhibition - this is an opportunity to connect with other students and industry professionals and shape our future careers. This is not the first time that students from Edinburgh Napier have taken their work to Free Range, but we are the last group to come from the Photography and Film BA (Hons) course. We want to take this opportunity to showcase the work of both photographers and filmmakers, and celebrate the benefits of these two groups working alongside each other at Edinburgh Napier for the final time. As with all things worth doing the road to Free Range isn't easy or cheap, but it's one that we are passionate about taking, and with your help we can put on an exhibition that we can be proud of. 


We need to raise £2000 to help get us on our way to Free Range. We've received a grant from Edinburgh Napier University to fund our exhibition space but without some more funding it will just be us in an empty room! The money that you donate to us here will go towards:

  • Wall hire - as well as hiring the space we will need to put up some walls so that we have room to show all of our work and create a great exhibition.
  • Travel  and transport costs to get us and our work from Scotland to London.
  • Promotional materials - we want to make sure the show is a huge success and one of the ways to do this is to let everyone know that we're going to be there.
  • Consumables - all those little things that are needed to make an exhibition great like paint, hooks and screws. 
We will all be covering our own costs for producing the work that will be shown, so we need your help to make sure that we're not all dressed up with nowhere to go. Any money that you donate will go a long way to helping us get to Free Range, and while the warm fuzzy feeling of donating to our cause is nice we're also giving away a range of great perks to say thank you for supporting us. From a special thank you in our exhibition catalogue to merchandise to signed prints, we want to give you something special in recognition of your help and as a way for you to remember the important part you've played in our exhibition. 


Many members of the collective have exhibited their work before so we feel confident in our ability to put on a great show, and we can use these previous experiences to ensure our success at Free Range. As with any event like this there are challenges involved but we feel confident that with our expertise and passion and your contributions we can create an exhibition to be remembered. Any support that you can show for us will be gratefully received by each and every one of us, and we hope that even if you cannot offer financial support you will still share our campaign and spread the word.

story:
Summary

I am an Irish/Italian photographer and writer who has been living in the UK most of my life. My interests are in participatory practice and social documentary, with a strong focus on ethics in photography.

Delta is a photographic project that I have been working on as part of my MA in Documentary Photography and Photojournalism at the University of Westminster.  The project, taking its name from Adrienne Rich's poem Delta, asks those who identify or are read by society as women to consider when they first recall experiencing sexual harassment, and to contribute an image of themselves at that age.  A collection of poetry, testimonies and reflections provided by project participants is bound into an accompanying book in which the audience can also write. This solid, tactile item that cannot be easily erased signals my contract with the participants and audience that the stories entrusted to me will not be ignored, dismissed or disbelieved. 

In the wake of the #metoo movement, and with the aim of starting a conversation that may help to shape a more egalitarian society, the project seeks to reframe some common assumptions about sexual harassment and encourage reflection on when we all start learning.

This campaign is specifically raising funds to build an installation to show the work in a way that aims to support people engaging with a difficult subject.  

Imagine, if you will, a circular stand-alone wall, with a wide entry point at one end. The photos will be on the outside wall. The inside will be plain and hold a stand with the book on it.  The stand will be sloped so you can open, read and write in the book while sheltered by the protective embrace of the wall, always being able to see the entry/exit point.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will go towards the cost of materials, labour and transport for the specific installation build that aims to make this difficult subject more accessible.  This is a whopping £1900 and why I am asking for your support.

The rest of the project (including printing, wall painting and much more) is self funded.

In the unlikely event that I raise more than £1900 I undertake to donate the rest to Medicine Sans Frontieres (MSF).

I plan to offer a number of perks for people who are feeling particularly generous - please check the perks section!

 

The Impact

Your contribution will support me in my aim to present this work in a unique way.  Instead of defaulting to a traditional flat wall, I want to use space as a tool to support participation and engagement with a challenging subject.  The design is mindful of the risk of triggering those who have been subjected to sexual harassment. It seeks to avoid shock tactics, building in a space where those who want to read the hard hitting written contributions by participants can do so in a supportive environment that is not overlooked.  It is my hope that this space will create an environment which is encouraging of reflection, debate and discussion and perhaps even participation.

 

Risks & Challenges

The exhibition is part of an MA Final Show and will happen regardless of whether the funding target is achieved.   The funding is directed specifically towards creating a space (or build) that aims to support people engaging with a difficult subject.  

The design of the installation resolves a challenge; previously, you could be overlooked while reading and writing in the book.  

My ambition is also to make the inner space big enough to be wheelchair accessible though much depends on what the carpenter and technicians think is possible. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about the exhibition which is taking place at the Ambika  P3 Gallery in London from 22 to 28 June 2018

Share the link with anyone you think might like to contribute towards the exhibition build.

story:
Documenting Ancient Tibet

Between the 1980s and 2000s, I launched more than two dozen expeditions to the uppermost reaches of Tibet in search of its first civilization, shooting photographs of people, places and monuments.

These images have proven to have exceptional cultural, historical and archaeological value, chronicling a vanishing Tibet. In the last thirty years momentous social and economic changes have taken place in Upper Tibet, my photos serving as a benchmark of developments there.

My photographs are absolutely unique, representing the first images ever taken of the remains of an entire ancient civilization known traditionally as Zhang Zhung, including impressive megalithic sites, all-stone temples, fortresses, a wide array of tombs and other burial structures, as well as much rock art.

Making my priceless archive available

Most of these photographs are locked away in my archives unavailable for study and consultation. Join me to digitize my complete collection of 18,000 images of Upper Tibet and be a part of bringing to light one of the least known ancient civilizations in the world.

story:
Greetings!

Here i am raising funds to get my book, Valley of Light - A Photo Journal of Pemberton, BC, printed (maiden print run) and out to the world for all to see and get inspired by. I am amazed by the beauty and power of the Pemberton Valley in beautiful British Columbia every day. It is something i believe everyone should be able to experience.

Each day of the 2014 year I took a photograph of what inspired me that day. Thats 365 photographs in a row! Please visit my blog http://valleyoflight.wordpress.com to view all the photographs. All photographs were taken with the amazing ¾ frame Nikon D5200 DSLR with either a 50mm 1.8 or 18-105mm 3.5-5.6 lens. Photographs are a mix of colour and black and white.



Using InDesign as my preferred program for layout and design, the book is electronically finished and waiting to be sent to the print house. Each photograph has space to show its full story, and below it, the caption that i felt inspired to compliment it with the day of. The book will measure at 12"x12", be hardcover and will be professionally printed in Manitoba, Canada by Friesens Press. As you are scrolling down, you are looking at a few of the pages from the book.


The finished product will be sharp, elegant and shine on your coffee table or in your office waiting room for clients to get inspired by. The book will also make the perfect gift for all occasions, even to yourself! Come on in and join the journey in making the the first print run of this amazing book happen!


If you have any questions, feel most welcome in contacting me via the provided email.

Thank you for reading and i look forward in sending you your copy :)

story:
How you can help? 

We are hoping to raise £1700.

We are crowdfunding to raise funds to enable us to install an exhibition to a high quality and professional standard to reflect the way we work, providing us with our initial opportunity to launch our work into a professional context.

On this page is the opportunity to purchase original work from up and coming new photographers, along with other items such as tickets to our symposium and invitations to our private view attended by many leading industry professionals.

Money received will contribute to the production of the show including our show catalogue, and promotional material such as websites along with lighting and show installations.

The Impact

We are all working hard, trying to produce interesting and pertinent work, that will engage with the public. However we cannot do this alone and are grateful for any help you can give us. For many of us this will be the first show in London and very important platform to launch our future careers.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, you can still be a big help by spreading the word and telling other people about our upcoming show! Please share this page with your friends and family.

Thank you for your support, we hope you enjoy looking at our work in progress.

Facebook: www.facebook.com/mapadegree18

Instagram: @mapashow2018

story:
Hello!

In case you don't already know: My name is Cara Nicole. Also known as AZ Powergirl to some. I cosplay, edit comics, write and color art professionally. I am also the model for Magic: The Gathering's Emmara Tandris. 

So, here is how this is going down. Me, you, this Photobook. We are going to make this happen! More awesome cosplay photos, with commentary by yours truly and with some new and amazing perks.

What We Need & What You Get

Photobook 1 saw several printings and has been sold out for a long time. Photobook 2 has sold over 1,000 copies! I want Photobook 3 to be the next evolution. It will feature a revamp in design and prime content of quality costumes, seductive art photography, selfies, and convention adventures.

So here is the detail of what the funds will be used for...

1) Printing and shipping to you.

2) There are no other production costs as the book is being made in house. ;)

 

 

The Impact

Yeah! Let's talk about the impact. The last photobook was sold at over 50 conventions and many major comic book stores worldwide. Let's keep the momentum going as together we plant this flag for COSPLAY and cement it as a staple in our culture.

I've said it before and I will say it again, you vote with your wallet. I'm voting with mine and you can too! Let's make this photobook another undisputed success.

 

Risks & Challenges

As before, I've taken on a substantial investment by curating images, building the book and finding good printing. This is on top of the time and effort of having built the costumes, shooting with the photographers and editing the images.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge at this time, you can definitely share this on social media like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, etc etc AND you can talk to your local comic book store about carrying it in their shelves. Also, join my Patreon and see new content material first.

 

A Long Time Ago In a Galaxy Far Away!

This is the print that will go with the Leia pack.

Canvas and Metal Print Perk

Canvas and Metal Print perk supporters! Any art and cosplay print in our store is available as a perk for this level (exclusives excluded). Please send me a message as to which you want to get!

See here for selection: http://183degree.storenvy.com/

ADD ONS

PHOTOBOOK 2. For those of you yet to own my previous book, The AZ Powergirl Photobook 2 is being made available to you at a discounted price for being a supporter of this campaign. To get Book 2, simply add $10 to your already existing pledge and you will receive both your incentive from this campaign and book 2. It's as simple as that!

STRETCH GOALS

Thanks in advance for supporting this book just as you have supported my cosplay overall. Here are some incentives to help things along. Don't forget to share this on your social media and watch the campaign for the book grow:

 

GOAL: 25 perks claimed. REWARD: New song digital download for free for all supporters. - EDIT: GOAL HAS BEEN MET!!

GOAL:  50 book perks claimed   REWARD: Everyone participating in those pledges receives a free comic book sized print of me as Waldo (below) [EDIT} AND lingerie Domino  GOAL HAS BEEN MET!!

GOAL: 75 book perks or higher will unlock REWARD: New Perk in the form of Comic Art.

GOAL: 100 book perks claimed   REWARD: I will add four new metallic trading cards of four different costumes.

BONUS GOAL: $7000  REWARD: 10 never before seen high resolution digital downloads of my most popular cosplays to all who participate in the campaign.

story:
Fears Photography is 3k away from having a much needed studio!

This impacts us all. Our little ones need somewhere to go when the weather is not fit for outdoor portraits. When it's too cold, but we want to send Christmas portraits in our cards. When it's too hot but we want to show Grandmother how big we have gotten over the summer...

  Anyone can benefit, at any time of the year!
From the High School Senior wanting a studio shot, to a mother wanting to show her after baby figure for the husband, to Families just needing that one perfect portrait for the fireplace. All are welcome!


"I hate to turn anyone away due to weather. It is an honor to photograph someone, and a service I enjoy providing to the best of my ability. As the weather changes, I catch myself telling clients that it may be getting too cold for their babies to be outdoors. That makes me sad! You have come to me! You want to put your trust in me! I want to make you happy!"

 So here is the deal:

 We are $3,000 away from having a "safe haven". This is only a starter. A building, basic equipment, and props will be purchased to get us rolling once this is met. We need donations! Friends, loved ones, family; let's help each other and build a studio!

Spread the word! This is for us all!

story:
The ”Escamonde” Tourism and Arts Club, in partnership with the Association for Promoting and Developing Tourism Prahova, is organizing the third edition of the "Sequences" Photography Festival, between 25 – 27 September 2015.

What the festival is showing, once again, is that photography has a strong grip on today’s society, and it’s doing this by promoting images and ideas belonging to Romanian and international artists.

The main activities are workshops, conferences and photography displays. In addition to this, there will be jazz concerts, theatre plays, a handcraft market and other activities.

@ Sebastian Puraci, Sebastian Bruno, Iulian Ignat and Oliver Merce.

@ Ilinca Vânău, Felicia Simion, Hannah Saunders, Clio Ryan and Gina Buliga.

All events are open free of charge to the public.

This year we invited more than 40 photographers from all over the world, to exhibit their work at our festival. In the same time, we will have also group exhibitions with other tens of photographers. At this link you can find the complete list of the exhibitions.

@ Bogdan Comănescu, Aurel Manea, Nicolae Chirobocea, Cătălin Pomeanu.

@ Ryan Bradley, Molly Kempster, Marc Wilson, Tom Kirby.

This festival is organized with the support  of the cultural centres of the two cities mentioned before: the Prahova County ”Ion Ionescu-Quintus” Art Museum , the Prahova County History and Archeology Museum, Ploiesti ”Toma Caragiu” Theatre and  Prahova County Natural Sciences Museum.

Even though we have great partners, the festival’s funds are coming mostly from the organizers’ pockets and in order to achieve an amazing event we need a bit of help. As we want to keep the festival tradition and to have all the photographic related events free to attend, we need to find other ways to support your expenses. The money raised will be spent on:

- high quality prints;
- accommodation for the artists;
- building up the white walls for the exhibitions;
- promotional materials (flyers, posters etc).

@ Bandia Ribeira, Jesse Alexandrer, Julien Coquentin and Cătălin Munteanu.

@ Oltin Dogaru, Christoph Soeder, Ioana Casapu, Anca Mitroi and Cristiana Apostol.

It doesn’t matter if we manage to raise this sum or not, and by the way 1703 is related to the time of our grand opening: 17:03 (Friday 25th of September). Why three minutes after five o'clock? We are not big fans of round numbers and in the same time it is a reference to the third edition of the festival. Coming back to the point, no matter if we manage to reach this sum or not, everyone will be more than welcome to our festival.

As you climb the large stairs of the Palace of Culture in Ploiesti you will be greeted by the warm friendship and joy of lots of handmade artists who will present their skills during the days of the festival. Entering the main room you will be amazed by this wonderful building, finished in the 1930's in the time of Carol II of Romania who said at the opening: "Inaugurating today this beautiful place, which is a jewel of Ploiesti, I am happy thatit will shelter those who have the calling of spreading justice".

@ Sarah Oleksik, Ruxandra Rădulescu, Lorna Foster and Ellie Paris.

@ Florin Andreescu, Gadi Habumugisha, Mikey Brand and Alina Negoiță.

As in Romania there are not too many photography festivals and almost none is concentrated on documentary photography, "Sequences" already made a great impact on the audience and our public is growing each year. We hope that soon will be a reference point regarding the quality of the work displayed, the artists we invite to participate and of course, the good feeling of a nice organized photography festival.

 @ Tom Kirby, Harriet Simmons, Gareth Jarvis, Diana Stanciu, Dafina Jeacă.

By helping us you will receive not only a great photography festival, but also unique prints and other treats. You can also help us as volunteers before and during the festival as we are in great need of this kind of help as well.

Please help us to share our campaign and festival, thank you!

Click here to see the available list of prints.

story:
The Once Home Story:

The Once Home project is organized by InLiquid, a non-profit organization dedicated to fostering the work of Philadelphia’s diverse community of artists. Over the past 20 years, InLiquid has worked with nearly 1,000 local painters, sculptors, photographers, and craftspeople.

Artists, Khalif Rivers and Howard Traivers each grew up alongside the collapse of manufacturing in Philadelphia. In 2015, Traivers became homeless and took shelter in the abandoned factory where his father was once employed. Rivers captures hidden remnants of industry within the city's unique landscape. Both artists have an uncanny ability to express emotion in photographs void of human presence; primarily desolate urban landscapes. 

These stories are increasingly important to tell in the context of South Kensington, Philadelphia where there is a surge of real estate development alongside the city’s largest homeless population. Homeless youth from local shelters will participate in discussions and art-making workshops in the exhibition at InLiquid Gallery.

When you choose to support Once Home, you are giving a voice to artists who would not otherwise have the resources to print, frame, and display their work. You are giving a platform for their stories to be told. Your generosity further extends to the next generation when InLiquid uses this platform as a venue for art-making workshops for 30-50 homeless youth to express themselves among their peers.

What we need:

  • InLiquid is raising funds to cover the cost of printing and framing Rivers’ and Traivers’ photographs for the free, public exhibition in South Kensington, Philadelphia. These costs are estimated at $2,500 or more.
  • Your funding will also cover the costs of paying professional teaching artists and buying supplies to hold weekend workshops for 30 – 50 homeless youth in our gallery. These costs are approximately $350 - $500 per workshop.
  • Beyond the basic costs of producing the exhibition and workshops, InLiquid would like to pay each artist an honorarium of $500 or more for the time they have dedicated to creating work for the exhibition. As a part of its mission, InLiquid believes that it is important to support our diverse community of artists in their creative endeavors.
  • Your support will enable InLiquid to produce and print bilingual educational materials about the Once Home project to continue an open dialogue within our diverse community.

What you get:

  • When you support Once Home, InLiquid will publicly recognize you as an important contributor to the project! Thank you!
  • Your gift is tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law!
  • Contributors of $100 or more will receive prints of some of the photographs in the exhibition.
  • Contributors of $500 or more will also receive tickets to InLiquid’s Benefit Art Auction and 20th Anniversary Party.
  • All donors are encouraged to attend the free public exhibition of Rivers & Traivers photographs in April of 2020!

Your impact:

  • When you support the work of Howard Traivers and Khalif Rivers, you recognize the cultural contributions of two self-taught African-American photographers whose stories are seldom told, yet are an important part of our creative community.
  • Your support allows 30-50 of Philadelphia’s homeless youth to visit the exhibition and work with professional teaching artists to express themselves in words and images. Students will share their work with their peers and can choose to display their work in the gallery, furthering a public dialogue around homelessness.
  • When you support Once Home exhibition and education project, you create a free, shared space in the community for new and old neighbors to come together and experience our Philadelphia neighborhood through the eyes of Howard Traivers and Khalif Rivers. It will be a place for reflection and discussion.
  • Your support allows InLiquid to produce educational materials in both English and Spanish so that all of our neighbors can participate and be a part of this important project. Thank you!

 

Risks and Challenges:

InLiquid is a nonprofit organization based in Philadelphia that has supported the work of local artists for 20 years. Because the Once Home artists cannot produce and frame their photographs on their own, we are asking for your help. 

There is a risk that InLiquid might not meet its funding goal. We are prepared to find a way with whatever funding we receive to produce a meaningful and thought-provoking exhibition. If we don’t meet our goal, we may need to forgo framing, or reduce the size or number of prints exhibited. With creativity, we will find a way!

InLiquid is partnering with local homeless shelters and service organizations to provide workshops for the city’s homeless youth and has already had a great response from local organizations. InLiquid is committed to producing at least 3 weekend workshops with 10 – 15 students each, and may need additional funds to schedule more based on demand.

Other ways you can help:

  • Share our Once Home Indegogo campaign with your friends!
  • Post a link on your Facebook page or other social media!
  • Visit the exhibition and bring your friends!
  • Visit InLiquid.org and join our mailing list for future projects!

Thank you!

*All photographs included in the campaign are by the artists who maintain the rights to their images. Color photographs are by Howard Traivers and black and white photographs are by Khalif Rivers.

story:
Architecture of Wings is a photographic series of dragonflies and their lattice-winged comrades.

======

how this started

This particular project began with two unexpected dragonfly visitors on my windowsill. Intrigued by the complex geometries created by their overlapping wings, I made a series of photographs and created a miniature portfolio in a limited edition of 100. It has become one of the giveaways to supporters, and can be seen here.

the project itself

The windowsill moment led to discoveries of other creatures with intricate wing structures, and to the idea of a larger photographic series containing dragonflies, damselflies, cicadas, and similar insects with ‘filigreed’ wings. This project will take a closer look at the extraordinary details in the sometimes-unlikely subjects around us. “Fragile magic” someone called it. The final product will be a series of archival portfolio prints. See giveaways at right for more detail.

nuts and bolts: specimen resources

One of the Smithsonian’s entomology collections will be a primary source of specimens, where they have drawers and drawers of bugs! Other specimens are being sought through word of mouth. And the insects I catch myself will be refrigerated to slow their metabolism enough to use as models and then released – living to tell the bizarre story of capture and release.

how you go about helping

If you are new to this approach to art patronage, here’s how it works: You click over on the right and make an underwriting pledge – like underwriting your favorite NPR or PBS program. And like underwriting an NPR or PBS program, you get a thank-you gift: a print or a complete portfolio. And like underwriting with NPR or PBS, you get to enable a project that specifically resonates with you. Please look to your right at the underwriters’ thank-you gifts, including large archival prints and a limited edition portfolio. Backers will have their choice of prints from the new collection.

why do it this way

And finally I want give a plug to IndieGoGo and similar grassroots artist support forums. Yes, it’s cool that they enable a project to happen, and yes, it’s cool that the supporters receive artwork at a greater value than the amount of their pledge. But the best part of it all is the conversation that emerges as like-minded people share and champion one another in work and art.

Thanks for checking out Architecture of Wings, and for your support!

story:
Μy name is Dimitris Lampropoulos and I am a freelancer photojournalist.

My work has been published in several international news agencies, such as AFP, Associated Press, Reuters, EPA, Anadolu.

After covering the deadly floods in Mandra, Greece, I had an accident with a motorcycle while I was approaching the firefighters who where trying to rescue an old man.

Unfortunately my camera was broke and my lense cant focus.

As everybody knows, times in Greece are difficult, a lot of people are struggling, including me, and I can't afford to buy new equipment and even by working hard everyday to collect money, it won't be enough to replace my camera as I participate in covering the living cost of my family, rent, bills, no need to explain, you know what I am talking about...

GOALS

I need to raise the amount of 2000 EUR so that i will be able to continue to work and to improve my skills as a photographer.

OTHER WAYS TO PARTICIPATE

If it's not possible for you to contribute financially, you can still help me by sharing the campaign around your friends, family and above all, spread the word!

Thank you so much for your support.

Dimitris Lampropoulos

 

Γεια σε όλους,

Το όνομά μου είναι Λαμπρόπουλος Δημήτρης και είμαι φωτορεπόρτερ. Καθώς κάλυπτα τις φονικές πλημμύρες στην Μάνδρα, Αττικής, είχα ένα ατύχημα με μηχανή στην προσπάθεια μου να προσεγγίσω ένα σημείο που έκανε διάσωση η ΕΜΑΚ με αποτέλεσμα η κάμερα μου να σπάσει και ο φακός να μην εστιάζει σωστά.

Όπως όλοι γνωρίζουν, στην Ελλάδα είναι δύσκολα, πολλοί άνθρωποι αγωνίζονται, συμπεριλαμβανομένου και εμού, και δεν μπορώ να αντέξω οικονομικά το να αγοράσω νέο εξοπλισμό, ακόμα και δουλεύοντας σκληρά καθημερινά για να συλλέξω τα χρήματα, αυτό δεν θα είναι αρκετό για να αντικαταστήσει τη φωτογραφική μηχανή μου γιατί συμμετέχω στην κάλυψη του κόστους διαβίωσης της οικογένειάς μου, ενοίκιο, λογαριασμοί, δεν χρειάζεται να εξηγήσω, ξέρετε τι εννοώ ...

ΣΤΟΧΟΙ

Με το ποσό των 2000 ευρώ, θα είμαι σε θέση να αγοράσω νέο εξοπλισμό και να συνεχίσω να εργάζομαι ως φωτογράφος. 

Άλλοι τρόποι ΣΥΜΜΕΤΟΧΗΣ

Αν δεν είναι δυνατό για σας να συνεισφέρετε οικονομικά το καταλαβαίνω, μπορείτε να με βοηθήσετε ακόμα και με το να μοιραστείτε την καμπάνια με τους φίλους, και την οικογένεια σας ώστε να εξαπλωθεί όσο το δυνατόν περισσότερο!

Σας ευχαριστώ πολύ για την υποστήριξή σας.

Δημήτρης Λαμπρόπουλος

story:
Hello!

Hopefully some of you already know who I am and what I'm about. For those of you that don't, I am a professional cosplayer, model, comic book colorist. I also ran for office in the state of Arizona, I have passed legislature that benefits children, and I have fostered puppies this year.

I am a HUGE supporter of cosplay, as a craft, as a passion and as a means to live. I strongly believe cosplay is for everyone and I love the impact that it has had in my life. This book is a compilation of photos from my cosplay beginning plus some added content that has never been printed before. 12 Extra Pages!  <3

What We Need & What You Get

The Photobook series has been INSANELY successful! Thousands of books, which are comic sized, vibrant full color and filled with costumes, have gone with you faithful fans. However, Photobook 1 has not been available for 5 years! I decided to make an Ultimate Edition to bring this to more of you, my lovely fans and supporters.

So here is the detail of what the funds will be used for...

1) Printing and shipping.

2) As always, I make this. That means no extra cost and I pass that value to YOU.

The Impact

I have so many messages from people wanting to complete their collection with Photobook 1. I did several print runs of it back in 2012 and they flew off the shelves and off my convention table. These are very hard to find! To me, the book is a symbol of what cosplay can be, what it can do. And you get to have a copy of your own! It will also have additional content from that era as well, and we'll have some great extras and bonuses as well <3

Risks & Challenges

The normal spiel: I've taken on a substantial investment by curating images, building the book and finding good printing. This is on top of the time and effort of having built the costumes, shooting with the photographers and editing the images. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please please please, share! Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, etc etc That way no one misses out on this amazing book. Also, join my Patreon and see new content material first.

Exclusive Print 1 by Bald Pirate Photography

Exclusive Print 2  by Dan Wickline will be available in metal!

 

 

ADD ONS

PHOTOBOOK 3. For those of you yet to own my latest new book, The AZ Powergirl Photobook 3 is being made available to you at a discounted price for being a supporter of this campaign. To get Book 3, simply add $10 to your already existing pledge and you will receive both your incentive from this campaign and book 3. It's as simple as that!

STRETCH GOALS

Thanks in advance for supporting this book just as you have supported my cosplay overall. Here are some incentives to help things along. Don't forget to share this on your social media and watch the campaign for the book grow:

GOAL: 25 perks claimed. REWARD: Everyone participating in those pledges receives a free comic book sized print of me as Powergirl

GOAL:  50 book perks claimed  REWARD: Everyone participating in those pledges receives a free comic book sized print of me as White Phoenix

More stretch goals will be revealed as the lower ones are met!
story_txt:
Hello!
Hopefully some of you already know who I am and what I'm about. For those of you that don't, I am a professional cosplayer, model, comic book colorist. I also ran for office in the state of Arizona, I have passed legislature that benefits children, and I have fostered puppies this year.
I am a HUGE supporter of cosplay, as a craft, as a passion and as a means to live. I strongly believe cosplay is for everyone and I love the impact that it has had in my life. This book is a compilation of photos from my cosplay beginning plus some added content that has never been printed before. 12 Extra Pages!  <3

What We Need & What You Get
The Photobook series has been INSANELY successful! Thousands of books, which are comic sized, vibrant full color and filled with costumes, have gone with you faithful fans. However, Photobook 1 has not been available for 5 years! I decided to make an Ultimate Edition to bring this to more of you, my lovely fans and supporters.
So here is the detail of what the funds will be used for...
1) Printing and shipping.
2) As always, I make this. That means no extra cost and I pass that value to YOU.

The Impact
I have so many messages from people wanting to complete their collection with Photobook 1. I did several print runs of it back in 2012 and they flew off the shelves and off my convention table. These are very hard to find! To me, the book is a symbol of what cosplay can be, what it can do. And you get to have a copy of your own! It will also have additional content from that era as well, and we'll have some great extras and bonuses as well <3


Risks & Challenges
The normal spiel: I've taken on a substantial investment by curating images, building the book and finding good printing. This is on top of the time and effort of having built the costumes, shooting with the photographers and editing the images. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please please please, share! Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, etc etc That way no one misses out on this amazing book. Also, join my Patreon and see new content material first.

Exclusive Print 1 by Bald Pirate Photography

Exclusive Print 2  by Dan Wickline will be available in metal!
 

 
ADD ONS
PHOTOBOOK 3. For those of you yet to own my latest new book, The AZ Powergirl Photobook 3 is being made available to you at a discounted price for being a supporter of this campaign. story:
My Story

I'm Kitty McGilliwiggles, or that's what my pen-name and artist equivalent is. I graduated from Drexel University's Media Arts school in 2011. I have a Nikon D80 I bargained from a relative, along with a small daylight-balanced fluorescent light kit. I'm working freelance photography gigs in the Northern Virginia area; portraits, pet portraits, small event photography, landscape art prints...Black and white or full color. I could still use a few sundry bits of equipment, a warm-toned reflector umbrella, sheets of color gels, and high-output fluorescent lamps balanced to 3200K. I also need to pay start-up business administrative fees, like the fee to register my trade name with the county and the fee to declare candidacy for a certification from the Professional Photographers of America. I'd also like to make the switch from Photoshop Elements 10 to full Photoshop, and that software is several hundred dollars.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I've set the goal at $1450. Raising the funds through IndieGoGo, using Paypal, and accepting credit card transactions will incur fees for me. There is a buffer on my goal to cover the maximum IndieGoGo fees and still allow plenty of funds for me to square away my business administrative costs. If I don't reach the goal, I'll still be I'll still be paying for those things in the long run, after I have several paying gigs. First thing on my list is registering my trade name, next stronger lamps for my light fixtures, then the CPP test from the PPA. Being a new business, that credential could really give me some legitimacy and then people will grumble less about paying me the same rates as "established" photographers.

 

I know people are going to want something in return, so I've got a few ideas for that.

> $15 earns you a full resolution landscape jpeg, watermarked in the corner

> $30 earns you an 8.5"x11" glossy landscape print

> $50 earns you a half-hour portrait session, 15-30 jpegs, watermarked (must be redeemed within 25 miles of 22153 zip code area)

> $100 earns you a full-hour portrait session, 30-60 jpegs, watermarked (must be redeemed within 25 miles of 22153 zip code area)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! The more people who contribute the less each person needs to contribute to help me reach my goal. Share it anywhere you think someone might see it and want to help.

story:
Project Istwa is a non-profit organization* dedicated to the promotion of self-empowerment, awareness and self-expression through the use of photography. Due to the large youth population in Haiti, and the potential positive role of youth on Haiti’s future, Project Istwa operates under the belief that it is especially important to amplify what youth want to communicate on behalf of themselves and their communities. Grounded in the principles of photovoice, Project Istwa provides youth with cameras and asks them to share their stories and their voices through their photos.

The Workshops:

Each workshop is tailored as specifically as possible to each individual group of participants in order to reflect community’s context. At the end of each workshop week, a public community exhibit is held to showcase the participants’ perspectives and voices.

Where We Have Been:

• Pétion-Ville, Port-au-Prince: January 3 - 9, 2012
• Cité Soleil, Port-au-Prince: July 11 - 17, 2011

Where We Are Going:

• Hinche: June 29 - July 8, 2012
• Port Salut: July 8 – 18, 2012
• Jacmel: July 18 – 25, 2012

Where the money goes:

All funds raised will go towards to implementation of this summer's 3 workshops, which includes but is not limited to supplies necessary to conduct the workshops (ie printer ink, photo paper, mats, small albums, etc) housing, ground transportation and serving lunch to the participants every day. All volunteers purchase their own plane tickets to Haiti and their meals for the day.

Project Istwa plans to conduct at least one workshop in each of the ten departments in Haiti, as well as the batays (impoverished areas where Haitian migrant workers reside) in the Dominican Republic.

Beyond the Workshops
Efforts to create long-term, sustainable relationships with Project Istwa alumni and their communities are in effect. Project Istwa strives for 100% school enrollment amongst alumni.

 

*By Federal law Project Istwa is able to operate as a fully functioning non-profit organization and receive tax-deductible donations while its application for 501(c)3 status is under review by the IRS. Tax-deductible donation letters will be issued after Project Istwa Inc. receives its determination letter from the IRS.

story:
DO YOU LOVE TREES?

White Willow tree (Salix alba), South Island, New Zealand

 

As TreeGirl, my passion is not only to meet new trees, learn about them, and photograph myself with them, but to inspire others to connect intimately and soulfully with wild nature.

Brush Box tree (Lophostemon confertus), Australia

As a fine-art photographer, certified arborist and naturalist, conservation educator, and forest ecotherapist, over the past 20 years I have climbed, listened to, intertwined with, and photographed myself in the nude with over 70 spectacular species of trees all over the world, with the aid of my tripod and remote control.

               

Why? Because it is an unparalleled experience to bond with nature! Trees are my love, my family, my community, my home. And I want to show that trees are not only integral for the functioning of the planet, but they also can be a resource for inspiration, wisdom, energy, companionship and allyship for all of us.    

 

There is no other book like this!

 

The TreeGirl book combines fine-art nude photography, with natural history and the ecopsychology of the human-tree relationship.

Morton Bay Fig tree (Ficus macrophylla), Australia

 

TreeGirl: Intimate Encounters with Wild Nature

goes beyond classic pictures of nature or the female nude; it captures dynamic relationships between living beings, while inviting possibilities for the reader's own interspecies connections.

Monterey Cypress tree (Cupressus macrocarpa), North Island, New Zealand

 

The TreeGirl book is an invitation for you to come home to wild nature.

Green Fig (Ficus virens), Australia

 

BOOK DESCRIPTION:

TreeGirl: Intimate Encounters with Wild Nature  is:

• A stunning, full-color, clothbound, hardcover coffee-table book

• A collection of over 150 photographs, including 20 new tree species not yet in my TreeGirl website gallery—with some images never before seen.

• 200 pages in an 11-by-11 inch format.

• Printed on 100% post-consumer-waste recycled paper.

• Foreworded by Fred Hageneder, German music composer and author of seven books on the ethnobotany and spirituality of trees. http://www.themeaningoftrees.com/about

• Gorgeously designed by Annett Boerner from Australia.

• The first book of its kind, combining photography, natural history, and ecopsychology.

 

All of the photographs were taken by me, with the exception of two collaborations with Devin Fleurdujon and Caiyloirch Rupert Marques,

and  13 botanical natural history photos from talented photographers, including: Marilyn McFarlin, Hal Brindley, Dave Ingram, Martin Fletcher, Kristen Rasmussen, Annett Boerner and Dean Nicolle.

 

TABLE OF CONTENTS

The TreeGirl book goes behind the scenes of what it is to be TreeGirl, and answers questions tree lovers have about these spectacular trees.

 

In the TreeGirl book, you will find photographs and writing of my 50 favorite species. Some of the trees pictured are the oldest, the tallest, and the biggest of their species. And because people always want to know about these trees, the photos are accompanied by their natural history, ethnobotany, conservation status, and narrative captions of my wild encounter with each tree.

SAMPLE PAGES INCLUDING PHOTOS, NATURAL HISTORY AND STORY

Interwoven with the species profiles are five essays that holistically address aspects of the human-tree relationship:

• the sensual (physical)

• the biophilic (ecopsychological)

• the arboricultural (ecological)

• the archetypal (spiritual), and

 • the practical ways in which readers can rewild themselves and have their own intimate encounters with nature (therapeutic).

 

People love this beautiful book, and it hasn't even been released yet. Read some of the Advance Praise for the Book:

 

The core of the book's message is:

We can repair our collective cultural disconnection from Nature by rediscovering trees as allies and as a sanctuary from the madness of modern technological civilization.

3000 year-old Panosos Olive tree (Olea europaea), Crete, Greece

 

BOOK PRODUCTION & TIMELINE:

SEPTEMBER 25th: The Campaign starts! At the end of this month, 2,000 TreeGirl books will go to print in Germany! (Why Germany? It was more affordable than other countries, with precision one can count on, and the ability to get 100% post-consumer waste recycled paper!)

OCTOBER: The Campaign ends at midnight (PST) October 25th!  Trees and tree lovers all over the world celebrate! The books get boxed and head over the Atlantic Ocean on a long ocean voyage!

NOVEMBER: The books are still sailing over the Atlantic, till at last...

DECEMBER 1-ish:  The TreeGirl books arrive like a grateful immigrants, passing efficiently through customs blessed by the tree angels. They are delivered to my distributor's warehouse in Tennessee, who then ships some special boxes to me overnight, to give you as Indiegogo Perks in time for the Holiday Season!

JANUARY 15th: The TreeGirl book is available for purchase in bookstores nationwide, including online at Amazon.com and Barnes and Noble.com in the US. It will also be distributed in Canada and the UK. The book becomes an instant best-seller thanks to your continued sharing!

 

COST OF THE BOOK:

This book has been a labor of love for the trees! There are many costs to writing and self-publishing a full-color book. Over the past eight years, I have personally invested tens of thousands of dollars into creating this first-of-its-kind book, including travel expenses, photographic equipment, workshops, research, consulting, assistance, professional editing, professional book design, and miscellaneous technical and professional expenses.

I estimate the total cost of this project to be over $100K, including the upcoming costs of printing and promotion. The TreeGirl book itself is priced to retail at an affordable $45.

 

Your reward for contributing $55 or more to this campaign  will be to receive your own personally signed pre-published copy before it's available anywhere else!

After this campaign, personally signed books will only be available at TreeGirl book events.

 

And, if you contribute $200 or more, you can also receive other exclusive Indiegogo Perks, including limited edition fine-art prints,

being photographed by TreeGirl,

 

or the ultimate Perk: the once-in-a-life-time opportunity to accompany TreeGirl on an all expense paid international photo shoot adventure!

 

HOW YOU ARE SUPPORTING THE BOOK:

1. By sharing this campaign on all your social media, and liking my FaceBook Page: https://www.facebook.com/TreeGirlPhoto/

2. By telling all your nature-loving friends and family about the TreeGirl book.

3. By suggesting locations, radio shows and podcasts for TreeGirl book presentations.

4. By contributing as much as your heart can to this campaign now!

 

Not only are you helping TreeGirl finish paying for her eight-year personal investment in this project, but you are also helping the trees themselves.

10% of the funds raised in this campaign will go toward tropical reforestation projects via TreeGirl's partnership with the successful, woman-powered www.treesisters.org!

THE CAMPAIGN GOAL:

 Minimum: $25,000

Ideal: $45,000

Since 10% of the funds raised goes to Indiegogo, and 10% goes to TreeSisters to fund reforestation projects, if the ideal goal is reached, the TreeGirl book project will receive $36,000. Promotion is critical, especially for a self-published book. Any funding over the goal is deeply appreciated, from the bottom of my TreeGirl heart, as it will not only help pay off the initial personal investment of self-publishing, but it will also provide the thousands of dollars still to be invested in promotion and book tours.

 

Why not buy your holiday gifts now?

Imagine how much your tree-loving friends will love you  when you give each of them their very own signed copy of TreeGirl: Intimate Encounters with Wild Nature!

Each and every contribution is vital to the birth of this book

and for thousands of trees!


THANK YOU for your heartfelt generosity

and please share this campaign!

(note: the Share Icons next to the BACK IT Button, sometimes do not show up on certain browsers like Chrome. Try Safari)

LET'S GO-GO!!!

story:
The Project...

Or should I say projects?!

Project 1

On my expedition along the entire Cornish coastline I plan to photograph every beach, creating a consistent catalogue of the coast that surrounds this land steeped in rich history.

The future is yet unwritten for British coastlines, if we lose our sandy (and some not so sandy) shores it is important that future generations have a document of what was lost.

I plan to develop these images into a book at a later date.

Project 2 

The sand! Oh what an underrated beauty sand beholds, and not just as a collective on a beach, each individual grain is a historical imprint on the landscape, be it a microscope speck of what was once a shell that belonged to an extinct Mollusc, or a tiny piece of hard coral.

I will collect a very small sand sample from every accessible beach I encounter, I will upon my return, using a microscope, create a series of images allowing an insight into the microscopic world and hopefully develop them into a book.

 

 

The Route!

I will arrive in Plymouth and immediately head south along the coastal path, passing by familiar and not so familiar coastal towns and locations such as; Looe, Charlestown, Roseland, Falmouth, Lizard, Penzance right down to Lands end. I will then head along the North shore past St Ives, Godrevy, Newquay, Port Isaac, Widemouth until I reach just north of Bude.

 

Your Contribution!

Every penny that people are so kind to donate will go towards supplies for the trip itself, camping gear, food, camera film (that's right I said film!), ferry fares (this is a hike not a swim!) In return for your kind contribution I have listed some wonderful thank you gifts and perks!

story:
The History

Earlier this year i undertook one of my biggest photographic projects to date, entitled "The Dark Carnival" An idea i had in my mind for the past few years to bring to life a forgotten carnival, with slight horror elements and a feel of the macabre,

I finally bit the bullet and started planning the shoot, 3 months from start to finish with 7 models, designers, costume makers, stylists and makeup artists involved on the day. The photoshoot was a complete success, it was everything i had wanted it to be, the budget was zero and the final results were spectacular. 

The Second Coming. 

So why you may ask, do i want to do another project of the same theme? The answer is simple, to aim higher. 

The last project was planned from nothing, it cost nothing, the models, and everyone involved gave up their time for free to be involved. We shot at an outdoor location in public space. But with last minute changes, models dropping out and a costume designer pulling out a few days before, it wasn't everything it could have been. I always had the idea in my mind to make it huge, with 7 different characters on set for it there was an element of grandeur and lost decadence. 

But it was missing certain aspects, more characters i had planned, more extravagant costumes, a larger gore element and more props that better suited the visual styling which was almost impossible to achieve with no budget. 


The Plan.

Simply, to go bigger! Bolder! By Crowdfunding the project with a small budget, it will enable me to finally bring the Dark Carnival to it's full potential. Hiring a venue to work at for a day or weekend, buying / hiring costumes, building set pieces and props. hiring larger lighting kits. Being able to hire prosthetic artists, fire performers (and Health and safety people) the list goes on. 

The ideal would be to create not just static photography but create moving image, to bring the characters to life, to bring movement to an otherwise fixed world. To create a short video telling the stories of how the characters came to be that way. Unfortunatly i am unable to produce video with my current photography equipment, however if this project exceeds it's funding goals, any extra money would be used to invest in video equipment or to hire a videographer / film maker to assist on the project. 

A small contribution could make for a huge difference. As mentioned, the last project was built from nothing and the results (In my eyes) were amazing. The sequel will be nothing short of spectacular. 

The Result.

So why am i doing this at all? Honestly, because i enjoy photography, i enjoy creating art. Provocative, sensual, scary, disturbing. Bringing to life the images in my head for no reason other than because i can do so through the medium of photography.

The final work will be used mostly for showcasing myself and Darkslide Photography. To submit to publication and eventually to bring together in an art book, calendar or similar. 

When.

Aiming for photography to take place mid november with a release date of the work before Christmas.
story_txt:
The History
Earlier this year i undertook one of my biggest photographic projects to date, entitled "The Dark Carnival" An idea i had in my mind for the past few years to bring to life a forgotten carnival, with slight horror elements and a feel of the macabre,
I finally bit the bullet and started planning the shoot, 3 months from start to finish with 7 models, designers, costume makers, stylists and makeup artists involved on the day. The photoshoot was a complete success, it was everything i had wanted it to be, the budget was zero and the final results were spectacular. 
The Second Coming. 
So why you may ask, do i want to do another project of the same theme? The answer is simple, to aim higher. 
The last project was planned from nothing, it cost nothing, the models, and everyone involved gave up their time for free to be involved. We shot at an outdoor location in public space. But with last minute changes, models dropping out and a costume designer pulling out a few days before, it wasn't everything it could have been. I always had the idea in my mind to make it huge, with 7 different characters on set for it there was an element of grandeur and lost decadence. 
But it was missing certain aspects, more characters i had planned, more extravagant costumes, a larger gore element and more props that better suited the visual styling which was almost impossible to achieve with no budget.

Hiring a venue to work at for a day or weekend, buying / hiring costumes, building set pieces and props. hiring larger lighting kits. Being able to hire prosthetic artists, fire performers (and Health and safety people) the list goes on.

story:
What this is all about...

I am a film photographer in Kelowna, B.C. I am an artist. I have been in business for a few years now and despite my efforts to build a successful business I've been struggle to keep things a float. I want to go to a workshop to learn all I can to help make this business successful. I don't want to let my failures to keep me from pushing forward. I am choosing to take a leap of faith and learn from the lovely Yan who just so happens to be killing it in her business. I want to build my business not only to keep the art of film photography alive but also to show families how beautiful they are through photographs. 

How you can help...

To get to the the workshop I have a goal of $2450 which will help us cover the workshop fee, the cost of gas to drive down, accomodations, and all the little things in between! 
I really want to continue building my business without letting failures or fears in the way. I truly believe a one on one workshop with Yan with will help me move my business closer to where I want it to be!

I am not sure if I can express how thankful I would be for any amount of support I receive but I will definitely try! There are perks you recieve for donating and for anyone who shares this on Facebook or Twitter make sure to comment below because I have something for you as well! 

Spread the word!

Even if you are unable to contribute you can hep us out a TON by sharing this campaign! Tell your friends, post it on facebook, on your blog, or anywhere else you like to post stuff!

story:
Short Summary

There are 2 collections of photos for sale at Cold Harbor Antiques, one of the renovation of the 2300 block of Broad Street from 1963 and another of the dedication of the WRVA building in 1968. 

The collected black and white photos are  from the estate of Bruce English (1960s president of the Historic Richmond Foundation). We posted about them recently on CHPN.

What We Need & What You Get

The two notebooks are $250 and $300. I propose to buy them, scan and share the photos, and then donate the photos to the Historic Richmond Foundation.

    The Impact

    These remarkable pre-digital photos capture very specific moments in Church Hill's history. It would be great to have them more readily available.

What We Need & What You Get The two notebooks are $250 and $300. I propose to buy them, scan and share the photos, and then donate the photos to the Historic Richmond Foundation.

  The Impact These remarkable pre-digital photos capture very specific moments in Church Hill's history. It would be great to have them more readily available.

story:
The project

"How the other half lives" is a photobook about stray cats. Through interviews with different stray cats we learn about their lives, about being down and out, segregated and discriminated. But we also read stories of real freedom and independence.

The black and white photographs (shot on Hasselblad 500 c/m) show the cats' environment: Courtyards, backstreets and abandoned buildings, all showing signs of decay. And then we see them: Strong personalities, full of dignity.

The book is a sometimes harsh commentary on modern day (cat-)society, representing a totally unbalanced view. It's the stray cat's vision of things, very different from what a domesticated cat would tell you.

Some quotes from some of the cats:


The production

After almost two years of work on the project, "How the other half lives" will be released in late April 2015. It will be my 5th self-published title.

I have been committed to self-publishing for many years now. I understand it as a way to stay independent from the demand of the editorial- and art-market and thus being able to produce works without making any compromises.

The aim of this crowdfunding campaign is to raise a part of the book's production costs (I'd like to raise half of the costs here and put the other half myself, I am still negotiating with 3 printers/binderies, as soon as I have a precise estimation of costs, I will give you an update, just to keep things transparent). The overall costs are very low as printing and binding are the only parts of the process I won't do myself. All the rest is essentially a one-person job: I did the photography, the layout and the overall design-concept of the book and will do the reproduction (scanning analogue hand-prints of the negatives) and pre-print processing. Like this I don't have to pay any designer, lab-guy, editor or publisher and you get a very well produced book for very little money. To guarantee this, I collaborate with cutting edge printers and binders here in Berlin where I live and can control the whole production.

Still you shouldn't expect a perfect product like the ones you would get from a big publisher. And that's part of the idea: The book is gonna have its edges and will have a raw feeling to it. Unlike the typical coffee-table book.


The book

(please be aware that all images show the handbound dummy and not the final book)

specifications:

paper and linen bound hardcover

blind debossing on the backcover

red headband

gray endpapers

92 pages

page dimensions: 21 x 24,7 cm (8.25 x 9.45 inch)

edition of 1000 (first 100 copies signed/numbered, reserved for funders)

Offset printing

matt, off-white (grayish) 170g/m2 paper

planned retail price: 29-32€


Challenges

As I have 5 years of experience in the field of self-publishing (apart from various collaborations with publishers) I think it's safe to say that I know what is expecting me. So there shouldn't be any mayor setbacks. Of course I could always get ill, but if I cannot make it to the post-office to send you your book or shirt, I'm sure I'll find a friend who'll do so.
If I don't arrive at the aim of $4200 (about 3600 €), the book will still be produced and you will still receive your reward. I would then only need to deal with a bank which I would love to avoid.



The author

I'm a freelance photographer living in Berlin and mostly work on my own documentary (or half-way fiction) projects.

My works have been exhibited in cultural institutions, museums and festivals in Spain, France, Italy, Turkey, Germany, Poland, Latvia, the Netherlands, China, Brazil and Venezuela.

They have also been exhibited on the streets and inside of a truck, never in a commercial gallery.

If you support me and my project, you support somebody who tries to keep his personal work as free as possible from any commercial compromises and as honest as possible to my own believes and convictions. "How the other half lives" is one of these works.

Here you can see more of my work: www.nicobaumgarten.net


Thank you so much for your support!



The rewards (perks)

All the rewards include shipping expenses.

Most of the rewards are handmade items.

My previous titles (of which only few copies remain) are all hand-bound by myself and I also do the screen-printing on the shirts.

I haven't made the shirts yet, but they will have this screenprint on the front:

As soon as I get busy screenprinting these shirts, I will update this here. I will also upload photographs of the set of photo-cards, the stickers and the handprinted card.

story:
The Vision

For as long as I can remember, train travel has been something that I've loved.  Seeing our beautiful country speed by as I travel to my destination... there's really nothing quite like it. 

In a few months, I plan to blend my love of riding the rails with my love of photography as I embark on a cross country train trip that will take me coast to coast and back.  During my trip, I will be training my camera on the beautiful countryside, from the Plains States, to the wonders of the Rocky Mountains, to the colorful desert landscapes and the alluring Pacific Coastline.  The best part is, I will be doing all of this from the window of my train car.  I want to show everyone just how beautiful our America is, and how much of it you can see from the generous windows of a passenger train.  I will be posting live on social media the whole way, taking you on the trip with me!

"Can You Take Good Photos From a Train?"

Actually, some of my favorite photos I've ever taken (including the one above) have been from the window of a train.  Trains often travel through some of the most picturesque parts of our country, featuring views of big cities, small towns and brilliant American landscapes!

"Why Should I Pay for Your Vacation?"

That's a great question.  This will not be a vacation so much as a chance to take a creative adventure that will lead to some beautiful photographs and eventually, a stunning photo book.  Even at the $5 level, you will receive a photo from my trip!  Think of is as buying a piece of art before it's created... and more than that, knowing that your contribution helped create it!

I intend to work hard, using my photography skills and equipment to capture our beautiful nation as it speeds by.  While I love riding the rails and I love photography, I have a goal on this journey, and that is to produce a unique and magical photographic story of the visual wonders of this nation, and do it all by train.

The reason I need your help is simply the fact that a trip like this is very costly and fronting the cash on a photographer's salary is just not possible.  I'm gonna need a little help along the way ;-)

"What's In It For Me?"

Another outstanding question.  Other than having my undying gratitude and constant shout outs on social media, as well as your name on my website and the photo book I will be publishing, you will receive free prints and even copies of my photo book for generous contributors!

"Why Do This At All?"

Because I truly believe that I have the opportunity to do something that nobody else has ever done, or at least not to this magnitude.  I truly believe that as a photographer, I can show people how gorgeous this country really is, and how much you can see it simply by hopping on a train and taking an adventure.  I can't wait to show America just how amazing it is!  Help me by walking this journey with me!
