story:
Short Summary

A  photographic book about Saharawi people living in a refugee camps in Algeria. They have been waiting 40 years to come back to their homeland Western Sahara which is currently occupied by Moroccans. Together we can bring more awarnes about this conflict by publishing a book about them via crowdfunding. All the profit from selling the book will be sent to the children's library in one of the refugees camps in Algeria.

Breve Sumario
Este es un libro fotográfico sobre el pueblo saharaui que vive en campamentos de refugiados en Argelia. Este pueblo ha estado esperando 40 años para regresar a su patria el Sáhara Occidental, que está actualmente ocupada por los marroquíes. Con la ayuda de todos ustedes, quiero publicar un libro sobre ellos a través de crowdfunding, y enviar todas las ganancias de la venta a la biblioteca infantil en uno de los campamentos de refugiados en Argelia.



The Camps

The camps are located near Tindouf in Western Algeria. The place is called "The Devil's Garden' and there is a reason for that -- the temperatures in summer can easily reach over 50 degrees C. There are 6 in total temporary settlements, refugee camps where live approximately 160,000 people surviving on aid from international community.
In 1975 the last African colony, Western Sahara has been invaded by Moroccans and many people has been forced to exile from their country. Even though under international law the invasion in 1975 was illegal and in 1991 Morocco agreed on referendum Saharawi people are still waiting for resolution for this conflict as well as for their referendum. 

Los Campamentos
Los campamentos se encuentran cerca de Tinduf en el occidente de Argelia. El lugar se llama "El jardín del diablo" y hay una razón para esto: las temperaturas en verano pueden llegar fácilmente a más de 50 grados C. Hay un total de 6 asentamientos temporales, campamentos de refugiados donde viven aproximadamente 160.000 personas que sobreviven con ayuda de la comunidad internacional. En 1975, la última colonia en África, el Sáhara Occidental, fue invadida por los marroquíes y mucha gente fue forzada a exiliarse de su país. Aunque, según el derecho internacional, la invasión de 1975 fue ilegal, y en 1991 Marruecos aceptó hacer un referéndum, el pueblo saharaui todavía está a la espera de la resolución de este conflicto, así como de su referéndum.


My Experience

I visited Sahrawi refugee camps in Sahara by a chance. I was exposed to a simple and harsh life people living there. My experience was so strong that just after a month I had to come back to the same place again. I  started to take quick snapshots  to capture just the experience of the moment of being there. Why I found the camps so fascinated? I guess the journeys changed my point of view on different things. Definitely taught me a lot about patience and human dignity. Was unforgettable journey both mentally and physically. 

Mi Experiencia
Visité los campamentos de refugiados saharauis en el desierto del Sáhara por casualidad. Estuve expuesto a la dura y simple vida de la gente que vive allí. Mi experiencia fue tan fuerte que sólo después de un mes tuve que volver al mismo lugar. Empecé a tomar rápidas instantáneas para capturar sólo la experiencia del momento de estar allí. ¿Por qué me parecieron tan fascinantes estos campamentos? Supongo que el viaje ha cambiado mi punto de vista sobre muchas cosas. Definitivamente me enseñó mucho sobre la paciencia y la dignidad humana. Fue un viaje inolvidable, tanto mental como físicamente.

 

The Book

The book will contain combination of the photographs from the camps as well as graphics created based on satellite images of the camps from the space. There are two tiltles of this book '40' which refers to the number of years the Saharawi people have been waiting to come back to their homeland and 'Place which does not exist' (in arabic) which refers to their current political status. Presented pictures are fruits of my recent trip to Sahrawi camps in Algeria. 

Technical information:

Size of the book: A5 

COVER: Hardboard  

INTERIOR: 108 Pages. 

Paper: matt 120 g/m2.

Paints: Four colours.

BINDING: INTEGRAL

Text in Spanish, English and Arabic

Estimated delivery time end of December 2015 beginning of January 2016.

before Christmas 2015


El Libro 

El libro contendrá una combinación de las fotografías de los campamentos, así como gráficos creados en base a las imágenes satelitales de los campamentos desde el espacio. Hay dos títulos para este libro: "40", que se refiere al número de años que el pueblo saharaui ha estado esperando para regresar a su patria y "El lugar que no existe" (en árabe) que se refiere a su situación política actual. Las fotografías presentadas son el fruto de mi reciente viaje a los campamentos saharauis en Argelia.

Información técnica: 

El tamaño del libro: A5 

CUBIERTA: de tapa dura

INTERIOR:  108 páginas. 

Papel: mate 120 g/m2. 

Tintas: cuatro colores. 

ENCUADERNACION: integral (en espiral)

Texto completo en español, inglés y árabe.



The Founding

Your contribution will be allocated to :

• To pay for the costs of printing the book and the rewards (photographic prints).

• Once the donations are awarded, the rest of the money will go to the children's library in one of the refugees camps in Algeria.

This is the only source of funding. I choosed a flexible type of funding which means that even if I will not reach my goal I still will be able to print books and send the remaining money to the children's library in the camps. However more people will contribute the cost of printing will be cheaper and more money will be send to the camps. 

La Financiación

Tu contribución será asignada: 

• Para pagar los gastos de la impresión del libro y las recompensas (impresiones fotográficas). 

• Una vez que las donaciones hayan sido asignadas, el resto del dinero se destinará a la biblioteca infantil en uno de los campamentos de refugiados en Argelia.

Esta es la única fuente de financiación. Elegí un tipo de financiación flexible que significa que aunque si no llegue a mi objetivo, aún seré capaz de imprimir libros y enviar el dinero restante para la biblioteca infantil en los campamentos. Sin embargo, mientras  más gente contribuya con el costo de impresión, será más barato y se enviará más dinero a los campamentos.



The Impact 


The aims of publishing this book are:

— to bring more awareness about situation in Western Sahara. I believe that unresolved conflict in Western Sahara in relatively unknown especially to people from english speaking countries and as the time passes the frustration between Saharawis grows -- it would be a shame if the only solution for resolving this forgotten conflict was returning to war.  

— to rise the money for the children's library in Bojador. I have contacted Sahara Bubisher http://www.bubisher.org/ non profit organisation which helps to rise money for the libraries in the camps. They kindly support my project -- all the profit from that action will be sent to them. I will update information about how much money has been raised on that webpage as well as on my project's facebook webpage.  


El  Impacto

Los objetivos de la publicación de este libro son:

 -crear más conciencia acerca de la situación en el Sáhara Occidental. Creo que este conflicto sin resolver del Sáhara Occidental es relativamente desconocido, especialmente entre personas procedentes de países de habla inglesa, y ` medida que pasa más tiempo, la frustración entre los saharauis crece. Sería una lástima que la única solución para resolver este conflicto olvidado fuera la vuelta a la guerra.


- Aumentar el dinero para la biblioteca infantil en Bojador. Me he puesto en contacto con Sahara Bubisher http://www.bubisher.org/, una organización sin fines de lucro que ayuda a recoger el dinero para las bibliotecas en los campamentos.  Bubisher está apoyando mi proyecto. Todas las ganancias de esta acción serán enviadas a esta organización. Actualizaré la información de cuánto dinero se ha recogido en su página web, así como también en mi proyecto de página de Facebook.



Pictures of the book:





Pictures of the limited handmade edition:
story_txt:
Short Summary
A  photographic book about Saharawi people living in a refugee camps in Algeria. They have been waiting 40 years to come back to their homeland Western Sahara which is currently occupied by Moroccans. Together we can bring more awarnes about this conflict by publishing a book about them via crowdfunding. All the profit from selling the book will be sent to the children's library in one of the refugees camps in Algeria.

Breve Sumario
Este es un libro fotográfico sobre el pueblo saharaui que vive en campamentos de refugiados en Argelia. Este pueblo ha estado esperando 40 años para regresar a su patria el Sáhara Occidental, que está actualmente ocupada por los marroquíes. Con la ayuda de todos ustedes, quiero publicar un libro sobre ellos a través de crowdfunding, y enviar todas las ganancias de la venta a la biblioteca infantil en uno de los campamentos de refugiados en Argelia.




The Camps
The camps are located near Tindouf in Western Algeria. The place is called "The Devil's Garden' and there is a reason for that -- the temperatures in summer can easily reach over 50 degrees C. There are 6 in total temporary settlements, refugee camps where live approximately 160,000 people surviving on aid from international community.
In 1975 the last African colony, Western Sahara has been invaded by Moroccans and many people has been forced to exile from their country. Even though under international law the invasion in 1975 was illegal and in 1991 Morocco agreed on referendum Saharawi people are still waiting for resolution for this conflict as well as for their referendum. 


Los Campamentos


Los campamentos se encuentran cerca de Tinduf en el occidente de Argelia. El lugar se llama "El jardín del diablo" y hay una razón para esto: las temperaturas en verano pueden llegar fácilmente a más de 50 grados C. Hay un total de 6 asentamientos temporales, campamentos de refugiados donde viven aproximadamente 160.000 personas que sobreviven con ayuda de la comunidad internacional. En 1975, la última colonia en África, el Sáhara Occidental, fue invadida por los marroquíes y mucha gente fue forzada a exiliarse de su país. Aunque, según el derecho internacional, la invasión de 1975 fue ilegal, y en 1991 Marruecos aceptó hacer un referéndum, el pueblo saharaui todavía está a la espera de la resolución de este conflicto, así como de su referéndum.




My Experience
I visited Sahrawi refugee camps in Sahara by a chance. I was exposed to a simple and harsh life people living there. My experience was so strong that just after a month I had to come back to the same place again. I  started to take quick snapshots  to capture just the experience of the moment of being there. Why I found the camps so fascinated? I guess the journeys changed my point of view on different things. Definitely taught me a lot about patience and human dignity. Was unforgettable journey both mentally and physically. 


Mi Experiencia


Visité los campamentos de refugiados saharauis en el desierto del Sáhara por casualidad. Estuve expuesto a la dura y simple vida de la gente que vive allí. Mi experiencia fue tan fuerte que sólo después de un mes tuve que volver al mismo lugar. Empecé a tomar rápidas instantáneas para capturar sólo la experiencia del momento de estar allí. ¿Por qué me parecieron tan fascinantes estos campamentos? Supongo que el viaje ha cambiado mi punto de vista sobre muchas cosas. Definitivamente me enseñó mucho sobre la paciencia y la dignidad humana. Fue un viaje inolvidable, tanto mental como físicamente.



 
The Book
The book will contain combination of the photographs from the camps as well as graphics created based on satellite images of the camps from the space. There are two tiltles of this book '40' which refers to the number of years the Saharawi people have been waiting to come back to their homeland and 'Place which does not exist' (in arabic) which refers to their current political status. Presented pictures are fruits of my recent trip to Sahrawi camps in Algeria. 
Technical information:


Size of the book: A5 
COVER: Hardboard  
INTERIOR: 108 Pages. 
Paper: matt 120 g/m2.
Paints: Four colours.
BINDING: INTEGRAL
Text in Spanish, English and Arabic
Estimated delivery time end of December 2015 beginning of January 2016.
before Christmas 2015


El Libro 

El libro contendrá una combinación de las fotografías de los campamentos, así como gráficos creados en base a las imágenes satelitales de los campamentos desde el espacio. Hay dos títulos para este libro: "40", que se refiere al número de años que el pueblo saharaui ha estado esperando para regresar a su patria y "El lugar que no existe" (en árabe) que se refiere a su situación política actual. Las fotografías presentadas son el fruto de mi reciente viaje a los campamentos saharauis en Argelia.
Información técnica: 
El tamaño del libro: A5 
CUBIERTA: de tapa dura
INTERIOR:  108 páginas. 
Papel: mate 120 g/m2. 
Tintas: cuatro colores. 
ENCUADERNACION: integral (en espiral)
Texto completo en español, inglés y árabe.






The Founding

Your contribution will be allocated to :
• To pay for the costs of printing the book and the rewards (photographic prints).
• Once the donations are awarded, the rest of the money will go to the children's library in one of the refugees camps in Algeria.
This is the only source of funding. I choosed a flexible type of funding which means that even if I will not reach my goal I still will be able to print books and send the remaining money to the children's library in the camps. However more people will contribute the cost of printing will be cheaper and more money will be send to the camps. 

La Financiación

Tu contribución será asignada: 
• Para pagar los gastos de la impresión del libro y las recompensas (impresiones fotográficas). 
• Una vez que las donaciones hayan sido asignadas, el resto del dinero se destinará a la biblioteca infantil en uno de los campamentos de refugiados en Argelia.
Esta es la única fuente de financiación. Elegí un tipo de financiación flexible que significa que aunque si no llegue a mi objetivo, aún seré capaz de imprimir libros y enviar el dinero restante para la biblioteca infantil en los campamentos. Sin embargo, mientras  más gente contribuya con el costo de impresión, será más barato y se enviará más dinero a los campamentos.



   

The Impact 


The aims of publishing this book are:
— to bring more awareness about situation in Western Sahara. I believe that unresolved conflict in Western Sahara in relatively unknown especially to people from english speaking countries and as the time passes the frustration between Saharawis grows -- it would be a shame if the only solution for resolving this forgotten conflict was returning to war.  
— to rise the money for the children's library in Bojador. I have contacted Sahara Bubisher http://www.bubisher.org/ non profit organisation which helps to rise money for the libraries in the camps. They kindly support my project -- all the profit from that action will be sent to them. I will update information about how much money has been raised on that webpage as well as on my project's facebook webpage.  



El  Impacto
Los objetivos de la publicación de este libro son:
 -crear más conciencia acerca de la situación en el Sáhara Occidental. Creo que este conflicto sin resolver del Sáhara Occidental es relativamente desconocido, especialmente entre personas procedentes de países de habla inglesa, y ` medida que pasa más tiempo, la frustración entre los saharauis crece. Sería una lástima que la única solución para resolver este conflicto olvidado fuera la vuelta a la guerra.



- Aumentar el dinero para la biblioteca infantil en Bojador. Me he puesto en contacto con Sahara Bubisher http://www.bubisher.org/, una organización sin fines de lucro que ayuda a recoger el dinero para las bibliotecas en los campamentos.  Bubisher está apoyando mi proyecto. Todas las ganancias de esta acción serán enviadas a esta organización. Actualizaré la información de cuánto dinero se ha recogido en su página web, así como también en mi proyecto de página de Facebook.

story:
My Story 

Hi, I am a travel writer and photographer from Canada.  I have been working in Latin America for the past 2 years carrying the moniker that travel is safe, and that the world is a good place full of honest people.  Well, the other day my world came crashing down.  While on a bus from Quito, Ecuador to Tena, Ecuador I was robbed of all my camera gear, a value of over $3,000.  The worst part?  My travel insurance won't cover anything since I bought the gear outside of Canada, and because each item stolen was over $500 in value.  If you want to read about the story you can do so here on my website: http://www.brendansadventures.com/i-was-robbed-im-going-to-puke/


Obviously I'm devastated. Losing your livelihood is not easy, and it's even more difficult for me.  I am a working nomad.  I have no possessions.  I own a laptop, a website, a digital travel magazine, and I used to own some camera gear. That camera gear was basically 75% of my physical property value.  I guess for many it would be like losing their house, or being fired from their job.


The Impact

Without a camera I am out of work.  More over, I have lost the opportunity to inspire others through my work.  My website is host to hundreds of visitors, sometimes thousands, a day who come to see my work.  Without a camera I have lost my ability to express how I view the world.  Despite this unfortunate situation I still see the world in a positive light, and I still want to shot people how beautiful the world is that we live in. 


What I Need & What You Get

I have already raised $700 through friends, family members, and readers of my website which is amazing.  However to do my job properly I need the following items.

  • Canon 60d Body: $899
  • Canon 70-200mm f/4 lens: $1300
  • Either a Canon 17-40mm: $799 or Canon 15-85mm: 699$
Honestly, if I can raise enough for just a lens to put on that body I would be overwhelmed with thanks.  

As I've outlined on my website article, you don't need to donate, I'm more than willing to sell a product related to me as well.  I have calendars, photo prints, and some other things listed on my article at the bottom: http://www.brendansadventures.com/i-was-robbed-im-going-to-puke/


Other Ways You Can Help

Obviously if you can't help out financially I completely understand, however I would love for you to release the social media wave for me.  Even the smallest thing, such as a tweet on twitter or a like on facebook will go a long way.  I truly appreciate anything you can do to help.  Yesterday, the support I got through my website was outstanding.  I'd be lying if I said that this robbery didn't shake my view on people, but the support I have been given through this process has solidified my belief that this world is a great place full of amazing and caring people.

  • On Twitter Tweet: Can you help @brendanvanson out? The Travel Photographer was robbed of $3,000 worth of gear: http://www.brendansadventures.com/i-was-robbed-im-going-to-puke/
  • On Facebook you can post: Can any of you help Brendan van Son out?  He's a travel photographer who was robbed of over $3,000 worth of gear the other day.
I appreciate everything.  Thank you so much.

story:
Reasons to organise a travelling exhibition:

when an exhibition is in premises, only the exhibition’s opening event gathers the maximum number of visitors;

exhibition halls are space-limited;

audience is not willing to enter the exhibition hall.

To show my pieces of art to a potentially wider audience, it was decided that the exhibition will go to the audience – on streets and city squares.


Political background:

We are from Latvia, and, in the first half of 2015, Latvia is the presiding country in Council of the European Union, and thus it organises and promotes its official culture programme in a number of European cities.

Our wish:

Along with the national culture programme, to participate with our alternative offer that is not an academic expression of art,

while the main things is 

to show our daily life, routine and holidays, to present Latvia and Riga from a simple and usual point of view to the audience, and show how people live, what they do, how they enjoy life, what is the truth as seen from the inside

with an objective

to show to a wider audience that we are not frightened and underdeveloped post-soviet province, to arouse interest, to give positive impressions about Latvia, and to show the conjunctive and different aspects of social life and culture.

We offer:

to demonstrate both documentation of history facts and creative view of the author with photographs of the single author.

Expression of the travelling exhibition:

in each visited city, a photo collection is exposed just for a day thus making the event a recurrent opening of the exhibition with maximum publicity in each place.

Our accomplishments:

In September 2014, we started organisational work carrying out a questionnaire with 30 European countries on a possibility to arrange such exhibition. We have received quite many approving answers to in fact plan the touring exhibition in 17 cities in 12 countries.

We have prepared the exhibition’s exposition and structures to be built, and currently we are booking accommodations and clarifying the touring details.

We are also working on issuing a photo album of the author, and the album is foreseen to be offered to the interested ones in the second half of this year.

Currently we are also developing a special homepage to present the exhibition’s tour, share opinions and publish the offer of the photo album.


Where we faced challenges:

we didn’t receive the expected help from organisations that would actually be interested in creation of the public image of Latvia;

many commercial companies refuse support as they see no immediate financial return of the invested assets.


What can we do?

We are turning to you asking for support and hoping that

our project is interesting and useful to public;

our private initiative in creative exchange of cross-national culture has deserved the public support.

About the author:

Irena Petra, a street photographer from Latvia:

“EVERY DAY THERE ARE THINGS AND EVENTS AROUND US, WHICH WE JUST DON’T SEE OR NOTICE, WE PASS THEM BY, BEING BUSY AS WE ARE, AND WE ARE SURPRISED WHEN WE SEE ORDINARY AND USUAL THINGS FROM A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE, THROUGH THE EYES OF A PHOTOGRAPHER.”

Irena has begun her creative work in the 1980s with professional dancing and painting, later turning to graphic design, graphic work and book illustrations, participating in the exhibitions of group of artists Free Art in Riga.  Her works can be found in private collections in Germany, Israel, Russia and Latvia.

Later, working as an image editor at a publishing house, Irena got into photography, first as a photo correspondent, but later it evolved into her private project Riga Collection.  It consists of documentary, ambience and observational photos of Riga and has been going on and developing since 2008.

The photos in the collection have been on public display at Irena's personal exhibitions in Riga in 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014.

Irena does not publish her photo collection on the Internet and it can only be seen at her exhibitions and in her coming printed photo album.

Run of the tour:

The expected length of the tour is 40 days, namely, one day is dedicated to the exhibition, while the other – to travelling to the next place.  Our touring team consists of three members.  We are planning to go to the tour from May to June 2015.

The planned touring route:

Riga (Latvia) - Dresden – Berlin – Munster (Germany) - Amsterdam (the Netherlands) - Brussels (Belgium) - Luxembourg (Luxembourg) - Strasbourg (France) - Zurich (Switzerland) - Vaduz (Liechtenstein) - Nuremberg – Munich – Garmisch Partenkirchen (Germany) - Bratislava (Slovakia) - Vienna (Austria) - Zagreb (Croatia) - Budapest (Hungary) - Krakow (Poland) - Riga (Latvia).

The tour includes 7,000 km and 17 cities in 12 countries.

What for and how much money is needed?

Construction of metal structures of the exhibition stands  3,000 €

Tour trip (fuel, accommodation, food)                                     12,000 €

Publishing of the photo album                                                       7,000 €

                                                                                                In total 20,000 €

We invest our money in organisation of the project, elaboration of photo printed and Neobond boards, arrangement of a car, souvenir materials, development of the photo album’s design, and development and maintenance of the homepage.

We would be happy to accept intangible support from you:

assistance in the tour in the above European cities – volunteering in supervision of the stands, contacts with the public, local media and TV, introduction excursion in the cities, and assistance in other forms as well.

We are inviting all contributors to visit our exhibition (precise date will be available in email).

Specifications:

The exhibition – dimensions of a stand w 1550 x h 2300 mm, 6 stands together.

There are 9 two-sided photo prints on a Neobond base, size of the photo print 480 x 480 mm. The exhibition in total incorporates 102 photo printed and 3 semitransparent banners with photo print. The exposition covers 40 m2, while all the exhibition space covers 180 m2.

When put together, the exposition can be placed in a transport container on the top of a car; size 1500 x 1600 x 450 mm, weight 110 kg.

Photo album – size 200 x 250 mm, hard-covered, 252 pages. Content: street photography in Riga, approx. 250 black-and-white photographs captured from 2008 till 2015, with text captions in English.


visit to me:
www.irena-petra.eu

from May 1, 2015.

story:
This campaign is to raise the final production costs for two photography books which I have just self published. The last bills are due at the end of this month so I'm offering some special deals. 

I am a photographer based in Berlin. For several years I worked in London and was selected for the Photographic Portrait Exhibition at the National Portrait Gallery in London, the Association of Photographers Awards in London, and the International Photography Awards in New York, among others.

Oder-Neisse


Oder-Neisse is a project I have been working on for the last three years. It is the name given to the post war Polish-German border. It is a study of the contemporary and historical nature of the region influenced in large part by the writing of Joseph Conrad. He was an ethnic Pole born under Russian rule in what is now Ukraine, who left his homeland to settle in England. It is an extended series of landscapes, interiors and portraits made during several trips to the area.

The book is 88 pages with 43 colour images, 20cm x 24,6cm, published in an edition of 500 copies, with the first 50 as a numbered special edition (plus 7 artist's proofs) complete with two 10"x8" prints also in a numbered edition of 50. As a special bonus for this campaign, anyone buying the special edition receives a signed copy of Szálló (see below) for free.


Szálló

Szálló, which means hostel in Hungarian, was the first project I ever made. It was shot over six months in Budapest in 1997.

It is a series of portraits, interiors and exteriors, of people living in sheltered accommodation in various locations across the city.

I rediscovered it recently and decided to publish it as a limited edition of 300 copies. It is 72 pages with 35 duotone images, 16,2cm x 20,3cm.

Check out the offers on both of these works on this site and please pass it on if you think it could be of interest. Only available until 23rd June!

Thanks for your support.
story_txt:
This campaign is to raise the final production costs for two photography
 books which I have just self published. The last bills are due at the 
end of this month so I'm offering some special deals.  I am a photographer based in Berlin. For several years I worked in London and was selected for the Photographic Portrait Exhibition at the National Portrait Gallery in London, the Association of Photographers Awards in London, and the International Photography Awards in New York, among others. Oder-Neisse 

  



Oder-Neisse is a project I have been working on for the last three years. It is the name given to the post war Polish-German border. It is a study of the
 contemporary and historical nature of the region influenced in large 
part by the writing of Joseph Conrad. He was an ethnic Pole born
 under Russian rule in what is now Ukraine, who left his homeland to 
settle in England. It is an extended series of landscapes, interiors and portraits made during several trips to the area.

The book is 88 pages with 43 colour images, 20cm x 24,6cm, published in an edition of 500 copies, with the first 50 as a numbered special edition (plus 7 artist's proofs) complete with two 10"x8" prints also in a numbered edition of 50. As a special bonus for this campaign, anyone buying the special edition receives a signed copy of Szálló (see below) for free. 
SzállóSzálló, which means hostel in Hungarian, was the first project I ever made. It was shot over six months in Budapest in 1997. It is a series of portraits, interiors and exteriors, of people living 
in sheltered accommodation in various locations across the city.I rediscovered it recently and decided to publish it as a limited edition of 300 copies. It is 72 pages with 35 duotone images, 16,2cm x 20,3cm.Check out the offers on both of these works on this site and please pass it on if you think it could be of interest. Only available until 23rd June!Thanks for your support.

story:
WOW!  You guys Rock!  Super big thank you!!

Everyone gets my new Kurt Cobain sticker!

Pre Sale Starts now!

The Flannel Years a photographic tour by Karen Mason Blair Foreword by Krist Novoselic

Your backstage pass to the early 90s Seattle music scene.

Do you want to be one of the first people to own this new book?

Karen Mason Blair is an entertainment photographer in Seattle Washington. She was a fan girl with a camera in the early 90s in Seattle during the grunge movement.  They were all her friends and this is her story. She took some time off of her career to raise her kids. But now she has self published her first book ever. This is her heartfelt book that showcases photos from her personal collection and stories you have never heard. Karen allows you to experience what she saw through her lens, whether you were there or wished you were! Today you have an opportunity to be a part of her journey.  This book has over 150 photos, and includes some previously unreleased photos. It is 8 1/2 x 11 and is 144 pages. Ships out next week.

story:
Our idea

My name is Yuri and I'm here to tell you about a dream that I have had for a very long time.

We live in a world today where we are constantly taking photos, accumulating terabytes of images every day, yet most of those pics are of little or no value. At the same time, among the thousands of photos taken for social networks showing our friends, the food we like, not to mention selfies, there are some really interesting shots of beautiful places, urban scenes and foreign sights, natural monuments and architectural wonders. Each family owns and keeps photo albums which tell their own stories. Just imagine how many photos taken in different parts of the world are now gathering dust on shelves or in closets. Worse still, over time they can be lost, thrown away, burned or simply deteriorate. Through our indifference we are closing our window on the past and losing the link between generations.

And now I would like to show you the future look of the website

Imagine that you want to take a look at your hometown street from your childhood. To do this, you will open our website http://picstorium.com, find your city and locate your own street on the map. Using the timescale, you will set the exact time that interests you. The map enables you to find the relevant images for that location, uploaded by other users. In short, you will be able to look into the world of memories and gain a fresh perspective on life in the past. You will also be able to rate any photo, thereby influencing the uploader's overall rating, just by clicking on their name. There will also be a system of user statistics depending on the rating. Each status will be displayed in the form of an original icon next to the user name. 

Users with a rating above 1000 points will be able to have access to the additional features of the website http://picstorium.com, for example, tools for processing and improving photos, VIP stickers, etc. The project backerswill receive accounts with all the privileges and with special statuses .

There will also be a "Hall of Fame" section, where photos with names of sponsors as well as users who have reached high ratings will be displayed.

Not only will you be able to evaluate each photo, you can also leave a comment in the comment section. Here you will also see feedback from other users on this photo. By clicking on the name of any comment's author, you will be able to communicate with him or her personally. And by clicking on the name of the person who uploaded the photo, you can start a conversation with them as well.

Users will be able to see the following information about each other: name, country of residence, age (optional). Under each comment the date of its creation will also be shown. Each message will also have a "translate" button to facilitate communication between people from all around the world.

Project budget

In order to improve the likelihood of launching the project, our team decided to calculate the minimum budget required to create and run the platform. If we are able to collect about 2400$, we will be able to create a full-fledged site. If we are able to secure additional funding, we are also planning to create apps for Android and iOS. Within these budget parameters, however, it will be difficult for us to promote the website http://picstorium.com and pursue its further development.

If we manage to raise more funds, we will launch an active advertising campaign to promote the site. Within the first couple of months, millions of people will learn about our project. This will make it possible to fill the virtual planet of the site with pictures from different epochs and countries in a short period of time. Our most important goal is to make sure that anyone who sees an interesting photo immediately feels motivated to save it on http://picstorium.com for future generations.

The platform will accumulate digital and scanned photos. In the very near future special tools will also be added for restoring, retouching and improving photos.

All photos uploaded by users will be subject to content moderation in order to ensure that they correspond to the website’s requirements.

Join the project and come together with people from all around the world. Share your old pictures with others. Leave your own footprint in the photographic legacy of humanity!

A website of this type will surely appear sooner or later.

So let US be its founders!

story:
Second Added Incentive for People to Support the Project

As an incentive for people to sponsor our compaign, Tomboy Tailors will send everyone who contributes at $25 or above (including people who have already made a contribution), a coupon for $25 off a purchase at Tomboy Tailors.

If you like this business idea, please help us by supporting us.  If you provide us with a $25 donation, you will receive both a listing as a sponsor in the book and a coupon for $25 off of a purchase at Tomboy Tailors. You are in essence, providing us with a short-term bridge loan and helping support the first company in the United States to open brick-and-mortar tailored clothing store that caters to lesbians and trans-masculine individuals.

If you contribute at a level below $25, we will send you a coupon for $25 off of your first purchase of $50 or more.

Please help us break down binary expectations for what people should wear. We as people are diverse and our options for clothing should be diverse as well.

 

First Added Incentive for People to Support the Project

Please be sure to see the details below about our Tomboy Tailors’ Company Tag Line Contest

All eligible submissions will be entered into the Tomboy Tailors' Company Tag Line contest where one winner will be selected to receive a custom-made suit, dress shirt, and bow-tie (total value $2,000). The lucky winner will also have the option to wear their outfit while riding a motorcycle side-car rig in San Francisco's 2013 Pride Parade.  (See photo in gallery area).

ALL who contribute to this Indiegogo campaign at $7 or more will receive an email after the close of the Indiegogo campaign with a link where contributors can suggest a company Tag Line for Tomboy Tailors.  All eligible submissions will be entered into a contest where one winner will be selected to receive a custom-made suit, dress shirt, and bow-tie (total value $2,000). The lucky winner will also have the option to wear their outfit while riding a motorcycle side-car rig in San Francisco's Pride Parade of 2013. See official rules in the gallery area. 

Who are we?

Tomboy Tailors is a fine clothier specializing in custom-made suits and shirts of the finest quality that are bespoke-tailored (made-to-measure for you) in the material, cut and fit that you want.

Our customers are butch/boi lesbians, trans-masculine individuals, and women and men of any identity who have a strong sense of self-expression and like to wear fine custom-made clothing.  We specialize in made-to-measure men's and women's suits and dress shirts and bring our clients bespoke tailor expertise and service.

Our vision is to provide everyone with a place where they can be themselves and experience excellent service, style, and quality. We also offer accessories and men’s shoes in a variety of sizes.

Our retail store, located in San Francisco, will be opening on February 2, 2013!

The store will be located in the Financial District of San Francisco just a few blocks from Union Square.

Our online store will be opening in approximately March 15, 2013.

What is Tomboy Dapper?

To help fund the company and celebrate dapper tomboys. To help fund our startup ANDcelebrate the 'dapper tomboy look, we are publishing a photography book, entitled Tomboy Dapper (working title), showcasing photos of butch/boi lesbians, trans-masculine individuals, and women of all stripes who show the style of donning menswear or masculine-of-center womenswear.

About 200 photographers will be partnering with us to photograph tomboys from all around the country in Tomboy Tailors' dapper styles.

What We Need

WE NEED YOUR HELP as we work to create a tailored clothing company that makes butch lesbians and trans-masculine individuals and all people feel welcome and appreciated. Your contribution will help Tomboy Tailors grow and through the book project, your contribution will help ensure more positive images of lesbians and transmasculine individuals in the society-at-large.

What You Get

Related to the book and Tomboy Tailors, we are creating an annual calendar, a seriously fun Tomboy Tailor match box, and the Tomboy Dapper book.

For $7, you will receive a eye-catching Tomboy Tailors match box perfect for your fireplace mantel. We love great looking legs!  - See a photo of our match boxes in the gallery area of this campaign.  

For $12, you will receive two eye-catching Tomboy Tailors match boxes perfect for your fireplace mantel.

For $20, you will receive our 2013 Annual Tomboy Tailors Calendar -  6"x6" wall calendar that would look great next to your computer. The calendar features 12 great looking Tomboy Dandies. See several photos from our calendar in the gallery area of this campaign. 

For $25, you will be listed as a Change Innovator Sponsor in Tomboy Dapper - a limited edition, hard-bound book.

For $50, you will be listed as a Change Innovator in Tomboy Dapper. You will also receive one Tomboy Tailors match box and one Tomboy Tailors Calendar.

For $75, you will be listed as a Change Innovator Sponsor in Tomboy Dapper - a limited edition, hard-bound book AND you will receive a copy of the book.

For $100, you will be listed as a Change Innovator Sponsor in Tomboy Dapper AND you will receive a copy of the book. You will also receive one Tomboy Tailors match box and one Tomboy Tailors Calendar.

For $250, you will be listed as a Change Innovator Sponsor in Tomboy Dapper -  AND you will receive a copy of the book. You will also receive one Tomboy Tailors match box, AND two tickets to the Tomboy Dapper Book Opening Cocktail Party which will take place in San Francisco, California or the Napa Valley area in October of 2013. 

As an incentive for people to sponsor our compaign, Tomboy Tailors will send everyone who contributes at $25 or above (including people who have already made a contribution), a coupon for $25 off a purchase at Tomboy Tailors.

If you like this business idea, please help us by supporting us.  If you provide us with a $25 donation, you will receive both a listing as a sponsor in the book and a coupon for $25 off of a purchase at Tomboy Tailors. You are in essence, providing us with a short-term bridge loan and helping support the first company in the United States to open brick-and-mortar tailored clothing store that caters to lesbians and trans-masculine individuals.

If you contribute at a level below $25, we will send you a coupon for $25 off of your first purchase of $50 or more.

Please help us break down binary expectations for what people should wear. We as people are diverse and our options for clothing should be diverse as well.

Frequently Asked Questions

See the gallery area for a document answering Frequently Asked Questions about this campaign.

Who are the Team Members of Tomboy Tailors

Tomboy Tailors currently has three employees. You can see information about Zel, Emma and Catherine within the Frequently Asked Questions document that is part of the gallary area of this campaign.

Our Contest - Take One Extra Step to Enter to Win a Dashing Ensemble in our Contest!

ALL who contribute to this Indiegogo campaign at $7 or more will receive an email after the close of the Indiegogo campaign with a link where contributors can suggest a Tag Line for Tomboy Tailors. 

All eligible submissions will be entered into the Tomboy Tailors' Company Tag Line contest where one winner will be selected to receive a custom-made suit, dress shirt, and bow-tie (total value $2,000). The lucky winner will also have the option to wear their outfit while riding a motorcycle side-car rig in San Francisco's 2013 Pride Parade.

Entries must be received by January 26, 2013 and will be judged by Tomboy Tailors' staff members. The winner will be announced at our opening party for the retail store on February 2, 2013. The winner's name will also be posted on our website by February 8, 2013.  See official rules in the gallery area.

The Impact

About 200 photographers will be partnering with us to photograph tomboys from all around the country in Tomboy Tailors' dapper styles.

Tomboy Tailors is one of the very few tailored clothing companies in the world that puts butch lesbians and transmasculine individuals as their VIP clients. We will be providing suits for men and women as well, but with such few options, we really want butch lesbians and transmasculine individuals to know that they are welcome in our store.

Not only will your contribution help support this much-needed and hard-to-find niche, but sponsors who contribute $75 or more will also receive a copy of the book, the final product of which is sure to be a prized possession.

Lastly, your contribution will ensure more positive images of lesbians and transmasculine individuals in society at large. We encourage you to help us make that happen by supporting this project and the team at Tomboy Tailors.

Tomboy Tailors thanks you for your contribution and support!

story:
This photography project is very important to me as it is my premier showcase. If I can pull off an amazing job with my photo reproduction then I will be able to gain more admirers and therefore make more work that they will continue to enjoy. If you could give any amount of money to help offset the costs of printing, framing, and staging then I'd greatly appreciate it. 

I'm a multi-disciplinary artist and this is just one of the many ventures I am working on and if you are able to fund me then there will be a great range of exciting perks. 

Description of Perks:

Unusual dinner parties will be held at my house featuring a variety of surrealist games, performances, and foods to partake upon. 

Unusual dates will be similar to the parties, but not at my house and will be much more intimate. These will only take place in the DMV area unless travel expense is added on.

Underpitals are a fashion line I have created to empower the wearer by accessorizing the underarm which causes the wearer to raise their hands and thereby putting them into the power position. This position has been statistically proven to improve confidence. The accessories are a bold and beautiful must have for any fashionista. 

Anatomical Inaccuracies drawings will be drawn based on the anatomical body part of the donator's choice. These body parts will be transformed and combined with other parts to form unique creations that are incredibly intoxicating.

Power, Positivity, and Purification Therapy Sessions are another creation of mine that can be done via skype, but the preferred method is in person to gain the most benefits.  These sessions help the participant get their lives on track if they have become derailed in someway or just need a pick me up.

The Purification Amulet is a creation of mine that is used in the therapy session, but with proper usage can give the donor the benefits of the therapy at home. It will also make for a wonderful ornament for your neck, but it may be fragile and so you should take care when wearing it out.

Performance Time is what I offer as a performance artist. You can hire me for a public or private event. After you have given me a theme then I will send over three proposals and you can choose one. We can then discuss the details of it further at that point. Depending on the proposal the materials cost involved may or may not be included in this perk.  

Brainstorming Time is what I excel at and I enjoy the most. I am available to help you hash out any idea you have whether it is based in art, marketing, advertising, relationship management, or life goals. Getting the conversation started about solutions is my expertise and I thrive on other's projects to create ideas for my own future projects. 

Snuggle Sessions are almost a performance piece in itself, but I fully believe in the healing powers of a good snuggle. These sessions will involve no sexual activity and there will be calming music playing to put us both at ease. I will be available to talk or to listen during these sessions depending on what you desire.  

Perks do not include shipping charges. Free for hand delivery or pick up in DMV area.
story_txt: This photography project is very important to me as it is my premier showcase. If I can pull off an amazing job with my photo reproduction then I will be able to gain more admirers and therefore make more work that they will continue to enjoy. If you could give any amount of money to help offset the costs of printing, framing, and staging then I'd greatly appreciate it. I'm a multi-disciplinary artist and this is just one of the many ventures I am working on and if you are able to fund me then there will be a great range of exciting perks. Description of Perks:Unusual dinner parties will be held at my house featuring a variety of surrealist games, performances, and foods to partake upon. Unusual dates will be similar to the parties, but not at my house and will be much more intimate. These will only take place in the DMV area unless travel expense is added on.Underpitals are a fashion line I have created to empower the wearer by accessorizing the underarm which causes the wearer to raise their hands and thereby putting them into the power position. This position has been statistically proven to improve confidence. The accessories are a bold and beautiful must have for any fashionista. Anatomical Inaccuracies drawings will be drawn based on the anatomical body part of the donator's choice. These body parts will be transformed and combined with other parts to form unique creations that are incredibly intoxicating.Power, Positivity, and Purification Therapy Sessions are another creation of mine that can be done via skype, but the preferred method is in person to gain the most benefits.  These sessions help the participant get their lives on track if they have become derailed in someway or just need a pick me up.The Purification Amulet is a creation of mine that is used in the therapy session, but with proper usage can give the donor the benefits of the therapy at home. It will also make for a wonderful ornament for your neck, but it may be fragile and so you should take care when wearing it out.Performance Time is what I offer as a performance artist. You can hire me for a public or private event. After you have given me a theme then I will send over three proposals and you can choose one. We can then discuss the details of it further at that point. Depending on the proposal the materials cost involved may or may not be included in this perk.  Brainstorming Time is what I excel at and I enjoy the most. I am available to help you hash out any idea you have whether it is based in art, marketing, advertising, relationship management, or life goals. Getting the conversation started about solutions is my expertise and I thrive on other's projects to create ideas for my own future projects. Snuggle Sessions are almost a performance piece in itself, but I fully believe in the healing powers of a good snuggle. These sessions will involve no sexual activity and there will be calming music playing to put us both at ease. I will be available to talk or to listen during these sessions depending on what you desire.  Perks do not include shipping charges. Free for hand delivery or pick up in DMV area.

story:
Project aim

Helping a young photographer to replace his broken camera half way through working on his dream project to capture life and the true Asia.


About the project

I'm a 22 year old photographer. My dream to travel and share my vision of our world have started since my first steps in photography. I have worked hard to make this dream come true with my own budget and to start to report what was in front of me, sharing the truth about life, about a reality happening every day for some people, about social facts and human condition. About our environment, and how people live in this.

Jakarta / indonésia 

My dream project started on the 4 December 2014 when I boarded my flight for Manila, starting this project in the Philippines. Until today, i have taken pictures almost every day, I have heard, seen and captured many interesting, crazy and sad stories. I seek to capture the beauty everywhere, even if sometimes this kind of beauty can hurt. Even if the truth can hurt. The most important thing for me is to share that. Share their stories.

Manila (railway) / Philippines

The problem is that in Asia the weather and climate can change very fast. My professional camera 5D mark II, which I have had for 4 years, has survived in a lot of hard conditions (Typhon, a lot of rain, sand, humidity, and rain again ) But unfortunately it broke down today beyond repair, while I am just half-way through my journey to explore and capture Asia’s truth. Unfortunately without my camera my project is in peril. I have already taken arrangements for the rest of the journey but can’t imagine continuing without a camera. In my tight budget I had not prepared the eventuality to invest in new material. And I have actually sold my second camera one month ago to prolong my project.

So, I ask your help, if you can of course, to help me finish this project.

Cebu city / Philippines 

 

Gifts for thanks your help

The only thing i can give you for thanks you, is a part of my work.
Continued my project and share you this.

For donation less of 20 $  :
You can be sure i will be forever thankful for have trust in my dream, in my project, 
and for help me to continue my passion.. 

For donation up to 20 $ and more :
I engage myself to send you by post a 10x15 print picture of this project in Asia, signed on the back.

For donation up to 50 $ and more :
I engage myself to send you by post a 20x30 print picture of this project in Asia, signed on the back.

Another Face of Asia / selection of a part of the project


For donation up to 250 $ and more :
I engage myself to send you by post a 40x60 print on plexiglas+aluminum picture of my last exhibition and project "Absence", of street photography,
( Only 10, and unique print ) signed on the back.
For this one, you can choice the one you want..

Absence / Pictures #1

Absence / Pictures #2

Absence / Pictures #3

Absence / Pictures #4

Absence / Pictures #5

Absence / Pictures #6

Absence / Pictures #7

Absence / Pictures #8

Absence / Pictures #9

Absence / Pictures #10


For donation up to 350 $ and more :

a 28x21 cm photo book (Limited edition) of 106 pages of my project in Asia.
Print in only 10 exemplary, in hight quality paper.
Signed and dedicated.

story:
My wife loves photography & has always wanted a "real" camera. However, with the (financial) realities of life, we've never splurged for one of high enough quality to really pursue her interest.

This last year two things happened:

  • We had a beautiful baby girl!


       And

  • Our point and shoot camera went bye-bye.


So, I'm calling all friends and family (and all friends of friends and family) to join me in getting her a camera worthy of her interest (and of our daughter's beautiful smile).

The camera she would love (we recently borrowed one) is over $700.00 new. I would love to wow her with a gift like that. And I'd love your help.

Everyone who pitches in will be listed in the birthday card I give her, and if you provide email addresses, I'll see to it you get a beautiful pic of my family taken with the birthday camera (or one of my short stories in e-book format if you'd prefer... or both!).

So... What say you? Will you join me in making her birthday special?

________________________________________________________________________

 

A few more details:

Although I put the end date as April 4th, that's just because IndieGoGo required me to. My wife's Birthday is March 27 (that's only 10 days) and this idea just occurred to me. So, although it's short notice, I'd love to let her know about it on her birthday even if the money takes longer for IndieGoGo to drop in the account.

 

The camera I'm looking at for her is the Nikon D5100 which ranges from right at $700 to more than $900 depending on lense kits. I picked $830 because that will give her roughly $770 after IndieGoGo fees---which should cover the camera with a basic lense.

 

If we don't make the goal, but get close, I'm looking at getting her the Nikon D3100 (still a rocking camera that she would love).

 

And if we really don't get near the goal, but collect a couple hundred, I'm looking at having her pick out a Point and Shoot camera of her choice---because currently she's limited to her cell phone camera... and her phone is old :o)

 

So there it is. Your help in making her day would be amazingly appreciated!

 

Love you all!

 

Geno

story:
Who am I?

My name is Shannon Vogel and I've been doing photography for about 6 years. I have done some freelance work and I take a lot of photos of my kids. I am very passionate about nature photography, though, and I would like to pursue it more.

Over the past couple years I have become more serious about starting a small business with my photography. I would like to start out by selling my prints online and eventually doing local craft shows and more freelance work. I want to create a nature photo book that I can sell online and locally to expand what I have to offer. If I can acomplish this goal I will be able to support my family better while doing what I love.

What I Need & What You Get

To create and order 100 - 22 page, hardcover 13x11 books plus the perks I will need $4500. High contributors can recieve a print from my gallery or even the book once it is finished. If my full goal isn't met I will purchase as many of the books as I can after the perks are accounted for.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute you can still help out by spreading the word about my project. Use the direct link or use the share buttons above. You can share on facebook, twitter, e-mail, your blog or where ever else you'd like.
 
You can also purchase my prints and other products for yourself or as gifts http://muffinpie03.deviantart.com/store/

story:
ABOUT ME

My name is Norm Yip and I’m an artist and photographer. I grew up in Canada, in the province of Saskatchewan, where I was a visible minority, a Chinese living in a small town where I could count the number of Asian families on one hand. I studied both fine arts and architecture and lived in Toronto for 10 years before making the move to live in Hong Kong. In Hong Kong, I worked as an architect for nearly 5 years, but found that my deeper interest was in photography and art.

*

THE ASIAN MALE - 3.AM - A NEW BOOK PUBLICATION 

I am raising funds to print and publish my third photography book of Asian men nudes and semi-nudes entitled The Asian Male - 3.AM. All the images are already taken, having collected them over a period of seven years. The layout and design is 95% complete and the foreword has been written by Amazon.com Hall of Fame reviewer Grady Harp. Below is the the cover of the book, who is modeled by the exotic Filipino, Nono. 

Sample layouts (work in progress)


HOW IT ALL BEGAN

After seeing my friend Derek Lam, a graphic designer, publish a book on Asian men, I thought I could do the same. I learned photography at the age of 12 the old-fashioned way using black and white film and a darkroom. At the gym in Hong Kong, I had many friends that had really great physiques, and thought I could practice shooting while trying to emulate the style of Herb Ritts, an American photographer who captured stunning images of beautiful men and women. The nude work that he did with Japanese soccer player Kazu inspired me greatly. 

After shooting a number of guys, I found that my own photography both disappointed and excited me. I found that I could not copy Herb Ritts and his photos of muscular guys. Instead, I discovered my own style of photography, which then set the tone for my Asian male publications. I contacted several well known publishers, but none came back to me with a positive response. In the end, I decided to go about doing it on my own and set up Studio 8 HK as a small publishing company. 

*

MY FIRST BOOK

The Asian Male - 1.AM became my first self-published book. The '1' stands for first edition; the 'A' for Asian and finally the 'M' for Male. That was in 2005. I hired a friend to help with the layout and design. I handled all the distribution and promoting on my own, learning how to put together a proper press release, and contacted as many bookstores across the US in hopes of taking on my book. 


MY SECOND BOOK

A short two years later, I published my second book The Asian Male - 2.AM which included a more diverse range of men. The selection of guys were Koreans, Nepalese, Malaysians, Indians, Filipino, and Chinese. It further demonstrated that Asian men could be appreciated aesthetically for their inherent qualities, making the lean muscular build ideally attractive as an subject and object of art. 


MY THIRD BOOK 3.AM

Well, its now 2014, and I’m ready to print and publish The Asian Male - 3.AM. The 3rd edition will showcase the best photographs of guys in the past 7 years. The majority of the images are in black and white and shot mostly in my Hong Kong studio. The ethnic range includes Thai, Filipino, Vietnamese, Malay, Japanese, Cambodian and Chinese. 

Bodies range from the super masculine and hard bodied men such as Vietnamese Jeremy Tang, to the softer and lyrical body of Nono, a young and exceptionally photogenic Filipino. Then there is Malaysian-Chinese Derek Chong, who I photographed several times both nude and with fashion accessories. The images celebrate and bring to the forefront the beauty of Asian men in a erotic and sensuous way. 

There are semi-nudes to nudes in this book, but it is all photographed in a sensitive and sensual way. The men that appear come from all areas of life, including financial advisors, dancers and performers, professional models and more. 

These photographs are portraits of people just like anyone else; they are proud of who they are as Asian men, but also proud to be able to express their own beauty. It was a chance for them to be admired and appreciated in an artistic way, without the fear of being seen as vulgar or unruly, especially within the Asian community as a whole. Although Asian is progressing, there is still a huge stigma to nudity and the body as a whole.

*

THE BOOK

The book will be 9 x 12" sized book with over 100 pages. The inside pages will be printed on 178gsm Art Matt paper. Meanwhile the cover will be in black with silver foil stamping, with a laminated Jacket. (Pictured below is a soft-cover dummy copy, but rest assured, the final printed book will be a hard-cover book.) The book's design, layout, cover, and jacket is designed by me. 


FINE ART PRINTS

The photographs you see below have been carefully selected to appear on the Indiegogo campaign, whereby the Asian male has been interpreted as fine art images. They are as follows: Nono - No. 1, Nono - No. 2, Calvin, Monika, Nathan, Ricky, and Wilfred. They will be available in various sizes to fit: 

a) 8 x 12" (Edition of 10)

b) 13 x 17" (Edition of 10)

c) 16 x 24", (Edition of 10)

d) 24 x 36" (Edition of 5)

The fine art prints will be printed on Fine Art Matt paper, signed and numbered. Each print will be accompanied by a Certificate of Authenticity. 

Nono, No. 1, Filipino, Hong Kong

Nono, No. 2, Filipino, Hong Kong

Calvin, Chinese, Singapore

Monika, Albanian-Cambodian, USA

Ricky, Chinese, Hong Kong

Nathan, Chinese, Hong Kong

Wilfred, Chinese, Hong Kong

*

BE A PATRON

Those purchasing artwork through the listed Perks will have an opportunity to be acknowledged in the book publication as Patrons. 

GOLD PATRON
- purchase of US$2,500 or more of artwork

SILVER PATRON
- purchase of US$1,250 or more of artwork

BRONZE PATRON
- purchase of US$625 or more of artwork

*

HOW THE FUNDS BE USED

Your pre-order copy or purchase of a limited edition print along with a book will help fund the cost of printing 1,500 books, which amounts to US$20,000. This will cover costs for color proofs, editing, the foreword, proofing, and part of the shipping costs to the USA where my wholesaler is based. The printing of the book publication will be done in Hong Kong, where I will be conducting press checks, to ensure quality control of the printing from start to finish. 

The goal amount however does not cover any pre-productions costs, studio hours, post-production work on the images, nor the hours of graphic design work that I have spent on the book publication and the promotion thereof. 

*

PRESS/MEDIA

South China Morning Post - Photographer hopes to score with body of works by Kylie Knott
Timeout Magazine - Norm Yip's Asian Male Photography by Arthur Tam

Daniel Magazine - Photographing the Inner and Outer Beauty of the Asian Male by Helen Zhao

*

WEBSITES & FACEBOOK

The Asian Male - 3.AM Blog - http://theasianmale3am.wordpress.com
The Asian Male Project - http://theasianmale.com
Norm Yip Website - http://normyip.com

The Asian Male Facebook Page

*

'ASIAN MALE' BOOKS ON AMAZON

The Asian Male - 1.AM
The Asian Male - 2.AM

***

story:
Personal Story

Sereyrath Mech, also called Kan, is a female senior student at Department of Media and Communication in Royal University of Phnom Penh. Having a strong passion in art and journalism, she synthesised these and proposed to her supervisors who supported her request and provided an approval on having Contemporary Breath  as a topic for her project. 

PROJECT OVERVIEW 

WHAT: Contemporary Breath aims at bringing contemporary photography into journalism under an environmental issue - air pollution. There are a few main activities such as pitching idea, photographing , producing a photo book and hosting a photo exhibition. 

WHEN: February -July 2018

WHERE: Phnom Penh (urban and sub-urban areas)

WHY: There are two fundamental objectives to conducting this project. First, it is to emerge the practice of contemporary photography into photo-journalistic practice to the Cambodia press for advancement. Its second purpose is to raise an awareness of various sources of air pollution and actions to be taken to improve air quality in cities. 

WHOM: Three targeted groups include as follow: 

   - Primary audience: Photojournalists, whose work is to tell stories through photos, find some subjects challenging to cover such as scenes of physical illness or harm, individual dignity, emotions, abstraction or complicated events.

   - Secondary audience: City dwellers, especially those who have been experiencing a difficulty in breathing the so-called polluted air. 

   - Tertiary audience: Stakeholders such as Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Information, Media institutions, the Ministry of Health, policy makers, and those who play a key role in promoting the freedom of press and public health particularly air quality.

WHO: Production Crew

story_txt:
Personal StorySereyrath Mech, also called Kan, is a female senior student at Department of Media and Communication in Royal University of Phnom Penh. Having a strong passion in art and journalism, she synthesised these and proposed to her supervisors who supported her request and provided an approval on having Contemporary Breath  as a topic for her project. PROJECT OVERVIEW WHAT: Contemporary Breath aims at bringing contemporary photography into journalism under an environmental issue - air pollution. There are a few main activities such as pitching idea, photographing , producing a photo book and hosting a photo exhibition. WHEN: February -July 2018WHERE: Phnom Penh (urban and sub-urban areas)WHY: There are two fundamental objectives to conducting this project. First, it is to emerge the practice of contemporary photography into photo-journalistic practice to the Cambodia press for advancement. Its second purpose is to raise an awareness of various sources of air pollution and actions to be taken to improve air quality in cities. WHOM: Three targeted groups include as follow:    - Primary audience: Photojournalists, whose work is to tell stories through photos, find some subjects challenging to cover such as scenes of physical illness or harm, individual dignity, emotions, abstraction or complicated events.   - Secondary audience: City dwellers, especially those who have been experiencing a difficulty in breathing the so-called polluted air.    - Tertiary audience: Stakeholders such as Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Information, Media institutions, the Ministry of Health, policy makers, and those who play a key role in promoting the freedom of press and public health particularly air quality.WHO: Production Crew

story:
Los Hechos

El domingo de la semana pasada, David Herranz (davidherranz.com) –y su consorte- salieron de casa, a mediodía, con intención de mendigar un plato de sopa en casa de sus suegros. 

Tras disfrutar de una opípara comida, una siesta eterna, diversos chistes malos y un café con pastas de Lidl, volvieron al hogar y casi les da un chungo cuando vieron que alguien había entrado.

Todo estaba revuelto: cajones abiertos, ropa por el suelo, desorden, caos… El ordenador seguía ahí, el ipad, el televisor… ¿No se habían llevado nada?

Sí, la mochila de David… con todo el equipo fotográfico.Se habían llevado su herramienta de trabajo.

¡Estamos hablando de 11.000 euros en equipo!

11.000 euros que no tiene... Porque es autónomo, porque la crisis nos está jodiendo a todos y, sobre todo, porque a David le pone muy cachondo hacer favores y currar sin cobrar, o cobrando poco…

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Y ésa es la razón por la que el recién creado COMITÉ DE COLEGAS MONGERS hemos decidido montar este tinglado: necesitamos que David vuelva a tener un equipo... para que siga haciéndonos favores.

Esto no es caridad. Esto es devolverle un poco de lo que nos ha dado.

El COMITÉ propone una suma de 6000 euros. Seis mil eurillos destinados íntegramente a la compra de material fotográfico.

Pero, ¡ojo! Si llegamos a los 11.000 euros, David Herranz posará desnudo. Él aún no lo sabe, pero todos sabemos cómo es David cuando bebe.

Y si superamos los 11.000, el COMITÉ se compromete a organizar un fiestón como nunca antes se ha visto en… por ahí.

David se encargará del PhotoCall, o como se diga.

Así que si eres uno de tantos a los que David ofreció su talento de forma desinteresada… no seas zanguango y ráscate el bolsillo. Y si no le conoces de nada, piensa en el KARMA y suelta un poco de calderilla, que todo suma.

Pero, como diría Super Ratón, "aún hay más": estamos que lo tiramos… y aquí toda acción tiene su reacción. Es decir, que cada donación tendrá su recompensa:

Por 25 euros, recibirás una chapa con la cara de David, modificada con Photoshop para que parezca José Luis Moreno cuando lo hostiaron en su casa.

Si sueltas 100 euritos te llevarás un disco de los Dead Bronco, firmado.

Por 200 euros, una foto firmada por David Herranz.

Y por 300 euros… Pues todo lo anterior.

Y recuerda... David en bolas haciendo el PhotoCall de la Macrofiesta… Sólo por ver eso merece la pena.

Aquí tenéis links a la mega obra del artista:

http://davidherranz.com

https://www.flickr.com/photos/davidherranz/collections


*** Por cierto, en el COMITÉ sospechamos de los suegros, pero no podemos probarlo. Cualquier información al respecto será bienvenida.

"When the going gets tough...!"

story:
Why You Should Use 360 Product Photography?

1. Conveniently drive e-commerce purchase decisions by creating the in-store experience through the use of SDLR high quality interactive 360-degree product views.

2. Save time on capturing product photographs from multiple angles to simplify your online page layout.

3. Increase website speed.

4. Reduce overall returns through better product transparency. 

 

The return rate for e-commerce is 3X that of brick & mortar stores!

*Source: Invesp

 

OUR SIMPLE & EASY PROCESS

We have made the complex and expensive 360 product photography into a simple and easy to use process. It features filters, cropping abilities and customizable turntable duration times. The whole process takes under 5 minutes!

 
 

What We Need & What You Get

 

 

  • We need the financial support from backers to help further improve and develop our app and to purchase a small inventory (light box, turntable, tripod, etc.), which would help introduce our technology to early adopters. 

 

OUR EXCITING Glo3D PERKS!

 

 

 

 

 

STRETCH GOALS

  1. $10,000 - 1 Mirror Sheet
  2. $30,000 - 1 hand held LED Lights and 1 Mirror Sheet

 

HARDWARE

Glo3D 360 Product Photography Hardware Descriptions

LIGHT BOXES

TURNTABLES

TRIPODS

 

Mobile App Interface

Easy & Simple App Process
 

 

Image Format & Samples

  • 360 Interactive Image (embed code) – allows for interactive 360 degree rotation of the image. Embed code can easily be incorporated into websites, blogs or online stores.
  • GIFs Image – non-interactive 360 models can be shared to social platforms (Pinterest, Facebook, Twitter, etc.).
  • MP4 – video that would show the 360 models (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, etc.).
  • 2D image with the 360-degree link & watermark – contains a link to the 360-interactive image that could be copied and pasted.

Sample 360 Interactive Image (Embed Code)

 

Sample of 360 Interactive Image Used on Shopify

 

Compatibility: Our app would be compatible with both iOS and Android.

iPhone:

iPhone 10
iPhone 8
iPhone 7, iPhone 7 plus
iPhone 6, iPhone 6s, iPhone 6s plus, iPhone 6s
iPhone SE
iPhone 5, iPhone 5s, iPhone 5c

Android:

Android 8
Android 7
Android 6

 

Glo3D Web Application Console

Simple web application that would manage all of your models, embed codes and links. It’s a great platform to be shared among different team members such as web designers, developers, etc. You would also have access to tutorials and a section to provide feedback as well.

 

The Process

 

The Impact

Our 360 product photography system will allow online shop owners and photographers to create enhanced online product display and product transparency that would result in increased customer engagement, drive purchase decisions, improved SEO by reducing the number of product photos needed per product and reduction in online returns. By making 360 product photography accessible, Glo3D will help bring the in-store experience for online shoppers and in turn, will help make e-commerce better for everyone.

What early adopters are saying about Glo3D

Dee Wilkie of Dee Silkie

Ryan Siberry of 416&Co

Erin Williams of Pocomono

 

OUR TEAM

We are a self-funded Canadian company located in the Toronto Midtown neighbourhood. Our dedicated team is completely committed to our work in making Glo3D the #1 solution in accommodating the needs of entrepreneurs and e-commerce platforms seeking to enhance their online storefront shopping experience through better product display and higher degree of product transparency.

 

FAQ

  1. How will I receive my Glo3D app for the exclusive first release? On the schedule date, we will send you an email invite to download your app directly onto your smartphone.
  2. Does your light box come with a setup instruction manual? All of our light boxes come with a tutorial video and a paper instruction to ensure seamless user experience when setting up for the first time.
  3. Can I use the Glo3D app with my existing hardware? Yes. Our Glo3D 360 product photography mobile app is compatible with any manual/motorized rotating stands and light boxes. 
  4. How do I claim my Glo3D app credit? The Glo3D app credit can be used towards future subscription for additional enhancement features and will automatically be added to your Glo3D account once it's set up.
  5. What is your solution to deal with delays? The foreseeable risk associated with this project would be the fulfillment of the hardware to our backers on the planned scheduled dates due to manufacturer challenges. Our solution to help minimize and mitigate this is the use of Shipwire to outsource fulfillment and Ship Station to help with shipping logistics. Lastly, we would provide our supporters with regular updates on the status of their deliveries with complete transparency if a delay is to be expected.
  6. Is your 360 product photography app compatible with any smartphone? Our Glo3D app is compatible with iPhones that have at least an iOS verion 10.3 and Android 6, 7, 8 (over 1400 android devices).
  7. If my hardware or package is damaged, what is your company's exchange or return policy? For any damaged or defected hardware, Glo3D will send out a new replacement at NO COST to the backer and will also cover the return of the original damaged or defected hardware.
  8. Is your hardware compatible with the European and International voltage standards? Our Glo3D hardware is currently supporting only US Voltage standard. Backers from European and International countries are responsible in ensuring the hardware works with the voltage standard of their countries.
  9. What is the cost of international shipping? This would be dependent on the destination country and the total weight of your perks. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Lastly, we appreciate any non-monetary support through the word of mouth of our project! You can easily spread the word with the Indiegogo share tools.

 

Visit us @ http://www.glo3d.net for more information.

story:
I have been a photographer for many years taking pictures of some of the world’s most beautiful women. I like to be very inclusive in my work. I see beauty in all women, no matter what their size, ethnicity, social standing or physical or emotional scars.

My passion and service to the world is to highlight all beauty. Sometimes when breast cancer strikes a woman’s life, it can turn her world upside down. Her self-worth and self-image can be shattered. I want to be a positive factor in their lives to reinforce that they are beautiful despite the physical challenges or deformities that may have altered their bodies from the consequences of having breast cancer.

It is my deep desire and quest to offer my photography services for free to women with breast cancer all over the country and beyond. I want to highlight their wholeness by capturing an artistic picture of them to remind them that they are still indeed beautiful. This is an offering of healing through art.

I am here  to seek donations to enable me to set out on this journey. If this resonates with your values and views to give women this boost of self-esteem via this artistic medium, I will be grateful for you donations to this cause. Together, we can bring some semblance of happiness and wellbeing to the lives of women who are conquering breast cancer.

Thank you for your attention.

“Be the change you wish to see in the world.” ~ Mahatma Ghandi
